title: Senior Data Engineer in ESG
description:
ING’s goal is to enable people to “do their thing” and empower them to stay a step ahead in life and business. We are one of the largest banks in Europe and we continuously evolve to become one of the most innovative companies in the banking sector.

**The Team**


ING Analytics is a major driving force in ING’s transformation, aimed at helping us to become a data-driven digital leader and creating tangible value for ING and its customers through world-class analytics models, products, and services.


The Analytics Engineering team is a team of 50+ engineers (and growing rapidly) that has the mission to enable this transformation. We do this by combining Big Data technology with Data Science to deliver high-value solutions and products for our organization. We work in a fun and creative environment, and we’re dedicated to bringing out the best in both each other and our projects.

 **Roles and Responsibilities**


You will work as an engineer on our Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) project within the ING Analytics Wholesale Bank Tribe. The project aims to give insight into our alignment with the NetZero 2050 climate promise, our exposure to human rights violations and help ING in the transition to a sustainable finance portfolio.

  

Your passion is to work with the latest and greatest technologies in the field of Data Engineering. You will work as an engineer and will design and build the data pipelines that support the ESG initiative and collaborate with data analysts, data scientists and UX designers to create the best user experience for our customers. The product is new in ING, you will be working in a more “start-up” mindset, and it is one of the most strategic topics at this stage in ING. Data accuracy is key to sustain our credibility.

 **How to succeed**

 **Must have:**

* Hands-on experience building complex data pipelines
* Knowledge of data manipulation and transformation
* Experience with Apache Airflow, Spark, Python
* Knowledge of software engineering best practices
* Deployment and provisioning automation tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD)
**Nice to have:**

* Hands-on experience managing and further developing distributed systems and clusters for both batch as well as streaming data (S3/Spark and/or Kafka/Flink)
* Experience in setting up both SQL as well as noSQL databases
* Experience with monitoring and observability (ELK stack)
* Bash scripting and Linux systems
* Security, authentication and authorisation (LDAP / Kerberos / PAM)
* Experience working in cloud environment (e.g. GCP)
* System design and architecture
* Knowledge of MLOps architecture and practices
* Affinity with ESG domain and data sources
 **Rewards and benefits**  

We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues

**About us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Data Engineering Associate
description:
We are looking for a Data professional to join our Data Engineering team. As a Data Engineer Associate, you are responsible for turning our clients’ business a more data-driven one, where data is used to drive action in every team, every day.

**What we offer:**
------------------

* Interact with senior stakeholders at our clients on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
* Working with Data Scientists to take data throughout its lifecycle - acquisition, exploration, data cleaning, integration, analysis, interpretation, and visualization.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.  
* 

  

**Who we are:**
---------------

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.


With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.


We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.  



  

**What you will do:**
---------------------


* Engineer complete technical solutions to solve concrete business challenges in the areas of digital marketing, e-commerce, Business Intelligence, and self-service analytics.
* Collect functional and non-functional requirements, consider technical environments, business constraints, and enterprise organizations.
* Support our clients in executing their Big Data strategies by designing and building operational data platforms: ETL pipelines, data anonymization pipelines, data lakes, near real-time streaming data hubs, web services, training and scoring machine learning models.
* Collaborate closely with partners, strategy consultants, and data scientists in a flat and agile organization where personal initiative is highly valued.
* Share data engineering knowledge by giving technical training.
* Guide and mentor team members.

  



**What you will bring:**
------------------------


* 3-5 years of experience in data analytics.
* Understanding of data warehousing principles, concepts and best practices (e.g. ODS, data marts, data lakes, data vault, 3NF).
* Advanced SQL, data transformation and data profiling skills.
* Experience of building production ETL/ELT pipelines at scale.
* 1-2 years of hands on experience with Azure, GCP or AWS, Data factory, Databricks, Synapse (DWH), Azure Functions, App logic and other data analytics services, including streaming.
* Experience with Airflow and Kubernetes.
* Programming languages: Python (PySpark), scripting languages like Bash.
* Knowledge of Git, CI/CD operations and Docker.
* Basic knowledge of PowerBI is a plus.
* True engineering craftsmanship mindset.
* Passionate about continuous improvement and working collaboratively.
* Strong problem-solving skills, coupled with the ability to convey designs and ideas to a wider audience.
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics, Business or other related technical disciplines (Master's Degree is a plus).



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

title: Marketing Analyst
description:
At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat forever by offering our customers high-quality food and recipes for different meal occasions. Over the past 10 years, we've seen this mission spread around the world and beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are a global food solutions group and the world's leading meal kit company, active in 18 countries across 3 continents. So, how did we do it? Our weekly boxes full of exciting recipes and fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of customers looking for delicious, healthy, and sustainable options. The HelloFresh Group now includes our core brand, HelloFresh, as well as: Green Chef, EveryPlate, Chefs Plate, Factor\_, and Youfoodz.
HelloFresh has been recognized as the #7 Best Place to Work in the list of Multinationals 2023 by Great Place to Work Netherlands! Check out our amazing team and office here and learn more on our socials On LinkedIn and Instagram! Ready to join our team?



 This is how you’ll change the way people eat forever  

  

We are looking for a [Marketing Analyst] for our ambitious Marketing Analytics team where you’ll take a role in advising our marketing teams with key insights through data analysis on multiple levels (customers, campaigns, channels, brands) focusing on key areas for the company (Growth, Reactivation, Incrementality, Discounts). You will be in charge of data collection, treatment, analysis, presenting data and turning them into actionable recommendations to a large variety of teams and stakeholders within the company.



 This is how you’ll make an impact


* Provide cracking insights into customer acquisition and reactivation, looking for improvement opportunities to optimize marketing campaigns, channel targeting, efficiency, etc.
* Work closely with stakeholders from our Growth channels and other (Marketing) teams, and translate their business questions into structured and meaningful analytics - combining business and technical understanding
* Run in-depth analyses, create dashboards and reports, organize and evaluate AB tests, provide ad-hoc insights, etc.
* Carry out complex in-depth analyses to understand the impact of (e.g.) our price & discount set-up on customer dynamics and economics (conversion, retention, profit contribution, …) and identify and validate opportunities to improve
* Use various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
* Discuss the results of your work with stakeholders of various seniority, including the domain leads of our Marketing teams
* Take responsibility of own projects, but also collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts
* Support our recently launched and strongly growing brand Green Chef
* Contribute to the broader HelloFresh Benelux’ Analytics capabilities through knowledge sharing and training


 These are the ingredients you’ll bring to the team


* At least 3+ years experience in a similar role, driving business impact based on Data and Analytics. Experience with marketing metrics and/or in a consumer-facing business is a plus. E.g. in a fast-growing start-up / scale-up, consulting company or a data-driven corporate
* A quantitative and analytical mindset and skillset. More specifically, you have strong SQL skills. You have experience with statistical analyses (e.g. regression modeling, AB testing). You also have experience in visualization tools(e.g. Tableau, Looker, Google Studio).
* Experience with other programming languages such as Python and R is a plus.
* Strong business sense: ability to build a “bridge” between business needs and your analysis (problem & analysis structuring), and between your analysis result and business implications (recommendation definition, data visualization, storylining)
* You don’t shy away from a challenge and have a hands-on can-do attitude. You can work independently. You communicate clearly and are able to perform in a fast-paced and continuously changing work environment, interacting and creating support with a variety of local and Global stakeholders.


 This is our recipe


* Freedom to initiate, execute and implement your own ideas
* The opportunity to engage and collaborate with our colleagues across the globe
* Participation in the HelloFresh Benelux Business Analytics L&D community, where you will develop yourself through training (hard skills & problem solving), support and knowledge sharing with other analysts
* Other learning and development opportunities including a personal development budget
* 24 holidays per year, plus 1 day per additional year of work
* A hybrid work setup, with a budget to help set up your home office
* Flexibility to work abroad
* Reimbursement of travel expenses to the office
* A discount on your weekly HelloFresh and/or Green Chef box
* Our FreshEnergy program including bootcamp, yoga, boxing, Headspace subscription, a collaboration with OpenUp for your mental wellbeing, webinars and other events
* Multiple ways of getting to a work-related appointment, for example by using our company cars or a MyWheels car
* Discount on your ClassPass subscription, and a discount for your gym membership via High Five Fitness Network.
* Discount on your additional health insurance through Zilveren Kruis
* Healthy lunches, fruit and snacks in the office
* Monthly pension scheme


 Grow your career at HelloFresh



A career at HelloFresh is an opportunity to make an impact in a world-leading meal-kit company. Through our Learning Never Stops core value, we empower you to take your career development to your highest potential…but we don’t just want to say it, we want to show it too.



Check out some amazing growth stories here:


* Joran van der Hel’s journey from driver to Ground Operations Manager
* Valerie Blank’s journey from Junior Sampling Coordinator to Team Lead of Product Marketing


 Hungry for more?


* Apply with your CV and a strong motivation to join us (In English please)
* If we see a match, you’ll have a video call with one of our recruiters to share more about what you can bring to the team.
* Are both sides still positive? Then we proceed to the assessment stage to assess key skills required for the job.
* Next up is an in-person interview (if possible) with the hiring team to get to know you better and dive into more detail of your skills and how you are going to make an impact.
* Lastly you’ll have a conversation with people from our Associate Director Strategy & Analytics BLX



About HelloFresh  

We believe that sharing a meal brings people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures together. We are committed to celebrating all dimensions of diversity in the workplace equally and ensuring that everyone feels a sense of inclusion and belonging. We also aim to extend this commitment to the partners we work with and the communities we serve. We are constantly listening, learning, and evolving to deliver on these principles. We are proud of our collaborative culture. Our diverse employee population enables us to connect with our customers and turn their feedback into meaningful action - from developing new recipes to constantly improving our process of getting dinner to our customers’ homes. Our culture attracts top talent with shared values and forms the foundation for a great place to work!  

  

At HelloFresh, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We are an equal-opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of an individual's race, national origin, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, marital status, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law, whether actual or perceived. As part of the Company’s commitment to equal employment opportunity, we provide reasonable accommodations, up to the point of undue hardship, to candidates at any stage, including to individuals with disabilities.  

  

We want to adapt our processes and create a safe space that welcomes everyone so please let us know how we can accommodate our process. In case you have any accessibility requirements you can share that with us in the application form.  

  

To learn more about what it's like working inside HelloFresh, follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn.  

  

*HelloFresh is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and providing reasonable accommodations to candidates with disabilities. If you need an accommodation during the application process, please reach out to us at:*  

* *Europe:**EUaccommodations@hellofresh.com**.*
* *APAC:* *APACaccommodations@hellofresh.com*
* *United States:* *USCandidateAccommodations@**hellofresh.com*
* *Canada:**CAaccommodations@hellofresh.com*
company_description: HelloFresh is a global food solutions group and the world's leading meal kit delivery company, active in 17 countries across 3 continents. Our kits include fresh ingredients and cooking instructions.

title: Python Developer
description:
**The client**



ABN AMRO is a leading Dutch bank dedicated to providing clients with sustainable solutions to achieve their financial goals. Our commitment to innovation, customer-centric services, and sustainability keeps us at the forefront of the banking industry.


**The department**



The Asset Liability Management (ALM) department is pivotal to ABN AMRO, managing the bank’s balance sheet in terms of interest rate, liquidity, and capital risks. Positioned at the core of the bank, ALM collaborates with key stakeholders, including board members and regulatory authorities like DNB and ECB. We operate in a dynamic Agile DevOps environment that promotes continuous improvement and innovation.

**Job Description:**



We are seeking a Python Developer with extensive data engineering experience. This role focuses on developing testable Python modules for Databricks notebooks, optimizing ETL processes, and automating operational tasks. The successful candidate will work closely with stakeholders to implement impactful solutions and drive technological enhancements.


***Responsibilities***


* Develop and maintain testable Python modules for Databricks notebooks.
* Design, implement, and optimize ETL processes.
* Enhance test automation and implement a 'shift-left' testing approach.
* Manage Azure infrastructure deployment and maintenance.
* Build and optimize CI/CD pipelines.
* Automate operational processes.
* Analyze data to assess process changes.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams.
* Resolve incidents and support continuous improvement.

**Ideal Candidate Characteristics**


* Proficient in Python and object-oriented programming.
* Experienced with Databricks, Azure Data Factory, and cloud technologies.
* Skilled in ETL best practices and data engineering methodologies.
* Familiar with data integration and orchestration tools (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Apache Airflow).
* Proficient in SQL and relational databases.
* Experienced in CI/CD pipelines, particularly with Azure DevOps and YAML.
* Knowledgeable in version control systems like Git.
* Strong in automated unit, integration, and regression testing.
* Analytical with an interest in Finance & Risk domains.
* Excellent English communication skills.
* Collaborative with a coaching mindset.
* Proactive problem-solver with leadership skills.
* Strong organizational skills focused on timeliness and completeness.
* Knowledge of Power BI for data visualization.
* Proficient in scripting languages like PowerShell.

*What we offer**:*


* initial 11-month-assigment with extension possibility
* 36 hour work week
* hybrid working
* transit and/or working from home allowance
* internet allowance
* € 5.331,00 - € 6.500,00 gross per month (depending on experience)
* Bandwidth for a contractor (ZZP or payroll): €66 - €76 gross per hour, excl. VAT.
* holiday payment (8,33% on your gross annual *income)*
* 25 paid holiday days (based on 40-hour week)
* full pension contribution

title: Junior Business Data Analyst
description:
### **About Skinvision**



Join SkinVision, a trailblazing company transforming skin cancer detection and prevention. Skin Cancer cases are growing at an alarming rate globally. In fact, 1 in 5 people will get skin cancer, but only 3% of the high risk population is known by the health authorities. At SkinVision, we are on a mission to save the lives of 250,000 people in the next ten years by revolutionizing the way we care about our skin. Our technology allows users to take ownership of their health, recognizing signs of skin cancer from anywhere, at any time by combining the recommendations of AI and dermatologists.


### **Business Data Analyst at SkinVision**



We're on the lookout for a Business Data Analyst with excellent skills and experience to gain relevant insights into our business data, which is a vital asset to our core business stakeholders. The ideal candidate will possess a strong expertise in data analysis and visualization, with hands-on experience in SQL, Python/R, Git and visualization tools such as Looker/Tableau, along with a great business understanding and ability to manage stakeholders. Knowledge of the Cloud (AWS), data orchestration tools (Apache Airflow) and dbt are a plus!


### **Responsibilities**


* Partner with stakeholders to comprehend business requirements and translate them into actionable data analysis and reporting solutions.
* Utilize advanced data visualization tools to create visually compelling and interactive dashboards, visualizations and reports for stakeholders throughout the organization.
* Perform deep-dive analysis on large and intricate data sets, unearthing patterns, trends and actionable insights that drive strategic business decisions and optimizations.
* Collaborate closely with product & marketing teams to identify key performance metrics and implement comprehensive tracking mechanisms for robust product analytics.
* Execute data cleansing, manipulation and transformation techniques to ensure high-quality, reliable data for analysis.
* Design and implement scalable data models and schemas that facilitate efficient data analysis and reporting leveraging data visualization tools (e.g., Looker or equivalent).
* Stay abreast of the latest industry standards, best practices, and emerging trends in data analysis and product analytics, and share insights with the broader team.

### **Education and experience**


* 1-2 years of proven professional experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, showcasing exceptional proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Looker or equivalent), product analytics, data insights gathering and ETL pipelines.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science , Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.


### **Skills**


* Mastery of data visualization tools or platforms, enabling the creation of sophisticated visualizations, dashboards and reports that effectively communicate complex insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Proficiency in SQL and python for data retrieving and manipulation.
* Strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem-solving skills, and the ability to extract actionable insights from intricate datasets.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the capacity to effectively convey technical concepts to diverse audiences.
* Proven ability to thrive in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment, managing multiple priorities and deadlines.


### **What we offer you**


* 3 office days per week with a healthy lunch and 2 days of working from home.
* A competitive salary based on your experience.
* Join our enthusiastic and professional team with colleagues from all over the world.
* A dynamic and rapidly growing start-up in Amsterdam.
* Unlimited skin checks for you.
* Regular team events such as weekly drinks and monthly dinners.

#### **Not sure if you are qualified?**



Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women tend to only apply when they check every box. If you feel energized by our mission and would like to use your first-class talent to accelerate the growth of SkinVision but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still apply. We'd love to receive your application and see if you could be a good fit.



JD - Junior Business Data Analyst.pdf

title: Data Engineering Associate
description:
We are looking for a Data professional to join our Data Engineering team. As a Data Engineer Associate, you are responsible for turning our clients’ business a more data-driven one, where data is used to drive action in every team, every day.

**What we offer:**
------------------

* Interact with senior stakeholders at our clients on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
* Working with Data Scientists to take data throughout its lifecycle - acquisition, exploration, data cleaning, integration, analysis, interpretation, and visualization.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.  
* 

  

**Who we are:**
---------------

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.


With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.


We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.  



  

**What you will do:**
---------------------


* Engineer complete technical solutions to solve concrete business challenges in the areas of digital marketing, e-commerce, Business Intelligence, and self-service analytics.
* Collect functional and non-functional requirements, consider technical environments, business constraints, and enterprise organizations.
* Support our clients in executing their Big Data strategies by designing and building operational data platforms: ETL pipelines, data anonymization pipelines, data lakes, near real-time streaming data hubs, web services, training and scoring machine learning models.
* Collaborate closely with partners, strategy consultants, and data scientists in a flat and agile organization where personal initiative is highly valued.
* Share data engineering knowledge by giving technical training.
* Guide and mentor team members.

  



**What you will bring:**
------------------------


* 3-5 years of experience in data analytics.
* Understanding of data warehousing principles, concepts and best practices (e.g. ODS, data marts, data lakes, data vault, 3NF).
* Advanced SQL, data transformation and data profiling skills.
* Experience of building production ETL/ELT pipelines at scale.
* 1-2 years of hands on experience with Azure, GCP or AWS, Data factory, Databricks, Synapse (DWH), Azure Functions, App logic and other data analytics services, including streaming.
* Experience with Airflow and Kubernetes.
* Programming languages: Python (PySpark), scripting languages like Bash.
* Knowledge of Git, CI/CD operations and Docker.
* Basic knowledge of PowerBI is a plus.
* True engineering craftsmanship mindset.
* Passionate about continuous improvement and working collaboratively.
* Strong problem-solving skills, coupled with the ability to convey designs and ideas to a wider audience.
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics, Business or other related technical disciplines (Master's Degree is a plus).



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

title: Corporate Audit Data Scientist (m/f/d)
description:
**Become our next FutureStarter**
---------------------------------


Are you ready to make an impact? ZF is looking for talented individuals to join our team. As a FutureStarter, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of mobility. Join us and be part of something extraordinary!


**Corporate Audit Data Scientist (m/f/d)**
==========================================

Country/Region: NL
Location:
Amsterdam, NL, 1043 GR
Req ID 68937 Amsterdam, Netherlands  



**About the team:**  

We are looking for a highly motivated Data Scientist to join our multicultural Corporate Audit Data Analytics team. As a Data Scientist, you will be guiding our data analytics development and promoting best practices. You will mentor and support the Audit teams, oversee integrations with internal and external systems and applications, and provide technical/methodology guidance. In this role you will be making recommendations and providing input regarding integrating additional data analytics services, and designing and building solutions for Audit department needs.

  


**What you can look forward to as Corporate Audit Data Scientist (m/f/d):**


* Automation of data collection, data consolidation and data transformation processes, gather and analyze Corporate Audit department needs, obtain necessary accesses to acquire data and work with internal partners to design process enhancements through reports, dashboards, workflows/alerts (i.e., continuous auditing).
* Preparation and performance of data analysis to identify risks and related audit fields, gather, transform, and provide high-quality data e.g., for dashboards and periodic reports.
* Data preparation, modelling, visualization, and service to support risk-oriented audit planning and execution, communication with, and comprehensive support of, the global Audit teams data analytics requests (i.e., interpret and refine the results of the analytics provided).
* Continuous improvement of existing data analytics processes, tools e.g., Azure, Power BI, Excel, etc. and the portfolio of data analytics test procedures, and development of reports, dashboards, and key audit indicators.
* Coordination with data and process owners and IT for performance of individual and ad-hoc requested analysis, work in cross functional internal/external teams on data analytics to improve our Standards & Processes.
* The position also offers the opportunity to participate in an international audit.

  




**Your profile as Corporate Audit Data Scientist (m/f/d):**


* University degree in computer science, data science, finance, economy or similar.
* Experience in data management or data analytics/data visualization, ability to analyze and document complex data metrics, open to explore novel approaches for problem-solving through the use of Machine Learning, AI, and automation.
* Firm understanding of data sources/bases/structure and ERP systems.
* Outstanding knowledge in Excel (including pivot tables, pivot charts), Experience with Power BI, Azure tools, Knowledge of SQL, VBA, or any other programming language (e.g., Python).
* Experience in internal auditing would be an advantage.
* Effective written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to explain data and observations to a non-technical audience in English language.

  




**Why you should choose ZF in Amsterdam?**


* Home Office option
* Vacation pay included in the annual base salary
* Pension plan
* Commuting allowance
* Collective health insurance
* 25 vacation days + 3 additional office closure days

  


Be part of our ZF team as Corporate Audit Data Scientist (m/f/d) and apply now!


Contact


Janin Oppermann


+49 211 584 2166


**What does DEI (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion) mean for ZF as a company?**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------


At ZF, we continuously strive to build and maintain a culture where inclusiveness is lived and diversity is valued. We actively seek ways to remove barriers so that all our employees can rise to their full potential. We aim to embed this vision in our legacy through how we operate and build our products as we shape the future of mobility.


Find out how we work at ZF:

  

  

**Job Segment:** Computer Science, ERP, Network, SQL, Database, Technology

title: Risk Specialist Stress Testing
description:
Risk Specialist Stress Testing**At a glance**
---------------


Do you get excited about stakeholder management in a complex environment? Do you want to work at the heart of Risk Management and are you interested in the strategy of the bank? You don’t have to choose! At Central Risk Management you will help define bank-wide enterprise risk management with a direct link to the overall strategy using your stakeholder management skills.  

Central Risk Management enables the stakeholders to be in control. Through our expertise, knowledge, integrated view and ability to pro-actively connect, we deliver on a stronger company and support well informed decision making.  

Currently we are looking for an Risk Specialist Stress Testing to join our team. Someone who can connect the dots and who is able to translate the main opportunities and challenges into an advice towards Senior Management. By doing so, you generate impact for the bank! If this sounds like you as a person in combination with your competences, then please contact us!

**Your job**
------------


Stress Testing Domain (including Stress Testing and Scenario Analysis) is an essential part of risk management. As a forward looking risk management tool, it is essential for our capital and financial planning process. In the ERM cycle, it also feeds Risk Appetite and strategic planning, both on bank and portfolio level. Main recurring deliverables are the European Banking Authority (EBA) stress test and the stress test as foundation of the Internal Capital Adequacy Assessment Process (ICAAP). With external and internal requirements changing rapidly, it is important to maintain a clear view of the deliverables, and work with many internal stakeholders to foster continuous improvements.  

Upcoming challenges are related to the redevelopment of Stress testing models, and integration of Climate and Environmental Risk in the stress testing framework. The results of stress tests are communicated to the main Risk committees within the bank, including the Scenario & Stress Test committee, the Group Risk Committee and the Executive Board.

**Working environment**
-----------------------


The ERM Network within Central Risk Management consists of a group of around 75 professionals that are involved with maintaining the strategic risk profile of the bank.  

You will be working with an energetic group of people who share the same drive and vision. Our unique selling point is the diversity of topics and of our colleagues, who come from a background in Risk, Finance, Business or Consultancy and with multiple nationalities. We are always available to help each other. Furthermore, we make time for non-work related activities.  

At CRM we give the possibility to work hybrid. We have at least one fixed day in the week were the team comes together at the Gustav Mahlerlaan. We have structural quarterly CRM meetings and we also enjoy “borrels” (drinks), attending (content relevant) events and departmental outings.

**Your profile**
----------------


You are a team player who is eager to learn and strives for quality. You are able to liaise with different departments and different management levels within the bank and able to analyse and understand complex topics and can communicate the main points clearly. You are able to switch from a bird’s eye view to your eye for details, and you know when and how to ask for more information. Additionally, you have a good sense of humor.  

  

Check your profile:

* University degree with 3-5 years of work experience
* Knowledge of risk regulatory framework (e.g. CRR/CRD, EBA Guidelines on Institutions’ Stress Testing, etc)
* Affinity with ESG topics in the context of the financial institutions context
* Knowledge of a programming language like SAS (preferred), SQL, Python, R
* Knowledge of model use, governance, implementation, data collection is a plus
* You are entrepreneurial, proactive, thorough and you have a practical mindset
* You are flexible and able to work with deadlines
**We are offering**
-------------------


A challenging environment where there is a good work-life balance. We offer you the opportunity to develop yourself on hard as well as soft skills. You will have space for entrepreneurship and it is possible to receive responsibilities quickly. There are good opportunities for career growth. Over time you can develop towards a more advising/coordinating role or towards a specialist.

  

We also offer you:

* The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
* The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
* Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* An excellent pension scheme.
**Interested?**
---------------


If you are interested and want to know more about this vacancy, please contact Egon Grinwis (egon.grinwis@nl.abnamro.com) or Oana Milak (oana.milak@nl.abnamro.com). We very much look forward meeting you!

### **Wij vragen**

* Samenwerkingsgerichtheid

### **Wij bieden**

* Analytische skills
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Senior HFT Quant Trader/Researcher - Digital Assets
description:
Keyrock was founded in 2017 and has quickly grown from 3 to over 170 people today. As an industry recognized liquidity provider and market maker, Keyrock is a leading European creator of algorithmic trading technologies in the digital asset space. With VC backing including Series B investment from Ripple, a constantly expanding global client base, Keyrock is one of Belgium’s fastest-growing fintech companies.


We’re currently active on over 80 exchanges and count numerous marketplaces and asset issuers among our clients, including some of the best-known companies in the digital assets space.


Keyrock's beating heart is its technical team filled with crypto and DeFi natives, software engineers, digital scientists and academics, who themselves are supported by university professors, industry-leading experts and a strong management team. Over the years Keyrock has become a company that is both idealistic and practical.

**What we are looking for**… a dynamic, driven **Senior HFT Quantitative Trader/Researcher** to work in collaboration with our engineers, data scientists and quantitative traders. We are currently looking for people with experience developing and running systematic strategies in the HFT space.


The ideal candidate will be able to analyze existing trading strategies and identify areas of improvement. They will also be able to develop their own trading strategies and take them from hypothesis to production. The candidate must have a strong mathematical background. They must have a good understanding of the engineering problems faced by an HFT business and be able to collaborate with senior developers in overcoming these challenges.


If the candidate has run systematic strategies in the HFT space they should be able to demonstrate the performance of the strategies.

 **Job Description**

* Building models to create new trading strategies
* Structuring and implementing algorithmic trading strategies
* Backtesting algorithmic trading strategies
* Software development and implementation
* Monitoring market performance
* Market analysis

**Competencies, skills and experience**


As a quantitative trading researcher, you have strong analytical capabilities and are fully comfortable with financial markets and trading algorithms in order books. You have:

* Understanding of digital assets.
* Understanding of financial market micro structures.
* Strong attention to detail
* Good communicator
* Programming skills in Python
* Prior experience in building or researching trading algorithms
* A background or substantial experience in a STEM subject.
* Passion for algorithmic trading
* Prior knowledge of market making algorithms is a plus
* The ability to take ownership of a project while collaborating on it with colleagues
* Fluent in English
* Nice to have: Stochastic Calculus, dynamic programming
* Nice to have (tech): RUST, AWS, R

**Our philosophy**  

  

We believe the most important aspect of our recruitment process is self-awareness: we are looking for people who have a clear understanding of themselves and what they are looking for in their professional career. That means that we expect to work with people who not only have the right skills, but who have also made the conscious decision to look for a company in our industry and with our characteristics.

 **Our offer**

* A competitive salary package
* Complete autonomy in your time management thanks to flexible working hours and the opportunity to work remotely
* The freedom to create your own entrepreneurial experience by being part of a team of people in search of excellence who all receive stock options from the first year
* A ton of fun in a thriving and multicultural environment, with colleagues enjoying regular team building activities

title: Research Leader - Crime and Justice - Netherlands
description:
RAND is an independent not-for-profit research institute, whose mission is to help improve public policy- and decision-making through objective research and analysis. Part of the RAND Corporation, RAND Europe has over 30 years of experience in conducting client-funded policy research for governments, international organisations, research councils, charitable foundations, and other organisations. Our mission is to help improve public policy and decision making through evidence-based research and analysis. RAND Europe has offices in Cambridge, Brussels, and the Netherlands, and employs approximately 170 staff: just over half of our research staff have doctorates with the balance holding other post-graduate degrees.
 

The Home Affairs and Social Policy Research Group undertakes contract research and analysis in a range of public policy areas. At present in our Netherlands office we are looking to add a Research Leader to our Crime and Justice portfolio. This includes Crime and justice as a whole (including responses to offending, international law enforcement cooperation, organised crime and illicit markets).


Our recent work in the Netherlands includes studies for the House of Representatives, the Research and Documentation Centre (WODC), the Ministry of Justice and Security, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the National Coordinator for Counterterrorism and Security and various charitable foundations.


As a group, our Home Affairs and Social Policy team also work on:


Education (including early childhood education and care, school effectiveness) & Employment and social policy (including skills, employability, migration, gender equality, child, and family policy);


We collaborate widely with like-minded academic and other organisations across Europe and with colleagues based in RAND’s U.S. offices. We employ robust methods and offer multi-disciplinary perspectives.


Due to a growing portfolio of research projects with Dutch clients, RAND Europe has recently established an office in the Netherlands. As part of its strategy to grow our work in the Netherlands, RAND Europe is looking for an experienced researcher and project leader with a research background in **organised crime, illicit markets, criminal justice, policing, discrimination, migration and/or related fields.**


This is an exciting opportunity to work with a truly multidisciplinary team in one of the world’s most respected public policy research organisations.
 

The successful candidate will thrive on teamwork and collaboration with colleagues and research funders, take an active role in project management, and be keen to grow a body of work through active business development and proposal writing.


The role is ideally suited to an individual who is committed to applying a mixed methods approach to drive impact in policy and decision-making. Demonstrable experience of working on multiple projects in parallel and communicating with decision-makers in government, industry, academia, and wider policy communities is highly desirable.


### **Key responsibilities**


Your primary role will be to design, manage, and lead research and analysis on complex policy questions on behalf of our clients. You will work as part of our wider research team to ensure that projects are delivered on time, on budget and to the highest quality standards.


Specifically, the Research Leader role will involve:

* Undertaking qualitative (interviews, literature reviews, focus groups) and/or quantitative analysis (regressions, MLMs, DiD) with minimal supervision.
* Contributing to studies including research design, selection of appropriate analytical approaches, undertaking data collection and reporting findings.
* Identifying business development opportunities and acting on them with senior support.
* Managing projects with minimal supervision to deliver high quality work within available time and resources. (Desirable)
* Ad hoc duties as required

**Requirements**

**Management – essential**

* Experience managing research projects in professional services or public sector domains.
* Track record of undertaking research for policy and/or practitioner audiences.

**Commercial awareness – essential**

* Experience drafting and leading proposals that secure research funding in competitive environments.
* Experience of effectively managing small to medium-sized project budgets.

**Personal skills and experience – essential**

* Excellent problem-solving skills.
* Ability to multi-task and prioritise work.
* Ability to work flexibly and to deadlines.
* Ability to effectively process large amounts of information, translate and presenting complex research findings to policy, practice, and lay audiences.

**Thematic expertise - essential**

* Direct or indirect expertise in at least one of the following thematic areas: organised crime, illicit markets, criminal justice, policing, discrimination, migration
* Agility to work across other topic areas within the portfolio of the Home Affairs and Social Policy research group.

**Fluency in English – essential**

**Fluency in Dutch - essential**

**IT skills**

* Intermediate Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

**Desirable Experience**

* Familiarity and experience of working with WODC, Nationale Politie and other clients in the Netherlands in the crime and justice space.
* Familiarity and experience with international research funders, including the EU
* Tangible experience in policy research
* PhD qualified
* Expert use of statistical software packages (e.g., STATA, R, SAS) and relevant programming languages (e.g., Python).
* Experience with (quasi-)experimental evaluation designs

**Benefits**

* Pension - 9% employer contribution;
* 24 days holiday per annum + public holidays;
* Holiday pay (monthly);
* Annual salary review;
* Sick pay; (70% pay for sickness absence up to 104 weeks)
* Compassionate leave;
* Paid travel expenses;
* Home office expenses (if required) and home working allowance €2 per day;
* Flexible working hours;
* Learning and development opportunities;
* Employee wellbeing training;
* Service awards.

### **How to Apply**


If you believe you are suited to the above role, please submit an application comprising of a CV and covering letter.


If you have not been contacted within 30 days of application deadline, please assume your application has not been successful.

title: Senior Scientist - Uber Rides and Eats
description:
**About the Role**  

  

Our mission is create the best platform for our drivers. We are focusing on building a personalized experience that empowers earners to earn and progress effectively at Uber. We are looking for an experienced candidate who has the ability to break complex problems down into executable parts for testing, and is eager to take on new challenges.
  

  

**What you will need*** Propose, design, and analyze large scale online experiments
* Define and implement metrics to measure product performance
* Present findings to business and executive audiences
* Collaborate with engineers and product managers to implement ideas and plan future roadmaps
* Advanced understanding of statistics, causal inference, and machine learning
* 5+ years of industry experience as an Applied Scientist or equivalent
* Experience working with large scale data sets using technologies like Hive, Presto, and Spark

**Basic Qualifications*** Ph.D., MS or Bachelors degree in Economics, Operations Research, Statistics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field
* If Ph.D or M.S. degree, a minimum of 2+ years of industry experience as an Applied Scientist or equivalent
* Knowledge of underlying mathematical foundations of machine learning, statistics, optimization, economics, and analytics
* Knowledge of experimental design and analysis
* Experience with exploratory data analysis, statistical analysis and testing, and model development
* Ability to use a language like Python or R to work efficiently at scale with large data sets
* Proficiency in technologies in one or more of the following: SQL, Spark, Hadoop

title: Marketing Analyst
description:
At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat forever by offering our customers high-quality food and recipes for different meal occasions. Over the past 10 years, we've seen this mission spread around the world and beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are a global food solutions group and the world's leading meal kit company, active in 18 countries across 3 continents. So, how did we do it? Our weekly boxes full of exciting recipes and fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of customers looking for delicious, healthy, and sustainable options. The HelloFresh Group now includes our core brand, HelloFresh, as well as: Green Chef, EveryPlate, Chefs Plate, Factor\_, and Youfoodz.
HelloFresh has been recognized as the #7 Best Place to Work in the list of Multinationals 2023 by Great Place to Work Netherlands! Check out our amazing team and office here and learn more on our socials On LinkedIn and Instagram! Ready to join our team?



 This is how you’ll change the way people eat forever  

  

We are looking for a [Marketing Analyst] for our ambitious Marketing Analytics team where you’ll take a role in advising our marketing teams with key insights through data analysis on multiple levels (customers, campaigns, channels, brands) focusing on key areas for the company (Growth, Reactivation, Incrementality, Discounts). You will be in charge of data collection, treatment, analysis, presenting data and turning them into actionable recommendations to a large variety of teams and stakeholders within the company.



 This is how you’ll make an impact


* Provide cracking insights into customer acquisition and reactivation, looking for improvement opportunities to optimize marketing campaigns, channel targeting, efficiency, etc.
* Work closely with stakeholders from our Growth channels and other (Marketing) teams, and translate their business questions into structured and meaningful analytics - combining business and technical understanding
* Run in-depth analyses, create dashboards and reports, organize and evaluate AB tests, provide ad-hoc insights, etc.
* Carry out complex in-depth analyses to understand the impact of (e.g.) our price & discount set-up on customer dynamics and economics (conversion, retention, profit contribution, …) and identify and validate opportunities to improve
* Use various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
* Discuss the results of your work with stakeholders of various seniority, including the domain leads of our Marketing teams
* Take responsibility of own projects, but also collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts
* Support our recently launched and strongly growing brand Green Chef
* Contribute to the broader HelloFresh Benelux’ Analytics capabilities through knowledge sharing and training


 These are the ingredients you’ll bring to the team


* At least 3+ years experience in a similar role, driving business impact based on Data and Analytics. Experience with marketing metrics and/or in a consumer-facing business is a plus. E.g. in a fast-growing start-up / scale-up, consulting company or a data-driven corporate
* A quantitative and analytical mindset and skillset. More specifically, you have strong SQL skills. You have experience with statistical analyses (e.g. regression modeling, AB testing). You also have experience in visualization tools(e.g. Tableau, Looker, Google Studio).
* Experience with other programming languages such as Python and R is a plus.
* Strong business sense: ability to build a “bridge” between business needs and your analysis (problem & analysis structuring), and between your analysis result and business implications (recommendation definition, data visualization, storylining)
* You don’t shy away from a challenge and have a hands-on can-do attitude. You can work independently. You communicate clearly and are able to perform in a fast-paced and continuously changing work environment, interacting and creating support with a variety of local and Global stakeholders.


 This is our recipe


* Freedom to initiate, execute and implement your own ideas
* The opportunity to engage and collaborate with our colleagues across the globe
* Participation in the HelloFresh Benelux Business Analytics L&D community, where you will develop yourself through training (hard skills & problem solving), support and knowledge sharing with other analysts
* Other learning and development opportunities including a personal development budget
* 24 holidays per year, plus 1 day per additional year of work
* A hybrid work setup, with a budget to help set up your home office
* Flexibility to work abroad
* Reimbursement of travel expenses to the office
* A discount on your weekly HelloFresh and/or Green Chef box
* Our FreshEnergy program including bootcamp, yoga, boxing, Headspace subscription, a collaboration with OpenUp for your mental wellbeing, webinars and other events
* Multiple ways of getting to a work-related appointment, for example by using our company cars or a MyWheels car
* Discount on your ClassPass subscription, and a discount for your gym membership via High Five Fitness Network.
* Discount on your additional health insurance through Zilveren Kruis
* Healthy lunches, fruit and snacks in the office
* Monthly pension scheme


 Grow your career at HelloFresh



A career at HelloFresh is an opportunity to make an impact in a world-leading meal-kit company. Through our Learning Never Stops core value, we empower you to take your career development to your highest potential…but we don’t just want to say it, we want to show it too.



Check out some amazing growth stories here:


* Joran van der Hel’s journey from driver to Ground Operations Manager
* Valerie Blank’s journey from Junior Sampling Coordinator to Team Lead of Product Marketing


 Hungry for more?


* Apply with your CV and a strong motivation to join us (In English please)
* If we see a match, you’ll have a video call with one of our recruiters to share more about what you can bring to the team.
* Are both sides still positive? Then we proceed to the assessment stage to assess key skills required for the job.
* Next up is an in-person interview (if possible) with the hiring team to get to know you better and dive into more detail of your skills and how you are going to make an impact.
* Lastly you’ll have a conversation with people from our Associate Director Strategy & Analytics BLX



About HelloFresh  

We believe that sharing a meal brings people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures together. We are committed to celebrating all dimensions of diversity in the workplace equally and ensuring that everyone feels a sense of inclusion and belonging. We also aim to extend this commitment to the partners we work with and the communities we serve. We are constantly listening, learning, and evolving to deliver on these principles. We are proud of our collaborative culture. Our diverse employee population enables us to connect with our customers and turn their feedback into meaningful action - from developing new recipes to constantly improving our process of getting dinner to our customers’ homes. Our culture attracts top talent with shared values and forms the foundation for a great place to work!  

  

At HelloFresh, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We are an equal-opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of an individual's race, national origin, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, marital status, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law, whether actual or perceived. As part of the Company’s commitment to equal employment opportunity, we provide reasonable accommodations, up to the point of undue hardship, to candidates at any stage, including to individuals with disabilities.  

  

We want to adapt our processes and create a safe space that welcomes everyone so please let us know how we can accommodate our process. In case you have any accessibility requirements you can share that with us in the application form.  

  

To learn more about what it's like working inside HelloFresh, follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn.  

  

*HelloFresh is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and providing reasonable accommodations to candidates with disabilities. If you need an accommodation during the application process, please reach out to us at:*  

* *Europe:**EUaccommodations@hellofresh.com**.*
* *APAC:* *APACaccommodations@hellofresh.com*
* *United States:* *USCandidateAccommodations@**hellofresh.com*
* *Canada:**CAaccommodations@hellofresh.com*
company_description: HelloFresh is a global food solutions group and the world's leading meal kit delivery company, active in 17 countries across 3 continents. Our kits include fresh ingredients and cooking instructions.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**About HousingAnywhere**  

HousingAnywhere is Europe's largest mid-term rental platform. With Kamernet and Studapart under its umbrella, it represents three fast-growing brands with over 30 million yearly unique visitors combined, 160,000+ properties available for rent and 100,000+ tenants securing their new homes, based on the 2022 performance. HousingAnywhere serves young professionals and students, primarily aged between 18 and 35, connecting them with accommodation providers. Through its advanced technology platform, tenants rent accommodation for 3 to 12 months outside of their country of origin. Headquartered in Rotterdam, HousingAnywhere operates in most European cities and recently expanded to key cities in the US, establishing a presence in over 125 cities. Driven by the mission to enable people to live wherever and however they choose, thanks to a flexible renting experience, the technology scale-up employs 340 professionals globally.

  


**Our mission**  

Rent Easy, Live Free.



We are empowering people to live wherever and however they choose. To find comfort and peace of mind on the other side of the world or the other side of town. All while feeling confident and totally at ease, whatever their adventure might involve. We are doing it by creating a new standard of renting. Safe. Harmonious. More options. Less hassle. With the help of our trusted networks of landlords and partners.

  


**Our** **Values**


* Ownership
* We are Enablers
* We are Changemakers
* We are Connectors

  


**Your role & Impact**  

The purpose of this role is to empower commercial teams with insights and recommendations to grow our marketplace and get the most of our team.


* Collaborate closely with the commercial teams to translate business questions into analyses, synthesise insights and develop recommendations to drive business results.
* Define, develop and monitor the key metrics to measure operational performance and business outcomes, and identify drivers for changes in these metrics
* Ensure business questions are addressed in the most effective format (ad-hoc deep-dive, recurring analysis, dashboards, self-serving tools)
* Empower stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via dashboards and self-serving tools, in close collaboration with the Analytics Engineering and Business Intelligence teams.
* Develop dashboards and reports that support operational business processes.
* Support commercial team OKR planning and measurement.
* Identify and implement opportunities to enhance existing analytical processes and methodologies

  


**Your profile**


* 5+ years experience as a Data Analyst, Product Analyst, or equivalent role with a strong data/analytics component.
* Analytical mindset, combined with good business sense and orientation.
* A good communicator who can present insights and recommendations clearly and persuasively to different audiences
* Self-starter with strong project and time management skills.
* Proficient in SQL and Google Sheets, and experience with dash boarding tools (Tableau, Looker, Metabase, etc.)
* Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.) is a plus
* Previous experience in a high-growth, fast-paced tech company is a big plus.

  


**What's in it for you**


* Diverse international community (46+ nationalities).
* Hybrid working policy.
* Unlimited paid holidays, minimum-based not maximum.
* 1,000 EUR personal development budget.
* Complete coverage for commuting.
* Personal equipment, including laptop and ergonomic setup.
* Relocation support & 30% ruling application assistance.
* Gym membership discount with GoVital or OneFit.
* Variable pension scheme.
* Dutch/English classes budget.
* Fun team-building and after-work drinks every Friday.


*If you have further questions, please email* *y.kaboorappan@housinganywhere.com*


*By applying to work at HousingAnywhere, you agree to our* *Candidate Privacy Policy*
company_description: We have the mission to help with housing, anywhere. We want to build a safe, efficient and global rental marketplace for anyone looking for or renting out a place. We Care. We Perform. We Evolve.

title: Planning digital transformation Intern - Rookie Program 2024
description:
**Values & Innovation**
-----------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to empowering those who strive for more, and the company's values - Act Sustainably, Celebrate the Wins, Fight on Together, Love Athletes and Stand for Equality - serve as both a roadmap for our teams and the qualities expected of every teammate.

  

Our Values define and unite us, the beliefs that are the red thread that connects everyone at Under Armour. Our values are rallying cries, reminding us why we're here, and fueling everything we do.

  

Our pursuit of better begins with innovation and with our team's mission of being the best. With us, you get the freedom to go further - no matter your role. That means developing, delivering, and selling the state-of-the-art products and digital tools that make top performers even better.

  

If you are a current Under Armour teammate, apply to this position on the **Internal Career Site Here.**

**Purpose of Role**
-------------------


The scope of this project is to contribute in the digital transformation of the planning processes by supporting on the mapping of cross-functional processes. The successful candidate is expected to create and validate documentation (process maps, RACIs and others) that will later be used to drive process improvements.

**Your Impact**
---------------

* Conduct online and offline meetings to document cross functional tasks and processes (process maps, RACIs, others).
* (Optional) Assist guiding teammates in the validation and testing phase of new planning solutions by participating in data analysis and process improvement initiatives.
* (Optional) Aid in the configuration, setup, and day-to-day operational support of the new planning software, ensuring its effective use across teams.
**Qualifications**
------------------

* Currently pursuing a degree in digital transformation, project management or a related business field.
* A keen understanding of business processes including sales, inventory management, supply chain management.
* Understanding of programming languages such as R, Python or SQL is a plus.
* Knowledge of process maps and RACIs.
* Strong analytical skills, proficiency in Excel, and the ability to interpret data and provide actionable insights.
* Excellent presentation skills in PowerPoint and the ability to communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
* Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally and build strong relationships

  

#LI-KC1


#LI-Hybrid

**Benefits & Perks**
--------------------

* 750 euro gross monthly allowance
* Health and Wellness Benefits - free classpass membership
* Merchandising Discount
* Access to Under Armour's HPI (Gym).
* 38 hours workweek.
* And more!
**Our Commitment to Diversity**
-------------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, family or paternal status and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.
