title: Google Cloud Platform Engineer
description:
As a Cloud Engineer for the Google Cloud Platform team, you participate in shaping our global cloud transformation. You make a difference and impact by driving the adoption of Cloud Native Application Designs within Rabobank adhering to bank's security framework and contributing to long-term Engineering Platforms goals. You work with the DevOps teams, and your role involves developing, managing, and maintaining the resources in Google Cloud Platform. Additionally, you drive automation through CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure as Code.


Guiding the DevOps teams in secure application implementation, assisting their cloud journey, and sharing knowledge to boost team competence are also part of your responsibilities.


**How we work within our team**


Our team works in an Agile mindset, where innovation meets diversity in the realm of cloud technology. As part of the Area Engineering Platforms, we collaborate with other teams within the bank to enhance security and automation of the cloud infrastructure. Our goal is to deliver efficient, secure solutions and accelerate in delivering values for stakeholders. We are looking for an engineer who is not just technically proficient but also a perfect fit for our unique team culture.


**What your future colleagues from the team say:**


*“We get to experience the freedom to learn and innovate while contributing to the long-term goals of Engineering Platforms.”*


*“We love to celebrate Success and Failures.”*


*“We enjoy the team events that strengthen our team bonding.”*


*“We believe in collaboration and open Communication.”*


**What you bring to the table:**


*People and cultural skills and capabilities*


* Effective communication skills
* English proficiency in speech and writing
* Encourage the sharing of expertise and resources among engineers
* Eager to learn and adopt innovative technologies
* Agile and DevOps mindset
* Able to initiate and maintain cross-functional collaboration
* Team player and work towards a constructive conflict resolution
* Open to fostering transparent communication
* Simplify the use of cloud platforms, thus encouraging adoption across the organization
* Be able to convert complex, specialized tasks into easy-to-use format, such as code refactoring

*Expected Process, Technical skills, and capabilities*


* Minimum bachelor’s degree in a relevant direction (e.g. IT/CS)
* Minimum of 1 Google Professional certifications (example: DevOps Engineer, Security Engineer)
* Comprehensive understanding of Cloud technologies and Cloud design patterns with a focus on Google Cloud Platform.
* Proficiency with at least one or more programming/ scripting languages: Bash, Python
* Proficiency with one or more Infrastructure as Code tools: preferably Terraform
* Familiarity with CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery) configuration, usage, and maintainability.
* Knowledge and experience with Security process and Compliance
* Experience with Risk management and Incident Response, Handling and Processing
* Knowledge and experience with commonly used Google Services such as Identity and Access Management, Secret Manager, Cloud Storage, Cloud Function, Cloud Pub/sub
Skills to troubleshoot and fix issues in a running cloud application (preferred)  
* 

It is a plus if you also have:


* Knowledge of AI and Machine Learning,
* Other Google platform experience: Google Firebase, Google Play console, Google Analytics

**Interested?**


Are you our new colleague who wants to strengthen Rabobank as a Google Cloud Platform Engineer and thus make a difference for yourself, your new team, our customers, and society? We would like to receive your application for this vacancy in Utrecht.  



  

We offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (based on a 36-hour working week), you can also expect:


* a gross monthly salary of maximum between € 90.000,00 and € 105.000,00 (function group 8 or 9 depending on work experience) based on 40 hours;
* An 8% holiday allowance and a 13th month;
* An Employee Benefit Budget (10 or 11% of your monthly salary); you decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving extra cash on a monthly basis;
* An annual Personal Development Budget of € 1.400,-.
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance;
* A pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 3,5%.
* A monthly € 40,- nett work from home allowance, based on working from home 5 days per week.
* A monthly € 40,- nett internet allowance

**Growing a better world together**
  

You are already aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for millions of customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our “Growing a better world together” mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:


* A third of all the food we purchase is thrown away. Together with Nature & Environment, we’re working to increase awareness among consumers of how to reduce food waste.
* As part of a project with Humanitas, we are helping people who are experiencing financial difficulties to get their household finances in order.
* Together with Vluchtelingenwerk Nederland (the Dutch Council for Refugees), we are helping 1,500 refugees find a suitable job.

**You and the job application process:**


* Applications are open until the vacancies for this role are filled. Responses will be handled in accordance with our vacancy management policy.
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact: Lois Hageman, Recruiter via marie-louise.hageman@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* The application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff are reliable enough to work at Rabobank
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That’s why we want to know who *you* really are!
* We respect your privacy

title: Dev Ops Engineer Java Niche C Smile
description:
Our Insights features focus on provide RBB clients with categorised transactions and actionable insights on income and spendings to run their business, administration and finances better.


Our tech-stack:


* Angular, RXJS, Chart.js, Split.io
* NX Monorepo
Splunk (logging), SignalFX (metrics) and Pagerduty (alerting)  
* 

We are looking for a senior Frontend developer. In this role we expect you to show us your best coding skills, and also guide the team along with you, bring structure where needed and to have an eye for overall quality. This includes the DevOps responsibility and working together with the other developers to stand for the overall quality of the products and services we deliver.


We are adding support for dark mode and UI scaling to our applications. If you consider yourself an accessibility hero, we could really use your help to speed-up these processes.


**Way of Working**

* Ownership and mutual trust forms the bedrock of our close-knit team, fostering an environment where everyone looks out for one another.
* We often sit together to tackle interesting problems.
* We work mostly from home, once per week at the office, and come together for social events.
* We're working in full-fledged DevOps teams. You are not only responsible for changing and deploying your application, you will also do what is in the customers best interest to keep it stable. This can include standby shifts on weekdays and over the weekend. Also by focussing on far reaching automation for all testing, deploying and monitoring you will help to improve the DevOps delivery.
* You are capable of taking over the basic activities of other DevOps team members in case necessary, like performing business analysis, coding, executing tests or support activities.

**You and your talent**


* You are a senior frontend developer.
* Bachelor- or Masterdegree
* >5 years of work experience as a Frontend developer.
* You are not afraid to put forward your ideas, but are also good at listening to the ideas of others.
* You are customer focused and able to appreciate the bigger picture.
* You show initiative and has a lot of tenacity and drive.
* You enjoy learning and experimenting.
* Demonstrated ability to follow development best practices;
* Experience with modern web frameworks and/or libraries
* Experience with TypeScript and modern Javascript (ES6);
* Experience in writing unit tests and integration tests for web applications;
* Experience in applying the WCAG guidelines
* Scrum way of working and DevOps mentality (writing user stories, contributing to Scrum ceremonies, testing, monitoring applications using tools such as Splunk, Dynatrace).
* Knowledge of architectural principles.
* Fluent English is a must.
* Great analytical and problem-solving skills

You have the opportunity to work in the beating heart of data within Rabobank. You collaborate with colleagues who have an insatiable interest in technology and self-development. You invest in your career. As a Lead Engineer / Principal Engineer, you make a difference in technology, process, and people.


Within the Data & Analytics Tribe, you work on the data-driven enterprise. The tribe consists of 6 areas, namely:


* Global Data & Data Governance Platform
* Analytics Platform
* Data & Factory Services
* Data Science
* Business Intelligence
Customer Analytics  
* 

Our areas together comprise approximately 50 squads. For many of the squads, Azure is the foundation on which we build. We need your help to create groundbreaking solutions for our 7 million customers.


This vacancy falls within the Global Data & Data Governance Platform area. Within this area, we work with 18 squads on the "global governed data marketplace" for Rabobank. Based on your profile and competencies, we determine where you can make the most impact.  

  



**You & Your Role**
  

We are taking the next step in our transformation and therefore opening this position. We are moving our organization from IT to Tech. As a Principal Engineer, you are the visionary who supports technical projects and brings advanced data solutions to life. Your role is crucial in shaping the technical architecture, designing innovative systems, and implementing solutions that manage and analyze data optimally. And when necessary, you step in to solve high-urgency issues.


You are here to make an impact, and you do this by:


* Taking a leadership role in projects related to data and Azure, pushing the boundaries of what is possible.
* Designing and implementing scalable, cutting-edge data solutions in the Azure ecosystem. Collaborating closely with multidisciplinary teams to determine and monitor the technical direction.
* Striving for the highest standards in data management and security by evaluating and implementing best practices.
* Solving complex technical issues and acting as a mentor and guide for your team.
* Staying ahead with research into new technologies and tools, applying them to improve the data infrastructure.
Viewing the world with a growth mindset. As mentioned earlier, we assess where your competencies are best suited.  
* 

**With Your Talents**:


It is logical that innovation, coaching, impact, communication skills, and vision are indispensable for the role of Principal Engineer. Additionally, it is important that you recognize yourself in the following checklist:


* Demonstrable academic level (Master) in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Your programming skills (10-15 years of experience) are sharp, with expertise in languages such as Python and SQL, but the exact language doesn't matter to you.
* You have extensive experience with Azure services such as Azure Datalake Gen2, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, and Azure SQL Database or perhaps Airflow.
* You are a trusted coach and thought leader within your field, especially regarding future developments in technical languages and techniques.
* Outside the organization, you have built a network.
* Within your expertise, you are known in the community and share knowledge and skills.
* Innovation is in your DNA, and you play a leading role in exploring new technologies and actively contributing to innovation within the organization.
* Your ability to provide advice is unparalleled, and you are an essential link in the Agile work process.
* Achieving consensus between teams for complex technical solutions is second nature to you.
* You excel in clear communication and create a shared understanding among stakeholders.
Most importantly, you have an insatiable interest in technology and self-development.  
* 

**What do we offer?**
  

We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36-or 40 hours working week), you can also expect:


* Based on your experience: up to a yearly salary including all benefits of € 105,000, - gross per month (scale 9)
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
* An extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
* A budget of € 750- to set up your home working space and a monthly home working allowance of up to € 40-
* A personal development budget of € 1,400-
* A combination of working from home and at the office
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport
* A pension scheme to which you contribute 3.5%
* 151.2 hours holiday per year + 1 Diversity Day per year
* Relocation belongs to the possibilities

This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Principal Engineer based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.  

  



**You and the job application process**


Reply to the vacancy for Dev Ops Engineer Java at Rabobank.


* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? You can ask out IT Recruiter marie-louise.hageman@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
* A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.  
* 

**Growing a better world together**
  

You are already aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for millions of customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our “Growing a better world together” mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:


* A third of all the food we purchase is thrown away. Together with Nature & Environment, we’re working to increase awareness among consumers of how to reduce food waste.
* As part of a project with Humanitas, we are helping people who are experiencing financial difficulties to get their household finances in order.
* Together with Vluchtelingenwerk Nederland (the Dutch Council for Refugees), we are helping 1,500 refugees find a suitable job.

Interested? Please contact us.

title: Senior Scientist - Uber Rides and Eats
description:
**About the Role**  

  

Our mission is create the best platform for our drivers. We are focusing on building a personalized experience that empowers earners to earn and progress effectively at Uber. We are looking for an experienced candidate who has the ability to break complex problems down into executable parts for testing, and is eager to take on new challenges.
  

  

**What you will need*** Propose, design, and analyze large scale online experiments
* Define and implement metrics to measure product performance
* Present findings to business and executive audiences
* Collaborate with engineers and product managers to implement ideas and plan future roadmaps
* Advanced understanding of statistics, causal inference, and machine learning
* 5+ years of industry experience as an Applied Scientist or equivalent
* Experience working with large scale data sets using technologies like Hive, Presto, and Spark

**Basic Qualifications*** Ph.D., MS or Bachelors degree in Economics, Operations Research, Statistics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field
* If Ph.D or M.S. degree, a minimum of 2+ years of industry experience as an Applied Scientist or equivalent

title: Full Stack Marketing Tech Engineer
Data Scientist Predictive Maintenance
description:
**Introduction to the job**
---------------------------

Are you an experienced data scientist that can generate actionable insights from Big Data? Are you able to identify, develop and apply the most effective and robust machine learning approach to analyze complex machine data and develop fit-for-purpose solutions to improve performance and diagnostics capabilities in our scanners? Do you consider it part of your job to inspire others and share your knowledge with your colleagues, then read on!


Data science at ASML is a broad and demanding domain which is positioned on the crossroads of the functional knowledge of our scanners and the data-driven capabilities on our Data and Digital Platform. A data scientist at ASML is often focused on translating the business problem to a data science problem, and developing fit-for-purpose models and solutions to drive value out of data together with functional experts. Therefore, proven affinity to technical domains like Lithography and preferably working knowledge of at least one relevant functional area at ASML is a prerequisite for being successful in the role of Data Scientist Predictive Maintenance.


Together with Machine Learning Engineers and Data Engineers you will support the implementation of data-driven models and solutions and nurture them towards production to support the operation of the most complex lithography machines in the world.


**Role and responsibilities**
-----------------------------

As a Data Scientist you are responsible for:


* Independent and creative investigation, predictive maintenance modeling and development, remaining useful lifetime, Machine Learning, Signal & Image processing, state space modeling, pattern recognition, feature extraction, evaluation of models, algorithms and pipelines
* Work closely with domain experts to incorporate prior knowledge, find and validate relations between variables and to interpret predictive models
* Ensure documentation and knowledge sharing at various levels in the organization
* Provide quality output with the Agile team
* Competence development of data science
* Share your knowledge and insights with colleagues from different disciplines
* Apply and further develop methodologies and models, generate new and innovative solutions and help deploy solutions
* Leverage your professional network to accelerate knowledge and skills build-up

**Education and experience**
----------------------------

At least University Master’s qualification in Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, Applied Statistics, Applied Mathematics or equivalent and proven Data Science competence applied in an industrial setting for at least 3 years.


**Skills**
----------

* Proven track record with >3 years of experience in algorithm development experience and/or Statistical Machine Learning on structured and unstructured data, preferably in the high-tech sector, using state-of-the-art machine learning
* Advanced skills and knowledge in Statistical Modeling and Predictive Modeling, Deep Learning, excellent coding skills using state-of-the-art machine learning libraries (e.g. Python/R, Python preferred)
* Hands-on proficiency in frameworks such as Pandas, Scikit-Learn, PyMC, Tensorflow/PyTorch
* Proven affinity to technical domains like Lithography and preferably working knowledge of at least one relevant functional area at ASML like overlay or scanner sub-functions
* Hands-on experience with large-scale computing and machine learning model deployment in production (MLOps) is a plus

Experience or affinity with signal and image processing is needed; in addition, we highly value experience with finding causality in signals, capturing uncertainty in models, Bayesian modeling, optimization problems and diagnostics methodologies  

* 

**Additional qualifications for Predictive Maintenance development team:**

* Proven track record in designing, experimenting and building accurate and fit-for-purpose Statistical Machine Learning models
* Ability to create fast prototypes – experiment and iterate towards ideal solution in an Agile/ CRISP-DM manner
* Well versed with the latest GCP offerings like Vertex AI, BigQuery, dataproc, Pub/Sub, DataProc (+++) and experience with Feature Store

**Job Environment**

You will be working in a multi-disciplinary team of data scientists, functional experts, data engineers, machine learning engineers, physicists, computer scientists, and IT engineers to build, deploy and maintain scalable Machine Learning pipelines on various Big Data platforms. The team has been developing powerful predictive and diagnostic software tools that are aiming to uncover causal relationships between complex lithography equipment parameters and system performance. With regards to the current position, the team is engaging on predictive solutions for condition-based maintenance and equipment health monitoring.


**We provide:**

* Work in an open constructive environment with Multi-disciplinary team: Data scientists, data engineers and physicists
* Design and Build Data Science-driven models to optimize some of the most complex machines known to mankind that drive the digitalization of the world

**Context of the position**

Within ASML, the sector Development & Engineering is responsible for the development, specification and design of new ASML products.


Within Development & Engineering, the DATA (Data infrastructure, diagnostics Tooling and Analytics) department delivers and advances state-of-the- art methods and techniques for the monitoring, diagnostics and structural improvement of the performance and quality of scanner components using scanner data.


The holder of this position reports to the manager of Predictive Maintenance & Diagnostics group.


*This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.*

EOE AA M/F/Veteran/Disability


**Applications will be accepted until Friday the 24th of May. After this date, the vacancy will be closed, and the hiring process will start.**

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------

ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions .
company_description: ASML provides chipmakers with hardware, software and services to mass produce patterns on silicon, helping to build the electronic devices that keep us informed, entertained and connected.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Amsterdam
Netherlands
Information Technology
**Job Description**


**Job Title**  

Sr. Data Engineer  

  

**Job Summary**  

Do you want to join a team passionate about engineering data solutions to inform business decisions and transform business performance? ADM is seeking a Sr. Data Engineer, someone who thrives in an environment continuously integrating and deploying data products and analytics driving business value. The Sr. Data Engineer is responsible for delivery, adherence to standards, and mentoring team members. The Sr. Data Engineer collaborates with teams to ensure delivery and contributes to technical design and process improvements. The Sr. Data Engineer is a team player who sees problems as challenges to be creatively solved in collaboration with other data engineers, data scientists, and business colleagues. The ideal candidate is a driven learner who develops and sharpens skills building data pipelines, transforming raw data into useful data systems, and optimizing the data delivery architecture.  

  

**Job Responsibilities*** Responsible to design, build, refactor, and maintain data pipelines using Microsoft Azure, SQL, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Databricks, Python, and PySpark to meet business requirements for reporting, analysis, and data science
* Responsible to teach, adhere to, and contribute to DataOps and MLOps standards and best practices to accelerate and continuously improve data system performance
* Responsible to design, and integrate fault tolerance and enhancements into data pipelines to improve quality and performance
* Responsible to lead and perform root cause analysis and solve problems using analytical and technical skills to optimize data delivery and reduce costs
* Engages business end users and shares responsibility leading a delivery team.
* Responsible to mentor Data Engineers at all levels of experience

  

**Job Requirements*** Advanced experience with Microsoft Azure, SQL, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Databricks, Python, PySpark, Power BI or other cloud-based data systems
* Advanced experience with Azure DevOps, GitHub, CI/CD
* Advanced experience with database storage systems such as cloud, relational, mainframe, data lake, and data warehouse
* Advanced experience building cloud ETL pipelines using code or ETL platforms utilizing database connections, APIs, or file-based
* Advanced experience with data warehousing concepts and agile methodology
* Advanced experience designing and coding data manipulations applying processing techniques to extract value from large, disconnected datasets
* Experienced presenting conceptual and technical improvements to influence decisions
* Continuous learning to upskill data engineering techniques and business acumen

**Education and Experience*** Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, software engineering, information technology or equivalent combination of data engineering professional experience and education.
* 7+ years proven Data Engineering experience in a complex agile environment

**Our offer:*** Challenging tasks, short decision-making processes and a high level of personal responsibility in a modern work environment with flexible work time models
* Room for innovative thinking and growth
* A company culture which promotes continuous learning and diversity
* Excellent career opportunities in a world leading nutrition company
* An attractive remuneration including a variety of social benefits like subsidized health & fitness offers

  

**Additional information:**  

  

Learn more about ADM at www.adm.com.  

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and value diversity at our company. If you feel this job is for you, unlock your potential and apply now!
**#IncludingYou**  

  

Diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging are cornerstones of ADM’s efforts to continue innovating, driving growth, and delivering outstanding performance. We respect and value the unique backgrounds and experiences that each person can bring to ADM because we know that diversity of perspectives makes us better, together.  

  

For more information regarding our efforts to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging, please visit our website here: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion | ADM.  

**About ADM**  

  

At ADM, we unlock the power of nature to provide access to nutrition worldwide. With industry-advancing innovations, a complete portfolio of ingredients and solutions to meet any taste, and a commitment to sustainability, we give customers an edge in solving the nutritional challenges of today and tomorrow. We’re a global leader in human and animal nutrition and the world’s premier agricultural origination and processing company. title: Data Analyst - Financial Services
description:
Booking.com is seeking a Data Analyst to join and strengthen our Financial Services Data Science and Analytics team. The Data Analyst will drive analytics tasks such as reporting, visualization and analysis needs in Financial Services - bringing insight into our Banking, Payment, Treasury and Financial Services operations. They will have a high level understanding of the business problems in Financial Services, and collaborate closely with the business stakeholders and technical teams to solve these problems through application of data analytics. They will use their experience and consultation with stakeholders in problem-definition, setting success metrics and shaping the way forward through data insights and effective communication with their audience.



The successful candidate will report to the Manager of the Data Science and Analytics team within the Financial Services organization, and is expected to have a high-level understanding of business problems, working closely with business stakeholders to devise solutions. With an exceptional ability to operate in a fast-paced environment, the role requires to work with business stakeholders and prioritize tasks for significant business impact.



The candidate will leverage their knowledge of data, workflows, methods, and tools to independently lead analysis and reporting efforts, ensuring the delivery of scalable, reproducible, and long-term solutions across all facets of their work. The candidate can find opportunities to apply new concepts and approaches into action when business and user needs demand it. They can deliver scalable, reproducible and long-term focused solutions in every area of their work (ie. reporting, visualization, influencing business decisions through data, etc).



The role is critical to ensure that the Treasury & Financial Services department has sufficient insights, both from internal and external sources, to appropriately define its strategy, key priorities and identify problems and needs for change early.


**Tasks & responsibilities:**


* Own the design and delivery of Data Analytics solutions in Financial Services, based on business requirements, bringing them from the initial idea-generation phase to implementation independently.
* Work autonomously on consuming data, preparing it for analytical use, translating business problems to data stories and leveraging input from business stakeholders to determine the right technical solutions to deliver customer value.
* Leverage previous knowledge, experience and substantial skills in data analysis and data visualization to answer business questions in the most efficient way. Understand stakeholder needs and create intuitive and insightful visualizations that translate data into actionable insights to answer those needs.
* Work with the team to identify and manage stakeholders in operational, project-based, and managerial roles. Effectively communicates, addresses stakeholder needs, and conveys complex analysis results in a clear manner. Guide junior colleagues in stakeholder engagement.
* Is flexible in adopting existing internal and external Data Analytics approaches, proposing and spotting opportunities to apply new approaches and expanding their technical competencies and their peer’s when a more efficient way presents itself.
* Leverage Data Analytics for impact while learning to incorporate scalability, reproducibility and long term orientation in their work.
* Support community projects aimed at making other data professionals more effective, actively participating in community strengthening activities, and connecting with peers beyond their area.
* Is knowledgeable about the larger data ecosystem at Booking and how it relates to the work they do.
* Collaborate with peers, anticipating data needs to ensure smooth progress of their individual projects.
* Ensure quality of work by validating it through peer review.
* Influence business decisions within the Financial Services team.
* Maintain various existing risk tableau dashboards and continuously drive improvements based on business feedback.
* Respond to ad-hoc requests from the Financial Services business teams. Think strategically and make propositions of required data analysis and dashboards to support the financial services business needs (both based on internal and external data sources).


**Skills and experience required:**


* A bachelor’s degree in Finance, Mathematics, or Engineering is preferred, underscoring a robust foundation and dedication to excellence in the field.
* Previous experience in Payments, a Fintech or Financial Services company or a Bank is a very strong advantage.
* Business acumen and ability to translate business problems into data problems. Ability to translate business requirements and liaise with engineers to build the solution.
* Goal oriented and solution focused.
* Stakeholder management & Communication: Experience in dealing with non technical stakeholders.
* 3-5 years experience in data analytics, capable of generating insightful analyses and creating compelling data visualizations.
* Advanced SQL capabilities (encompassing joins and window functions), proficiency in Python (specifically PySpark), and a solid understanding of Big Data ecosystems, particularly Hadoop.
* Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
* Drive to consistently stay up to date with data analytics


**What we offer:**


**Benefits & Perks: Global Impact, Personal Relevance**



Booking.com’s Total Rewards Philosophy is not only about compensation but also about benefits. Our Total Rewards strive to make it easier for you to experience all that life has to offer on your terms so that you can focus on what really matters. We offer competitive compensation as well as thoughtful, valuable, and even fun benefits, which include:



Headquarters are located in one of the most dynamic and cosmopolitan cities in Europe: Amsterdam.  

Contribute to a high-scale, sophisticated, world-class product and see the real-time impact of your work on millions of travelers worldwide.  

Be part of a truly international, fast-paced environment with a performance-driven culture.  

Full relocation support for you and your family to move to Amsterdam. We have fine-tuned this process by successfully relocating over 300 Technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year alone!  

Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  

Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal,” including other perks and benefits.  

Company-sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture.  

Diverse and creative colleagues from every corner of the world.  

Health, life, and disability insurance  

Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme, including: parent, grandparent, bereavement, and care leave.  

Hybrid working includes flexible working arrangements and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country).  

Industry-leading product discounts for yourself, friends, and family, including automatic Genius Level 3 status and quarterly Booking.com wallet credit.  

Free access to online learning platforms, development and mentorship programs, and a complimentary Headspace membership  

On-site meals, coffee, and snacks, including healthy and vegan options, are available daily\*


**#ThinkInclusion: Wellbeing & Inclusion at Booking.com:**



Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations.



Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just create a unique workplace; it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone. Inclusion is at the heart of everything we do. It’s a place where you can make your mark and have a real impact in travel and technology.”



We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable adjustment to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.



Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

 **Pre-****Employment****Screening:**  

  

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

title: Senior Data Platform Engineer
description:
.


As a data platform engineer, you will be working on our data platform named Thor. With Thor, we want to create a self-service, metadata driven data platform where data producers can share their data with the data consumers without the platform team being the bottleneck. This means that we are working hard to enable our users so they can do as much as possible themselves and we can focus on improving and optimizing our pipelines and codebase.

 **A few cool new features we have recently implemented:**

* Smart Scheduling that dynamically changes data pipeline configuration based on historical statistics
* A versioned data platform that allows the product to scale to other brands
* Documentation that writes itself


If you want to know more about how it is to work in this team, read: https://werk.ah.nl/colleagues/charlotte-van-der-scheun/

 **This is how you will reinvent food retail.**

* You lead the design and implementation of a scalable data platform architecture on Azure in alignment with the product and platform architect
* You act as the technical subject matter expert (SME) and provide guidance on best practices, architectural decisions, and technology adoption
* You develop CI/CD pipelines, automation scripts, and infrastructure as code (IaC) templates to streamline deployment processes and ensure consistency
* You collaborate with the technical leads in the platform and work together towards a Data Enablement suite
* You mentor junior engineers, conduct code reviews, and foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement
* You optimize performance, reliability, and cost-efficiency of data pipelines and analytics workloads on Databricks
* You enable data producers with self-service capabilities on our data platform granting them the freedom to autonomously share their data to the rest of the organization for data driven insights
* You stay informed latest developments on technologies and industry trends, and evaluate their potential impact on our data platform strategy

 **Your new team and office.**  

Together with your team of platform engineers you will work on inspiring projects to accelerate our transition into a hybrid Food & Tech company. We want to leverage data and technology to future-proof food shopping and give our customers the accessibility to healthy food more easily available for everyone. At Albert Heijn, you team up with inspiring peers in the data, digital and tech domains. A community of diverse individuals who share a common goal; to create digital solutions that make (online) shopping simpler and more inspiring. Are you ready to reinvent the way millions of people buy and enjoy their food? We invest heavily in data, digital and tech. And that includes investing in your career! Our teams work in a hybrid way: both from home as well as in the office. We are located right next to the train station of Zaandam.  

  

We think it’s important to be part of an high-belonging team; a team where you can be yourself and feel safe, accepted and appreciated. For this job we are preferably looking for someone who brings diversity to our team, in the widest possible sense. Someone who is a great addition to our team by bringing other ideas to the table. Don’t check all the boxes? Don’t worry, we probably don’t either . Don’t hesitate to apply if you think you are up for the challenge, we’re happy to have a look at your resume!

 **The recipe for maximum impact**

* 10+ years of relevant experience in software development out of which 5+ years of industrial experience in the domain of large-scale data platform teams (building a data product), data engineering
* Experience with Databricks, Python and PySpark
* Hands-on experience incl. solid programming experience in data ingestions patterns (streaming)
* Curious, proactive, fast learner able to quickly picking-up new areas
* Experience with agile methodologies
* Perfect communication skills

 **What we offer.**  

At Albert Heijn we aim to grow, and this is only possible if you grow along with us. As we work together to build our brand and your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours per week):

* An annual salary up to 95k including holiday allowance and a flexible bonus. Depending on your level of seniority and experience
* A minimum of 20 days paid vacation, optionally 12.5 days extra. Do you want to take that extra time off, or would you rather convert the extra days into discounts or sell them for cash? You’re the end boss!
* Flexible working hours
* Access to a challenging training curriculum – AH Tech Academy
* An excellent pension plan where we as an employer contribute 6 times more than you as an employee
* A travel allowance or a NS-business card for traveling to and from Zaandam by train
* 10% staff discount on groceries in all Albert Heijn stores, to a maximum of €300 per year
* A free Mijn Albert Heijn Premium membership with many benefits
* A company laptop and telephone

 **We’re Albert Heijn, food retail reinventors.**  

Albert Heijn goes way back. More than 135 years, to be exact. So for millions of people, food shopping is synonymous with the Albert Heijn brand. We didn’t achieve this with a complacent, ‘hey, if it works today, it’ll work tomorrow’ approach, but by continually rethinking our propositions and staying plugged in to customer demands. More than 125,000 colleagues? Check. Over 1,250 stores in the Netherlands and Flanders? Check. The leading online food retail platform? Check, we build, run and love it.  

  

**Together we make eating better the easy choice. For everyone.**  

The world around us has changed, and significantly at that. These changes have impact on the lives of our customers, colleagues and partners. And therefore, also on Albert Heijn. We’re moving towards a new world with new opportunities and challenges. Albert Heijn wants more people to eat fresher, healthier and more sustainable food. Eating brings us together, keeps us healthier and contributes positively to the world. Our mission is: Together we make eating better the easy choice. For everyone.  

  

**Ready to contribute to our mission?**  

Do you want to play an active role in changing the food retail landscape as we know it? Then hop on board and join us on our expedition. Would you like to learn more first, before you apply to Albert Heijn? We’re happy to tell you everything about this vacancy! An assessment might be part of our selection process.


.

* ### **Solliciteren**


Stuur je sollicitatie in via deze website.
* ### **Gesprek**


Als je aan het profiel voldoet nodigen we je snel uit voor een gesprek in de winkel.
* ### **Mogelijkheden**


Samen bekijken we de mogelijkheden voor jou in de winkel zoals de verschillende werktijden en welke plek het beste bij je past.
* ### **Welkom!**


Zijn we allebei enthousiast? Dan kun je snel beginnen! Welkom.

### **Wat we vragen?**

* Een positieve houding
* Een aanpakkersmentaliteit
* Passie voor je vakgebied

title: Senior Scientist - Uber Rides and Eats
description:
**About the Role**  

  

Our mission is create the best platform for our drivers. We are focusing on building a personalized experience that empowers earners to earn and progress effectively at Uber. We are looking for an experienced candidate who has the ability to break complex problems down into executable parts for testing, and is eager to take on new challenges.
  

  

**What you will need*** Propose, design, and analyze large scale online experiments
* Define and implement metrics to measure product performance
* Present findings to business and executive audiences
* Collaborate with engineers and product managers to implement ideas and plan future roadmaps
* Advanced understanding of statistics, causal inference, and machine learning
* 5+ years of industry experience as an Applied Scientist or equivalent
* Experience working with large scale data sets using technologies like Hive, Presto, and Spark

**Basic Qualifications*** Ph.D., MS or Bachelors degree in Economics, Operations Research, Statistics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field
* If Ph.D or M.S. degree, a minimum of 2+ years of industry experience as an Applied Scientist or equivalent
* Knowledge of underlying mathematical foundations of machine learning, statistics, optimization, economics, and analytics
* Knowledge of experimental design and analysis
* Experience with exploratory data analysis, statistical analysis and testing, and model development
* Ability to use a language like Python or R to work efficiently at scale with large data sets
* Proficiency in technologies in one or more of the following: SQL, Spark, Hadoop

title: Data Scientist Predictive Maintenance
description:
**Introduction to the job**
---------------------------

Are you an experienced data scientist that can generate actionable insights from Big Data? Are you able to identify, develop and apply the most effective and robust machine learning approach to analyze complex machine data and develop fit-for-purpose solutions to improve performance and diagnostics capabilities in our scanners? Do you consider it part of your job to inspire others and share your knowledge with your colleagues, then read on!


Data science at ASML is a broad and demanding domain which is positioned on the crossroads of the functional knowledge of our scanners and the data-driven capabilities on our Data and Digital Platform. A data scientist at ASML is often focused on translating the business problem to a data science problem, and developing fit-for-purpose models and solutions to drive value out of data together with functional experts. Therefore, proven affinity to technical domains like Lithography and preferably working knowledge of at least one relevant functional area at ASML is a prerequisite for being successful in the role of Data Scientist Predictive Maintenance.


Together with Machine Learning Engineers and Data Engineers you will support the implementation of data-driven models and solutions and nurture them towards production to support the operation of the most complex lithography machines in the world.


**Role and responsibilities**
-----------------------------

As a Data Scientist you are responsible for:


* Independent and creative investigation, predictive maintenance modeling and development, remaining useful lifetime, Machine Learning, Signal & Image processing, state space modeling, pattern recognition, feature extraction, evaluation of models, algorithms and pipelines
* Work closely with domain experts to incorporate prior knowledge, find and validate relations between variables and to interpret predictive models
* Ensure documentation and knowledge sharing at various levels in the organization
* Provide quality output with the Agile team
* Competence development of data science
* Share your knowledge and insights with colleagues from different disciplines
* Apply and further develop methodologies and models, generate new and innovative solutions and help deploy solutions
* Leverage your professional network to accelerate knowledge and skills build-up

**Education and experience**
----------------------------

At least University Master’s qualification in Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, Applied Statistics, Applied Mathematics or equivalent and proven Data Science competence applied in an industrial setting for at least 3 years.


**Skills**
----------

* Proven track record with >3 years of experience in algorithm development experience and/or Statistical Machine Learning on structured and unstructured data, preferably in the high-tech sector, using state-of-the-art machine learning
* Advanced skills and knowledge in Statistical Modeling and Predictive Modeling, Deep Learning, excellent coding skills using state-of-the-art machine learning libraries (e.g. Python/R, Python preferred)
* Hands-on proficiency in frameworks such as Pandas, Scikit-Learn, PyMC, Tensorflow/PyTorch
* Proven affinity to technical domains like Lithography and preferably working knowledge of at least one relevant functional area at ASML like overlay or scanner sub-functions
* Hands-on experience with large-scale computing and machine learning model deployment in production (MLOps) is a plus

Experience or affinity with signal and image processing is needed; in addition, we highly value experience with finding causality in signals, capturing uncertainty in models, Bayesian modeling, optimization problems and diagnostics methodologies  

* 

**Additional qualifications for Predictive Maintenance development team:**

* Proven track record in designing, experimenting and building accurate and fit-for-purpose Statistical Machine Learning models
* Ability to create fast prototypes – experiment and iterate towards ideal solution in an Agile/ CRISP-DM manner
* Well versed with the latest GCP offerings like Vertex AI, BigQuery, dataproc, Pub/Sub, DataProc (+++) and experience with Feature Store

**Job Environment**

You will be working in a multi-disciplinary team of data scientists, functional experts, data engineers, machine learning engineers, physicists, computer scientists, and IT engineers to build, deploy and maintain scalable Machine Learning pipelines on various Big Data platforms. The team has been developing powerful predictive and diagnostic software tools that are aiming to uncover causal relationships between complex lithography equipment parameters and system performance. With regards to the current position, the team is engaging on predictive solutions for condition-based maintenance and equipment health monitoring.


**We provide:**

* Work in an open constructive environment with Multi-disciplinary team: Data scientists, data engineers and physicists
* Design and Build Data Science-driven models to optimize some of the most complex machines known to mankind that drive the digitalization of the world

**Context of the position**

Within ASML, the sector Development & Engineering is responsible for the development, specification and design of new ASML products.


Within Development & Engineering, the DATA (Data infrastructure, diagnostics Tooling and Analytics) department delivers and advances state-of-the- art methods and techniques for the monitoring, diagnostics and structural improvement of the performance and quality of scanner components using scanner data.


The holder of this position reports to the manager of Predictive Maintenance & Diagnostics group.


*This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.*

EOE AA M/F/Veteran/Disability


**Applications will be accepted until Friday the 24th of May. After this date, the vacancy will be closed, and the hiring process will start.**

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------

ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions .

title: Teacher Modelling, Uncertainty and Data for Engineers (MUDE)
description:
Teacher Modelling, Uncertainty and Data for Engineers (MUDE)
 Apply Now
***Are you a passionate educator with a strong background in engineering or applied sciences? TU Delft is seeking a lecturer for the Modelling, Uncertainty, and Data for Engineers (MUDE).***


Job description


The faculty of Civil Engineering and Geosciences is excited to announce the search for a teacher in Modelling, Uncertainty and Data for Engineers (MUDE) for our MSc-programmes in Civil Engineering, Applied Earth Sciences and Environmental Engineering.



MUDE is a collaborative educational module within our faculty, where approximately 300 MSc students begin their studies together. This module focuses on onboarding students from around the globe (with 30% international students) and provides engaging education in modelling, uncertainty, and data analysis for engineering applications. MUDE is delivered by a large, flexible team of lecturers and supported by teaching assistants. We currently have an opening in the core teaching team (comprising 5 lecturers) for a teacher fully dedicated to education.



From an educational perspective, MUDE is highly versatile, including lectures to explain theoretical concepts and practical assignments to illustrate their application. It also features small projects with groupwork to solve challenging problems derived from societal demands relevant to our faculty’s field of application. MUDE relies heavily on open-source digital software tools (e.g., Python, git or Jupyter) to facilitate the incorporation of computation as a complementary learning approach to the classical theoretical topics covered. As a faculty, we are very proud of this new educational setup and the standards it sets for our education.



We are looking for a dedicated teacher to become fully involved in the content and didactics and actively support and lead in-class activities with students. As a core member of the MUDE team, you will also handle many of the organisational tasks necessary to deliver the module. Additionally, you will collaborate with the team to develop new teaching materials and take responsibility for advancing MUDE's new teaching standards, sharing these innovations with the rest of our scientific staff within the faculty.


Requirements


For this exciting position, we are looking for candidates with a strong focus on education and a solid knowledge base in a technical field relevant to our engineering programs. We value interdisciplinary breadth and a wide range of experience over expertise in a specific field.


* You hold a master's degree in engineering or applied sciences.
* You are interested in our new educational approach and have experience with the mentioned digital platforms, or are willing to learn.
* You are a team player and excel at translating students' needs into quality education.
* You are well-organised and take pride in delivering smooth-running education, with a strong interest in keeping students and staff connected and engaged.
* Excellent communication skills are essential, as well as proficiency in spoken and written English.


Conditions of employment


* Duration of contract is 1 year with prospect of permanent.
* A job of 32-38 hours per week.
* A salary based on scale11 of the CAO for Dutch Universities with a minimum of €4,332 and a maximum of €5,929 gross per month based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.
* An excellent pension scheme via the ABP.
* The possibility to compile an individual employment package every year.
* Discount with health insurers.
* Flexible working week.
* Every year, 232 leave hours (at 38 hours). You can also sell or buy additional leave hours via the individual choice budget.
* Plenty of opportunities for education, training and courses.
* Partially paid parental leave
* Attention for working healthy and energetically with the vitality program.


TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)


Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.



At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.



Challenge. Change. Impact!


Faculty Civil Engineering & Geosciences


The Faculty of Civil Engineering & Geosciences (CEG) is committed to outstanding international research and education in the field of civil engineering, applied earth sciences, traffic and transport, water technology, and delta technology. Our research feeds into our educational programmes and covers societal challenges such as climate change, energy transition, resource availability, urbanisation and clean water. Our research projects are conducted in close cooperation with a wide range of research institutions. CEG is convinced of the importance of open science and supports its scientists in integrating open science in their research practice. The Faculty of CEG comprises 28 research groups in the following seven departments: Materials Mechanics Management & Design, Engineering Structures, Geoscience and Engineering, Geoscience and Remote Sensing, Transport & Planning, Hydraulic Engineering and Water Management.



Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Civil Engineering & Geosciences.


Additional information


* If the University Teaching Qualification (UTQ) or an equivalent has not yet been obtained, part of this position will involve obtaining it within two years, should the contract be converted to a permanent position. Time will be allocated within your work duties to achieve this.
* This position will be assigned to the department within the Faculty of Civil Engineering and Geosciences that best fits both the candidate's profile and the core team of MUDE.


If you want more information about the position, please contact the Director of Education, Hans Welleman (J.W.Welleman@tudelft.nl).
  

If you have questions about the application procedure, please contact the HR advisor, Mariska Wagemans-Vos (M.Wagemans-Vos@tudelft.nl).


Application procedure


Are you the teacher who will strengthen the MUDE team?



Upload the following documents no later than **June 13, 2024:**


* CV
* Motivation letter
* Teaching portfolio with examples of previous teaching activities developed and/or taught (optional if there is no experience).


You can address your application to Hans Welleman, Director of Education CEG. The interviews will take place as much as possible between **June 17 and 27, 2024**.



Please note:


* You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
* A pre-Employment screening can be part of the selection procedure.
* Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.


FACULTY/DEPARTMENT### **Faculty of Civil Engineering and Geosciences**

JOB TYPE### **Education**

SCIENTIFIC FIELD### **Engineering**

HOURS PER WEEK### **32-38**

SALARY### **€ 4.332,00 - € 5.929,00**

DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION### **University graduate**

VACANCY NUMBER### **TUD05367**


Apply Now

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Amsterdam
Netherlands
Information Technology
**Job Description**


**Job Title**  

Sr. Data Engineer  

  

**Job Summary**  

Do you want to join a team passionate about engineering data solutions to inform business decisions and transform business performance? ADM is seeking a Sr. Data Engineer, someone who thrives in an environment continuously integrating and deploying data products and analytics driving business value. The Sr. Data Engineer is responsible for delivery, adherence to standards, and mentoring team members. The Sr. Data Engineer collaborates with teams to ensure delivery and contributes to technical design and process improvements. The Sr. Data Engineer is a team player who sees problems as challenges to be creatively solved in collaboration with other data engineers, data scientists, and business colleagues. The ideal candidate is a driven learner who develops and sharpens skills building data pipelines, transforming raw data into useful data systems, and optimizing the data delivery architecture.  

  

**Job Responsibilities*** Responsible to design, build, refactor, and maintain data pipelines using Microsoft Azure, SQL, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Databricks, Python, and PySpark to meet business requirements for reporting, analysis, and data science
* Responsible to teach, adhere to, and contribute to DataOps and MLOps standards and best practices to accelerate and continuously improve data system performance
* Responsible to design, and integrate fault tolerance and enhancements into data pipelines to improve quality and performance
* Responsible to lead and perform root cause analysis and solve problems using analytical and technical skills to optimize data delivery and reduce costs
* Engages business end users and shares responsibility leading a delivery team.
* Responsible to mentor Data Engineers at all levels of experience

  

**Job Requirements*** Advanced experience with Microsoft Azure, SQL, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Databricks, Python, PySpark, Power BI or other cloud-based data systems
* Advanced experience with Azure DevOps, GitHub, CI/CD
* Advanced experience with database storage systems such as cloud, relational, mainframe, data lake, and data warehouse
* Advanced experience building cloud ETL pipelines using code or ETL platforms utilizing database connections, APIs, or file-based
* Advanced experience with data warehousing concepts and agile methodology
* Advanced experience designing and coding data manipulations applying processing techniques to extract value from large, disconnected datasets
* Experienced presenting conceptual and technical improvements to influence decisions
* Continuous learning to upskill data engineering techniques and business acumen

**Education and Experience*** Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, software engineering, information technology or equivalent combination of data engineering professional experience and education.
* 7+ years proven Data Engineering experience in a complex agile environment

**Our offer:*** Challenging tasks, short decision-making processes and a high level of personal responsibility in a modern work environment with flexible work time models
* Room for innovative thinking and growth
* A company culture which promotes continuous learning and diversity
* Excellent career opportunities in a world leading nutrition company
* An attractive remuneration including a variety of social benefits like subsidized health & fitness offers

  

**Additional information:**  

  

Learn more about ADM at www.adm.com.  

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and value diversity at our company. If you feel this job is for you, unlock your potential and apply now!

For more information regarding our efforts to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging, please visit our website here: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion | ADM.

title: Research Data Scientist
description:
As Data Scientist at BigData Republic you consult the biggest companies in The Netherlands on complex challenges. Research complex usecases, roll up your sleeves to write production ready code, advise on business decisions or coach your team to the next l


* 36-40
* Hybrid working
* Multi-industry client portfolio

Vacancy Research Data Scientist


**About you**
-------------


Perhaps you are a data scientist with a passion for academic research. Or you have a broader technical background and like to deep dive into technical problems. Either way, your eyes start to sparkle when research is needed to find a solution for your client’s challenge. You believe in collective intelligence and want to share your knowledge and passion with others. You also like a challenge, and like to discuss your experience and passion with peers to turn it into something useful for the world.


**About us**
------------


* BigData Republic is a high-end consultancy firm, specializing in data science, data engineering, and machine learning technology. As a niche consultancy team, we are different from the large consultancy firms out there. We deliver a quality over quantity approach. Our goal is to be a thought leader in the field. For our clients, we focus on creating business value with innovative data solutions that have a sustainable impact.
* Knowledge sharing and thought leadership are fundamental pillars of our organization. Every Friday we host knowledge sharing sessions at our office. We write blog posts, organize meetups and visit conferences. At BigData Republic you can be the expert in the room, and at the same time learn something new from your colleagues every day. And most importantly, you can be yourself.
* We are a team of about 20 experienced MLOps- and Data Engineers. Our culture is centered around collaboration and growth, and we are motivated by helping others. We love to share our knowledge and like to be challenged by each other.
* We develop data applications, create models, build data platforms and design infrastructures. We have a strong focus on advanced technical expertise, a software engineering mindset and pragmatic way-of-working.
**About the job**
-----------------


You have deep expertise in a technical field, dare to tackle the nitty gritty mathematical issues, and can put the Science in Data Science where needed. You also recognize when a more pragmatic approach is required, and always try to understand the bigger picture. From your expertise you can distill clear recommendations to technical as well as non-technical colleagues. You care deeply about continuous learning, not just by doing it yourself but also by mentoring those around you.


* We approach machine learning solutions as full-stack software development projects and use technologies such as Python, Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, Keras and Databricks.
* Bringing solutions to production is key, so scalable deployment, model interfacing and model monitoring are important aspects that you will come across.
* If you join us, you will work on complex challenges for large organizations. At the same time, you are part of a small, informal team with peers that know each other really well, share knowledge and inspire each other.
**Technical expertise**
-----------------------


You match if you have experience with some, or all of the items listed below:

* An academic background in math, or other hard sciences.
* You like to write code and are good at it
* Affinity with research in Data topics
* Translating business needs to your research is your approach
* Some experience in business/ SME or corporate industry


At BigData Republic we do not fit common role descriptions that well. And this is a great thing. We call this authentic, and hope you are too. That’s why we would like to get to know you and learn how you could add value, by being you, whichever way this is.


**Want to work for clients like these?**
----------------------------------------


**We match if you**
-------------------


* Have a knack for communicating relevant technical research expertise to both your data team and non-technical decision makers
* Love to double down on a challenge, problem or puzzle
* Look to add value, make an impact and work on elegant solutions that are pragmatic and sustainable
* Already work and live in The Netherlands - we don’t offer relocation at this time.

### **You will dislike the job if you**

* Prefer complexity over simplicity
* Ask GPT3,5 for code
* Don't like to work with people

**The way we look at work**
---------------------------


* Fitting salary and pension scheme, because this is important.
* 25 Days of holidayleave and 8% holiday allowance.
* 36 Or 40 hours a week, hybrid.
* Choose your tech gear; a laptop and phone that work best for you.
* Your project should be fun but also challenging.
* We love to see you speak at conferences, visit them, or get certified in tools or environments if you want to. Get that badge!
* Actively develop your seniority by shaping your own BDR Career path framework. Grow with us!
* Friday drinks, sports events, or other social stuff with your BigData Republic Team, if you feel like it.
* We have a soft spot for office dogs. Woof.

**The process**
---------------


* You apply
* We chat online
* Meet Bertjan and Toon
* We discuss a use case at the office
* An offer comes your way
**What's next**
---------------


If you are curious about the role and feel that you match (some of) the profile elements above, please contact Puck via the link below. She is our Talent Detective, always on the lookout for interesting people to become our new colleagues. Is there anything you would like us to consider while processing your application? Please let Puck know and she will take this into account.  

  

You may have some questions left or are unsure if you match. Don’t worry too much, and just check in with us. We’re not perfect, we don’t expect you to be either. We would much rather learn how we can complement each other and how we can create synergy than keep waiting for ‘Prince Charming’. Because the perfect match is a fairy tale. We believe you add value the most by simply being you, and we are curious about what that looks like.

title: Internship - Data Science
description:
**Internship – Data Science**  



  

**The internship**


Embark on a thrilling journey into the realm of data science as an Intern Data Science at the Global Analytics team of HEINEKEN. Delve into cutting-edge projects such as time series forecasting of financial figures, developing classification models for predictive maintenance on our packaging lines or algorithms that enhance our customer experience. Collaborate closely with our expert team of Data Scientists, gaining invaluable hands-on experience in leveraging data to drive business decisions. This internship offers a dynamic learning environment where you can apply your academic knowledge to real-world challenges, setting the stage for a rewarding career in the ever-evolving field of data science.


During your internship you will get the opportunity to get to know HEINEKEN as a company, also outside your department. We give you the trust and freedom, so you can work like a real entrepreneur. We like to bring the outside world inside and therefore we embrace new, fresh ideas with enthusiasm. Of course, always with the guidance that is right for you.

  

  

**The department**


The Global Analytics department has the goal of bringing advanced analytics products to all our breweries and operating companies. We develop and scale use-cases across the globe.

  

  

**The terms of employment**

* Your starting date is 1 September 2024


* The internship is fulltime (in consultation also 4 days a week possible)


* The duration of the internship is 5 or 6 months (in consultation with your internship supervisor)


* It is a theoretical research internship


* You will be based in Amsterdam


* Working from home is allowed for 50% of your time


* You will receive an internship fee of €500 gross pm based on 40 hours per week


* You will enjoy 2 vacation days per month (based on fulltime)
* If you do not have a student OV product, your commuting expenses will be fully reimbursed

  


**The start of your internship**


Together with a diverse group of interns from different departments you will start your internship at HEINEKEN. Together you will be introduced to the organization. Furthermore, you can organize fun activities with your fellow interns.

  

  

**The unique you!**

  

**We believe that everyone has unique talents and are therefore looking for you!**

* **Currently enrolled in a MSc in a technical discipline related to Data Science (Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, Econometrics, Bioinformatics, etc.) at a European university**
* **Knowledge of Machine Learning, Statistics, optimization algorithms and related fields. But you will learn a lot about this too during the internship!**
* **Python programming skills are essential**
* **A curious mindset!**


**Conditions of HEINEKEN**


* **You are enrolled at an educational institution.**

	+ **In the case of non-EU nationality, you must be registered as an intern with a Dutch educational institution, from which we receive proof of enrollment for the current academic year from you.**

	+ **In case of EU nationality, you may also be registered as an intern at educational institutions outside the EU.**
* **Living in the Netherlands during internship (HEINEKEN does not facilitate housing).**



**Interested?**  

Great! For more information about this vacancy or about the application process, please contact werkenbijheinekennederland@heineken.com or you can apply right now.

  


Are you unsure if there is a perfect match? If so, we would still encourage you to apply!

  


**Working at HEINEKEN**


Every day we work with pride on our great products that you have certainly had in your hand at a party, during a work meeting or at home on the couch. HEINEKEN is much more than just beer. What about brands like Heineken 0.0, Apple Bandit, Amstel Radler and Birra Moretti. We actively work to create a pleasant work environment where everyone feels respected and has equal opportunities. Your personality, knowledge and skills are the success of our organization.

  


Want to know more about our company? Click here.  



Curious what working at HEINEKEN looks like? Have a peek on our Instagram or Facebook!
