title: Postdoctoral position in Modelling Amphibian Species Invasions
description:
Vacaturenr.
14891
Functie-categorie
Omvang (fte)
1,0
Extern/intern
Extern
Locatie
Leiden
Geplaatst op
28 mei 2024
Sluitingsdatum
27 juni 2024


The Faculty of Science and Institute of Environmental Sciences are looking for:

**1 Postdoctoral researcher related to applying landscape models to the evolutionary ecology and invasion trajectory of amphibians**


Vacancy number: 14891


**Key responsibilities**  

Are you a curious scientist, wanting to bridge evolutionary ecology questions to environmental science applications? Does combining landscape models with real-world data, and interfacing with policy decision-makers for conservation applications pique your interest? Do you have experience with using environmental DNA (eDNA) or have a desire to learn and apply this approach in aquatic systems to help stem biodiversity loss? If so, the Institute of Environmental Sciences (CML) at Leiden University is looking for a postdoctoral researcher who has experience and an affinity with applying landscape modelling methods to study questions relating to invasive species (mainly Triturus spp. amphibians but possibly also Salmonid fish), conservation, and evolutionary dynamics. We are particularly interested in candidates familiar with Species Distribution Models (SDMs), evolutionary ecology theory (e.g., speciation, hybridization) and if possible (but not required) environmental DNA (or eDNA).

  

Specifically, the postdoctoral researcher will look at applying modelling methods to (already collected) genetic data to track and predict hybridization and invasion dynamics. Specifically, we are looking for someone to integrate eDNA data into landscape genetic frameworks to understand genetic connectivity of populations across the composition of the landscape, and how this influences hybridization and invasion potential. The Postdoc will investigate whether landscape features, such as waterbody fragmentation or elevation (e.g. with LiDAR and GIS) promote or hinder invasive species spread and potentially hybridization. For SDMs, the postdoc will be expected to overlay biotic and abiotic covariate data for different species for forecasting distributional trajectories. With these projects, we aim to deliver critical information needed for meaningful conservation recovery strategies.

  

The postdoctoral research will work closely with PhD candidates collecting genetic data through field work, and will be expected to work in a large research group comprised of 3-4 PhD students and numerous master’s students. These projects are a part of a Nationally funded research program that links many collaborators across two continents (Europe and N. America) and numerous academic institutions, private enterprises, and NGOs, ultimately offering a unique, large, and dynamic research network. Within the network, the candidate will be expected to liaise with others and potentially travel to various countries across Europe and North America.


The postdoctoral research will become a member in the laboratory of Dr. Stewart whose research has been fully funded through the Dutch VIDI program. As such you will work closely alongside a similarly funded PhD candidate and be expected to offer some degree of mentorship. This collaboration may also see the postdoc doing some fieldwork if wished. Funding for this position also offers the postdoctoral researcher the ability to attend multiple national and international conferences. Dr. Stewart is dedicated to an inclusive and open research environment to promote passion, independence, and transferable skills for whatever future career goals the candidate may have. In our research group, we strongly value a collaborative approach. Researchers will enter an environment of weekly informal meetings to promote progress and cohesion within the larger research group, while also engaging with the larger e3DNA working group (e3DNA.com; the Dutch eDNA research hub hosted by Dr. Stewart and Dr. Trimbos at Leiden University) that meets twice a month.


If you are an interdisciplinary thinker with a PhD degree in Evolutionary or Molecular Ecology, Biology, Sustainability, Environmental Science (or a related field), this postdoctoral position might be a great fit for you.


**You are expected to:**

* Be a collegial person but have a proactive attitude towards balancing your research endeavors
* Contribute to a dynamic research group involved in genetic, ecological and evolutionary analysis both within our institute but also with project collaborators in other countries
* Be comfortable and confident working independently when required
* Be comfortable supervising BSc or MSc students for thesis projects
* Contribute to a mentorship role for PhD candidates
* Attend national and international conferences
* Work with supervisors outlining research methodologies and proposals
* Stimulate students’ collaborative and pro-active attitudes

**Selection criteria:**  

The preferred candidate

* Has at least a PhD degree, ideally in Evolutionary or Molecular Ecology, Biology, Sustainability, Environmental Science or a related discipline
* Proven ability to motivate and/or encourage students and to coach them through group work
* Has excellent organization and communication skills (e.g., as evidenced through publications and presentations at conferences)
* Demonstrable proactive and flexible attitude
* Has experience with molecular data and applying landscape modelling frameworks (e.g. SDMs)
* Particular strengths with Machine Learning or Deep Learning approaches
* Strong data management, visualization, and scripting skills (e.g. in R, Python, or other) are a prerequisite. Your previous degrees ideally involves landscape modelling related research
* You are a team player, and can communicate your work to other researchers of various disciplines within and outside of the CML
* Fluent in English, verbally and in writing

  

**Research at our Institute/Faculty**  

Leiden University is situated between Amsterdam (36km) and Den Haag (15 km) and was founded in 1575, making it the oldest university in the Netherlands. It houses around 35,000 students originating from 112 nationalities, facilitated by approximately 8,000 staff. The Faculty of Science is a world-class faculty where staff and students work together in a dynamic international environment. It is a faculty where personal and academic development are top priorities. Our people are driven by curiosity to expand fundamental knowledge and to look beyond the borders of their own discipline; their aim is to benefit science, and to make a contribution to addressing the major societal challenges of the future.


The research carried out at the Faculty is very diverse, ranging from mathematics, information science, astronomy, physics, chemistry and bio-pharmaceutical sciences to biology and environmental sciences. The research activities are organised in eight institutes. These institutes offer eight bachelor’s and twelve master’s programmes. The faculty has grown strongly in recent years and now has more than 2,300 staff and almost 5,000 students. We are located at the heart of Leiden’s Bio Science Park, one of Europe’s biggest science parks, where university and business life come together.


The environmental science research in CML is organized around two major research areas: ‘Industrial Ecology’ and ‘Environmental Biology’. This makes CML one of the few institutes covering both the circular, sustainable economic use of natural resources and natural capital, as well as assessing the environmental impacts of economic activities on natural resources, biodiversity and natural capital. Presently, over 140 FTE (including postdocs and PhDs) are employed at CML. CML collaborates with the TU Delft and Erasmus University (Rotterdam) in the Leiden-Delft-Erasmus Centre for Sustainability (LDE-CfS).

**Terms and conditions**  

At Leiden University, a postdoctoral research is seen as an employee rather than a student. As such, we offer a 1-year position with the possibility of extension to 3 years based on performance and following the pay scale 10 in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. Salary ranges from € 3.226,00 and € 5.090,00 gross per month based on a full-time position. Leiden University offers an attractive benefits package with additional holiday (8%) and end-of-year bonuses (8.3 %), training and career development. Our individual choices model gives you some freedom to assemble your own set of terms and conditions. For international spouses, we have set up a dual career programme. Candidates from outside the Netherlands may be eligible for a substantial tax break (“30% rule”).


**Diversity**  

At the Faculty of Science we value inclusiveness and strive for a diverse community with equal opportunities for all. We give full support to our staff in achieving their potential to become independent academic researchers and teachers. For more information about our policy on diversity and equality please go to the diversity page on our website. Female researchers are also welcomed to join the Researchers In Science for Equality network of the Faculty if Science (rise.nu).

**Information**  

Enquiries can be made to k.a.stewart@cml.leidenuniv.nl, or sollicitaties@cml.leidenuniv.nl for general questions.

**Applications**  

Please submit your application via the online recruitment system, via the blue button at the top or bottom of this page. Applications received via e-mail will not be taken into consideration. Please ensure that you upload the following additional documents quoting the vacancy number.

* CV – highlighting any research and teaching or mentoring related experiences.
* A publication list.
* A cover/motivation letter.
* The names and contact information of two referees.

  

Applications will be considered on a rolling basis based on matches with specific projects. However, no applications will be considered beyond 27th of June.

title: Data Scientist - Real Estate Finance
description:
Do you want to challenge your analytical skills, take your social and influencing skills to the next level, and learn how we, Real Estate Finance, as market leader are working?


This is an opportunity for you to consider.

**Your role**


As a Data Scientist it is about making every day processes as smooth and easy as possible for both our customers and employees.


You work in an AGILE working environment which is driven by **autonomy** and **alignment**.


This way of working you will benefit from:

* empowerment and accountability on your delivery
* added value to our customers as you will deliver faster and in a more effective way
* transparency & dynamic setting for you to deliver within your squad
* a lot of development opportunities, knowledge sharing with other experts

**Your work environment**


Real Estate Finance NL (REF NL) services their real estate investment customers directly in four regions: North West, North East, South West and South East, e.g. in Amsterdam, Arnhem, Eindhoven and Rotterdam. The regional offices are supported by REF NL’s operations team. Latter team is centrally organized in Amsterdam and is structured in squads. REF NL is considered to be the principal Dutch real estate lender, and our real estate knowledge is appreciated throughout the real estate investor market. You will be part of a small Chapter and work together with other squads in and outside of REF NL to create an unbeatable customer and employee experience.

**The Purpose of REF NL is:**

*Changing real estate*


Our mission is to accelerate the transition to a sustainably built environment. We want to speed up the sustainability transition and at the same time stay appreciated within the real estate investment market and be the best digitalized real estate finance bank. To achieve this, we need to re-invent ourselves over and over again and use data to add value for our customers.

**Your responsibilities:**

* Build and maintain automated credit decisioning models in production, including implementing changes in the model scripts with updated business rules, fixing bugs in case of issues, etc.
* Design, analyze and interpret business hypothesis and explore datasets
* Further professionalize the Data Governance in the broadest sense
* Knowledge of analyzing large data sets and their quality (knowledge of statistics and machine learning techniques is a plus)
* Support and design data model and data definition
* Develop a data quality program to improve data quality
* Data analysis and data processing
* Validate business ideas regarding visualizations / predictive algorithms
* Assist users to understand the data science principles and when needed provide possible correcting actions.

**How to succeed**


We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious, keep learning and take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself. As a Data Scientist, you recognize yourself in the following:

* You have a Master’s degree or an equivalent work level (Econometrics, Computer Science, Physics, Artificial Intelligence or an equivalent).
* You have a learning attitude. You realize that the value of your work is quality x acceptance and want to become better at both. You are able to give, ask and incorporate feedback.
* You feel at home in a high-performing team and you make the other team members feel at home as well. You have the independence to speak up when needed.
* You have exceptional problem-solving capabilities. You understand that understanding the problem is at least 90% of the solution. You have displayed creativity and tenacity in cracking the problem and finding a solution to it.
* You are familiar with coding in Python, SQL, Java, Bash, Git
* Experience with popular frameworks such as NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Pytorch, and Pyspark.
* Familiarity with LLM, ChatGPT API, Gemini, and deep learning algorithms is a pre.
* You have excellent oral and written communication skills at technical and business level.
* You are fluent in English, Dutch is a pre.

**Rewards & benefits**


We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions here.


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 36 or 40 hour workweek
* Individual leave: 24+2 individual holiday days based on 36 hr workweek
* Diversity leave: 3 days per year (1,5 paid, 1,5 unpaid)
* CSR days: up to 2 days per year to actively engage in society by volunteering
* 13th month salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* Mobility card
* Attractive pension scheme
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation

**Want to apply directly?**

Upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button.


Please note, multiple interview steps involving various business stakeholders will be part of the selection process.

**About us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us and apply today!
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Operations Research Engineer
description:
+ Rotterdam

+ IT

+ 40 uur

**Beschrijving van**
**deze vacature**
--------------------------------------


Join us as an Operation Research Engineer at Vopak! Do you want to work at the intersection of the energy transition and making an organization more data driven? Do you believe that data and AI will play a key role in this transformation and do you know how to effectively implement an operation research capability? Then this role might be something for you.  



Vopak is well underway to become a digital and data driven organization. We have been standardizing our business processes across our terminal network, modernizing our application landscape, invested heavily in a data management program and data infrastructure foundation as well as speeding up the utilization of data to improve our customer service, make our operations more efficient, reduce our energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions and share our data with partners in the logical supply chain.

 **What will you do as an Operation** **Research Engineer?**


For this journey we are seeking an exceptional Operations Research Developer capable of combining software development & analytical skills, curiosity, critical thinking, sensitivity and entrepreneurship to facilitate the business in defining and realizing decision support systems.


You maintain close relationships with data scientists, data analysts, data engineers from the Data & Analytics team as well as with product managers and business subject matter experts. If this is you, then we’ll be happy to meet you!

**What do we offer you?**

* Become part of an energetic and dynamic Data & Analytics team which is driving Vopak’s ambition to become more data-driven
* Market conform salary depending on skills and experience
* Bonus opportunity
* Travel allowance
* 30 holidays on an annual basis
* Collective Health Insurance (contribution Vopak of 50% of basic package)
* Vopak’s own pension scheme https://pensioenfonds.vopak.com/
* We will continuously invest in your personal growth, and future career path within Vopak

 **What are the responsibilities?**


As an Operations Research Developer, you will be responsible for building and developing models and applications that empower the business to make informed operational and tactical decisions. You will make a significant contribution to the digital transformation Vopak is currently in. Your primary focus will be on creating solutions which will give decision support via our existing applications which are used by the end-users. For example, a planner who creates the planning for the next days, will get via your operation research solutions a couple of options which will accelerate the creation of a planning and improve the quality of the planning.

* Design and implement Operations Research algorithms to improve decision support systems.
* Develop mathematical models for operational and tactical decision-making processes.
* Analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable solutions.
* Optimize (tank) planning and scheduling capabilities
* Deploy solutions in production via our CI/CD pipeline

**What do we expect from you as an Operation Research Engineer?**


The ideal candidate enjoys discovering and solving business problems. He or she has a strong results driven personality with a high level of enthusiasm, energy and confidence and always being a critical thinker. Ability to communicate complex findings and ideas in plain language. Ability to change direction quickly, proactively seeking clarification of requirements and directions and take responsibility when needed. The role involves ongoing contact with a wide range of colleagues from different departments in a decentralized and international environment. This requires excellent influencing and communication skills, including a high level of written and spoken English.

* Academic degree in e.g. econometrics, mathematics, IT or another data & analytics discipline.
* 3 to 5 years of relevant work experience
* Excellent communication skills to convey complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Proficient in implementing Operations Research algorithms
* Previous experience in developing decision support systems
* Demonstrated strong teamwork skills
* Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skill
* Experience with agile scrum way of working
* Experience with using SQL
* Experience with Cloud data platform, data catalog tooling & data visualization tooling
* Experience with data science platform tooling, and object-oriented/object function scripting languages like Python
* Experience with AWS, Snowflake and Gitlab is a plus
* Experience with software development is a plus

**Want to start as an Operational Research Engineer at Vopak?**


Are you the Operational Research Engineer we are looking for? Become part of our digital transition and apply via the “apply” button. For more information about the process, please contact the recruiter.

*An E-assessment can be part of the recruitment process.*

 *Vopak is an equal opportunity employer. Everyone is different, and the differences in people allow us to match our ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. That's why we are curious about who you are!*

title: Data Engineer Principal

You will lead project activities and will be responsible for evaluation of business needs and objectives, in collaboration with project team and other stakeholders.

**What we offer**

* Become the go-to person for end-to-end data handling, management, and analytics processes.
* Lead your team in creating the pipeline for Data management, data visualization, and analytics products, including automated services, and APIs.
* Working with Data Scientists to take data throughout its lifecycle - acquisition, exploration, data cleaning, integration, analysis, interpretation, and visualization.
* Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.

**Who we are**
--------------

At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.



With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

**What you’ll bring**

* Experience in setting up automated testing frameworks including unit tests, integration tests.

* Advanced SQL, data transformation and data profiling skills.

* Experience with Airflow, Kubernetes, Great expectations is a plus.
* Programming languages: Python (PySpark), scripting languages like Bash.
* Basic knowledge of PowerBI is a plus.
* Customer centric, passionate about delivering great digital products and services.
* Demonstrating true engineering craftsmanship mindset.
* Passionate about continuous improvement and working collaboratively.
* Strong problem-solving skills coupled with the ability to convey designs and ideas to a wider audience.
* People Management experience (at least 5 team members).
* Experience working in multiple projects.
* Experience in service consulting and stakeholder management.
* Project design and planning.
* Comfortable with ambiguity, highly autonomous.
* A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics, Business or other related technical disciplines (Master's Degree is a plus).

  

In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

title: Analytics Engineer (L5) - Content & Media - EMEA
description:
Amsterdam, Netherlands
Data Science and Engineering
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.  

The Content & Media ML Foundations team, within Data Science and Engineering, is responsible for foundational R&D initiatives shaping the future of content production and promotion on a global scale. Using rich multi-modal data (text, video, audio, images), we build ML models and capabilities such as customized generative algorithms and multi-modal embeddings that enable unique content understanding. These initiatives lead to the development of high leverage capabilities and drive significant impact across Netflix. We also partner closely with platform teams to ensure that ML models and other data-driven solutions can be scaled effectively across Netflix.  

We are looking for our first Amsterdam-based Analytics Engineer to join the team. In this role, you will own and deliver insights that directly inform our ML strategy across model performance, improvements and new applications across Netflix. Specifically, you will collaborate with ML practitioners to develop tooling that provides insights into model performance, enabling a deeper understanding of model behavior and informing both improvement roadmaps and the creation of analytical products with modeling outputs. You will also partner closely with platform teams to offer analytical support on foundational systems such as the Netflix media platform and the Netflix scripts ecosystem to enable better decision-making and drive operational efficiency.**What You Will Do**
--------------------

* Amplify impact of ML models through Analytics: Drive insights across our ML ecosystem that shape long-term execution roadmaps against our strategy. Where appropriate, design and develop tools & dashboards that enable “unblackboxifying” of complex ML models, broadening the surface area of their impact.
* Stakeholder Analytics: Partner with business teams to identify critical analytical problems, applying an entrepreneurial mindset to find innovative solutions using data.
* Metric Design: Spearhead the creation of new metrics to inform decision-making and improve operational efficiency.
* Regional Expertise: Become an expert on all things related to our Data Science & Engineering efforts, helping educate and connect regional offices to existing and new data solutions.
**You Are…**
------------

* Able to develop and deepen strong relationships with a wide variety of stakeholders and have a proven track record of influencing strategic decisions through data.
* Able to thrive with minimal oversight and process, connecting the dots across business needs and independently driving projects forward.
* Proven experience with ML models and an understanding of modern ML algorithms, enabling effective collaboration with ML researchers and engineers.
* A senior analytics professional with extensive experience in data wrangling, analysis, reporting, and visualization.
* An expert in data-oriented programming languages, including Python and SQL, and intuitive dashboard/visualization design (e.g Tableau). Proficient in ETL processes and data warehousing best practices.
* Experienced at working across different cultures on a globally-distributed team, with core working hours in the Central European and GMT time zones.

Culture
You will have the opportunity to impact the business in a meaningful way, working alongside smart people who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect but also foster high performance. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems, and influence decision-making in a fast-paced, exciting environment. You can learn more about our culture at jobs.netflix.com/culture.  

Diversity and Inclusion
We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that an inclusive work environment builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

title: Clinical Science Data and AI Lead
description:
**Role Summary**

  


The Clinical Science Data and AI Lead is responsible for developing and leading the data and AI strategy, with a focus on enhancing our AI models for lung cancer screening. This pivotal role demands deep expertise in machine learning, clinical research, a comprehensive scientific understanding of lung cancer and related therapies, and strong technical leadership in data science and AI. The successful candidate will drive interdisciplinary collaborations, ensure strategic alignment of data initiatives with clinical research, and engage in securing research funding and promoting partnerships.

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**


* **Senior Oversight and Guidance:** Lead a team of scientists and AI specialists, setting clear objectives, managing project pipelines, and ensuring that projects enhance the company's lung cancer screening capabilities.


* **Data Strategy and AI Leadership:** Lead data and AI research initiatives to optimize and enhance lung cancer screening technologies, ensuring these projects directly enhance lung cancer screening capabilities and align with clinical development plans.


* **Data Integration and Quality Assurance:** Identify data gaps and implement strategic solutions for scientific and clinical needs; evaluate and ensure the quality of both internal and external data sources, integrating these effectively into our AI models.


* **Collaboration and Strategic Partnerships:** Work closely with clinical development teams to integrate and leverage external data sources and innovations; engage with internal stakeholders and external partners, including Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs), to foster collaborations that enhance project execution and strengthen scientific partnerships.


* **AI Implementation and Efficiency:** Implement AI solutions that boost the efficiency and effectiveness of lung cancer screening programs, monitoring the impact of these projects on improving screening accuracy and reliability.


* **Funding Partnerships:** Support and/or lead initiatives to secure research funding and promote collaborative efforts within Europe initially, with plans to extend our partnerships and influence globally in the future.


* **Policy and Compliance Oversight:** Ensure all clinical research activities adhere to international standards and regulatory requirements, maintaining ethical integrity and compliance across projects.


* **Culture of Innovation and Excellence:** Foster a culture of innovation within the clinical science team, promoting advanced training, continuous learning, and cutting-edge research methodologies.

 **Minimum Requirements:**


* **Education:** PhD in Data Science, Biostatistics, Computational Biology, Bioengineering, or a related field. Postdoctoral experience is preferred.


* **Experience:** Minimum of 7 years in clinical research or a related area, with specific experience in lung cancer screening technologies preferred.


* **Leadership Experience:** At least 5 years in a leadership role managing data science projects within a medical imaging setting.


* **Technical Skills:** Expertise in Python, SAS, R, and other statistical or machine learning software.


* **Knowledge:** Strong foundational knowledge in clinical trial design, and regulatory/clinical development processes related to medical devices or diagnostics.


* **Leadership Skills:** Proven ability to lead and manage cross-functional projects with significant business impact. Excellent interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills, capable of inspiring and leading teams.

 **Desired Qualifications:**


* **Epidemiology:** Experience with diagnostic testing in screening populations is highly preferable.


* **Regulatory Experience:** Knowledge and experience with FDA and MDR (Medical Device Regulation) submissions.


* **Publication Record:** A strong record of scientific publications in high-impact journals, demonstrating significant contributions to the field of AI and data science in healthcare.


* **Grant Writing Experience:** Proven experience in securing research funding through grant proposals, with a track record of successful grant applications in clinical research or related fields.

title: Part-time Data Analyst
description:
As data is at the heart of Vesper's existence, our Research Team provides the core of our product. Data and knowledge is what motivates us and connects us with the rest of Vesper, as our knowledge drives all other teams. The will to dive deep into the commodity markets, the drive to understand key parameters and the skill to ask the right questions are the pillars of our Vesper platform. The team is growing and we are now looking for a Data Analyst (part - time).



As our new Data Analyst, your mission it so make sure that the level of analysis and data of various commodity markets is at the highest level. With this new data, the team will be able to create new market overviews and contribute to the expansion of Vesper's knowledge of the commodity market.

  


**What you will be doing:**


* Find new and missing data and insights to be added to the platform
* Understand and translate users needs into actionable additions for the platform with our Product team
* Understand the key players in the industry (e.g. main competitors or potential partners)
* Provide support to research projects with other team members
* Assess attractiveness and feasibility of entering new sub-markets

  


**What you will bring**


* Quantitative skills: A solid understanding of how to navigate through large data sets, apply problem solving skills and statistical techniques in order to derive actionable insights
* Currently studying Bachelor's or Master's degree (or equivalent experience of any field). Economical or science background is a plus.
* Ability to manage time, priorities and planning through a variety of simultaneous projects
* Strong self-motivation and willingness to learn and deal with industries
* Eagerness to become independent
* Basic knowledge of analytical tools (e.g. Excel, Python, R)

  


**What you get:**


* Data is at the heart of Vesper's existence. You can help continue building our database that will have a major impact on the commodity industry
* A fun, young and innovative atmosphere
* An entrepreneurial environment where you learn more every day
* Personal responsibility with a ton of autonomy and growth potential
* A chance to see your work make a real difference and change a traditional business that is impacting every day of our lives
* A fantastic location in the city center of Amsterdam
* Great hangouts with brilliant people

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Eindhoven
As a Senior Data Scientist at TMC, you will play a pivotal role in our organization, leading projects that leverage data to provide strategic insights and drive business decisions. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop advanced analytical models and contribute to the growth and success of our data science practice.

  


**| YOUR CHALLENGES?**
----------------------

* Lead and execute complex data science projects from conception to deployment.
* Develop and implement advanced machine learning algorithms and statistical models.
* Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions.
* Mentor and guide junior data scientists, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science and apply them to our projects.
* Communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences.

**| WHAT DO WE EXPECT FROM YOU?**
---------------------------------

* Advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
* Over 5 years of experience in industry.
* Proven experience in data science, with a strong portfolio of successful projects.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
* Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, Scikit-learn).
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.


**| WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM TMC?**
-----------------------------------



TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.



At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.



As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.

  

**| WHY CHOOSE FOR EMPLOYENEURSHIP?**
-------------------------------------



We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars:


* You will have a permanent employment contract, offering you stability and security
* You will get to know your market value and have a share in the profit your work generates thanks to the individual profit sharing
* We will support you with a one-on-one coaching and trainings designed to help you develop your entrepreneurial skills
* The competence cells structure, provides you with a strong meaningful and relevant network
* The entrepreneurial lab: a playground for new ideas and a potential launching for start-ups



### **Feel Free to Contact**


### **Lieve Lievaart**


Business Manager Data Science, Netherlands


Tel: +31 (0)6 11 23 63 68

title: Data Scientist North
description:
**Your Impact**
---------------

As a Data Scientist at Ordina, you’ll dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence (AI). You’ll apply your skills to real scenarios and in different domains, such as the discovery and investigation of payment flows at governmental entities, fraud detection at banks, the development of recommendation systems in the retail sector, and the optimization of supply chains.


We are active in themes such as Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision, Machine Learning Operations (MLOps), AI Ops and Explainable A.I. (XAI). You’ll carry out development and implementation of solutions with Machine Learning & Deep Learning at our clients and assess the quality and performance of existing predictive models through to bringing and keeping them into production.

  

  

**Where you're going to get started**
-------------------------------------

Ordina North is the Digital Transformation partner for customers in the North. We advise on business challenges through smart IT technology and our extensive knowledge on executing change. We use our (regional) market and customer knowledge and use this as a basis to advise and realize change in the area of business, organization, IT & Data.


* At Ordina we use our successful concept of so-called High Performance Teams in which consultants work with a team of Ordina colleagues to implement solutions together with the customer. Our teams work on challenging assignments in which professional growth, cooperation and achieving results are key.

Ordina North plays an important role in realizing the (IT) ambitions of our customers. In addition to the Data Practice, Ordina North has 3 other advisory teams: Digital Product Management, Organization and Team Transformation, Strategy & Business Design. There are also three Development teams in the field of Java, Microsoft & Frontend as well as a team focused on Agile Testing. Together with your colleagues, you will bring expertise and experience on an organizational as well as a technical level to our clients.

  

  

**This is you**
---------------

* Master's degree or the equivalent in experience in a Data Science field as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps, or Software Engineer
* You can communicate fluently in Dutch ;
* Experience in some of the following Data Science techniques:
	+ supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms
	+ deep learning
	+ anomaly detection
	+ recommender systems
	+ natural language processing
	+ computer vision and reinforcement learning
	+ autoencoders, transformers, forecasting
* Experience in one of the following languages:
	+ Python
	+ R
* Experience in bringing Data Science solutions/software to production (Azure, AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.)
* Experience in building and implementing advanced analytics solutions and you can provide some reference cases
* In-depth knowledge of open-source software and libraries in Python and/or R for machine and deep learning
* Experience in big data and platforms such as Azure Machine Learning Services and Amazon SageMaker is an advantage

Just good is not good enough; you want to be among the best in your field. That’s why you’re trying hard to achieve your full potential, by constantly looking for ways to broaden your knowledge and keeping track of the latest developments. You’re also looking for ways to further improve yourself or to grow as part of a team.

  

  

**Benefits**
------------

* Part of our Data community with passionate and experienced peers;
* focus on working with one of our High Performance Teams (HPT) at renowned clients;
* you work in a high-tech environment with a focus on knowledge and innovation, an open no-nonsense corporate culture with room for own initiative;
* working with less travel time; remote & flexible;
* an environment where entrepreneurship and own initiative are encouraged;
* a culture where collegiality, knowledge sharing and collaboration are key;
* a pension plan, to which you are not required to contribute;
* 20 statutory days off and 7 additional days off via flex benefits;
* adapt your terms of employment to your personal wishes with flex benefits
* choice between a company car or a mobility scheme;
  
  

**Join To The Root**
--------------------

ToTheRootis a platform - powered by Ordina - for IT professionals that lovetolearn and share knowledge. It's all about deep-dives into technology and gettingtoknowthepeople behind it. From inspiring code snippetstobig ideas aboutthefuture of technology,there is lotstoexplore!So, if you are looking for inspiration and people who help each other share knowledge and get better, this istheplacetobe. Take a look around and if you feel at home, don't hesitatetojoin !  



  

Everyone is welcome to apply. Because we believe in the power of diversity and value inclusion. After all, the best ideas and smartest solutions arise in diverse teams. That is exactly why we pay so much attention to the composition of our high performance teams. So that you feel at home and can get the best out of yourself.

title: Graduate Internship Metagenomics
description:
Plants house various microbes, which together form the plant microbiome. Plant microbiomes include microbes that contribute to plant health, but sometimes also pathogens. At Rijk Zwaan, we strengthen crops against diseases through resistance breeding and the use of beneficial microbes. Precise detection of these microbes is crucial to our research and breeding program. For this, we perform in-house sequencing of plant microbiomes. As a metagenomics intern, you will collaborate in the development and improvement of our bioinformatics pipelines that are deployed to determine from our sequencing data which microbes colonize our plants. You will be engaged in:
* (further) Developing bioinformatics pipelines for the analysis of plant microbiomes, and making these accessible to other researchers within Rijk Zwaan.
* Analyzing short/long read metagenomics and metatranscriptomics data.
* Assembling and annotating microbial genomes, and mapping associated functional profiles.
In De Lier, near Delft, lies the head office of Rijk Zwaan. An international family business with a people-oriented corporate culture. Rijk Zwaan is at the beginning of the food chain. We develop vegetable varieties and sell their seeds to growers all over the world. From our position we can and want to contribute to the world's food supply.As our new intern, you will be working not only in De Lier, but also at our Research & Development location in Fijnaart, West Brabant. You will be present four days a week at your regular duty station in De Lier and one day at the R&D location in Fijnaart. You will be part of the Genome biology and Molecular Phytopathology team and will collaborate with various specialists.


As an intern you are curious and proactive. You enjoy learning from specialists and enthusiastically share your own insights. Teamwork comes naturally to you and you draw energy from working with colleagues. You are also strong in working independently. With a keen eye for detail, you carry out your research accurately. Furthermore, we can find the following on your CV:
* An HBO or WO degree in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Biotechnology, Molecular biology, plant sciences
* Basic skills in at least 1 programming language (e.g. Python or R)
* Experience with a (Command line) Linux environment (local installation, data processing, etc.)


During this internship you will work within a dynamic and international organization. You will be part of different teams, where your own ideas and initiative are certainly appreciated. In addition, we offer you:
* Internship remuneration of 500 euros per month (full-time)
* Monthly internship lunch
* Daily fresh soups, salads and/or fruit
* The space to undertake and develop yourself


Interested?


Work on the vegetables of tomorrow as a Metagenomics intern! Click 'Apply' and upload your resume and motivation. You will receive a response within 10 working days.
company_description: At Rijk Zwaan, we develop vegetable varieties and sell the seeds produced from them to growers all over the world.

title: Global Logistics Network Data Engineer
description:
**Full time**

  


Are you ready for new challenges in an international and innovation-driven environment where you can make a difference?! Apply and join our team, be curious, learn, grow, and develop your career together with us. We promise you are in for a special ride!

  


**The location of the role is in: Rotterdam, Netherlands**

  


**About the job**


In this position, you will report directly to the Head of Logistics Network Design & Value Creation and be a part of our Global Logistics Planning and Procurement team. You will be independently carrying out extensive evaluations and analyses of transport costs, shipping data, and volume flows (both raw material as well as finished goods), which serve as the holistic optimization of our global logistics network. On one hand, these analyses can be triggered in the context of internal projects or changes in the logistics network, for example by M&As or changes in any kind of product allocation. On the other hand, external influencing factors, such as geopolitical, macroeconomic, or ecological changes are also a reason to adapt the logistics network accordingly. Your task here will be to prepare any kind of data related to and/or impacting the logistics network, by doing scenario modeling, which will be the base to derive mid- to long-term strategic decisions.

  


**In addition, your tasks will include:**

  


* Data preparation and analysis of logistics data
* Scenario modeling and forecasting based on the available dataset
* Analyzing logistics network simulations and center of gravity
* Doing Multi-Echelon Inventory Optimization (MEIO) simulations to ensure cash value generation on inventory
* Carrying out the center of gravity analyses to determine the optimal warehouse locations in our distribution network

  


**About you**

You are a strong communicator with a collaborative attitude. With your great enthusiasm and creative mindset, you bring new ideas to the table, not only as an individual but also together with your colleagues. You work well in cross-functional teams and are not afraid to take responsibility and make decisions. With your hands-on mentality, structured approach, and analytical skills, you proactively seek to improve the status quo. You see change as something positive, can adapt quickly and you like to courageously help shaping the future of RHI Magnesita.

  


**What we expect from you in terms of**

  


**Education, certifications, skills & knowledge**

* A bachelor's or master’s degree in data science, engineering, or similar fields
* Good affinity using languages like Python, R, and Java and technologies like Hadoop, Git/SVN, JIRA, etc
* Certification to work with logistics network optimization tools such as Llamasoft Supply Chain Guru, 4Flow Vista, Siemens Xcargo, aso is a plus

  




**Languages**


* English – Proficient/Fluent
* Any other language would be an asset
  


**Work Experience**

* Few years of professional experience in data engineering, in particular, quantitative methods, predictive modeling, statistics, or operations research

  




**Why you should work for RHI Magnesita**


You will perform in a customer focused environment. We live innovation and appreciate an open and pragmatic way of working. From our leaders we expect to drive our further transformation, to engage our people and to give direction. RHI Magnesita is a company where you can be yourself and where not only your resume and experience, but also your personality counts. We aim for global consistency in compensation policies, but also consider local common practices. RHI Magnesita is committed to support its employees through various means to enable the best possible performance.

  


**We offer**


* Attractive remuneration packages including pension and global bonus program
* Local benefits such as NS-Business Card (1st class) and car allowance
* RHIM Academy for your ongoing learning & development, incl. full LinkedIn Learning catalogue
* Possibility of up to 60% home office (depending on position) incl. allowance
* Flexible and trust-based working time

  




**Sounds like you?**


At RHI Magnesita everyone is welcome and encouraged to apply. We evaluate applications based on required qualifications and regardless of gender identity, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, disability, age, sexual orientation, marital or partnership status. At RHI Magnesita we appreciate the value of diverse teams.  

  

We kindly ask you to submit your application **online and in English**. Due to data privacy reasons, applications via e-mail cannot be taken into consideration. Should you have any questions about this position, please contact us at: talent.europe@rhimagnesita.com  

  

**Agencies may only submit candidates for positions for which they have been invited to do so by the Head of Talent Acquisition Europe. All unsolicited resumes sent to us will be considered property of RHI Magnesita and our company will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.**

  

**About RHI Magnesita**


We are the acknowledged technology leader in the refractory industry. Our company is defined by people. We are committed to diversity and know that multiple approaches, perspectives and backgrounds fuel creativity and innovation. It is our aspiration to build a workplace culture where everyone feels valued, engaged, and can enjoy a truly inclusive environment and the diverse voices of our employees are heard. We foster a collaborative culture that cherishes ideas and determination to add value for our customers. Our leadership style encourages open-mindedness, reliability, pragmatism, and innovation.

  


Find & follow us: www.rhimagnesita.com


LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube

title: Bio-informaticus data analist IBD
description:
**About the project**
---------------------

**Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)** constitutes a group of incurable, chronic, relapsing diseases of the gastrointestinal tract, stemming from a dysregulated interplay between the environment and the immune system in genetically susceptible individuals. We are seeking a skilled Bioinformatics Data Analyst with a passion for leveraging computational approaches to understand the molecular mechanisms underlying IBD and its phenotypes. In this role, you will collaborate closely with our interdisciplinary team of clinicians, geneticists, and molecular biologists to analyze large-scale omics datasets, including genomics, transcriptomics, proteomics, and microbiome data.


**About the role**
------------------


Your primary focus will be providing bioinformatic support for the researchers in their analyses of high-dimensional data. The ideal candidate will be able to:


* Work with in-house generated or publicly available genetic, epigenetic, transcriptomic, proteomic data at bulk and single-cell level;
* Aid in the development pipelines for analyzing high-dimensional biological data;
* Performing data preprocessing, quality control, and normalization on omics datasets for Biomarker identification and molecular pathways analyses;
* Be able to work on multi-omics data integration;
* Be able to master data visualization techniques to communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders;
* Be willing to stay updated on the latest bioinformatics methodologies and contribute to the development of novel analytical approaches.


**Profile**
-----------

* You possess a master's degree in biomedical data sciences or a related life-science field with a strong emphasis on applied data analysis and/or machine learning;
* You have prior experience in analyzing omics data, such as (single-cell/bulk) RNA-sequencing, DNA methylation microarrays, or metagenomics sequencing. Previous exposure to single-cell omics technologies, such as single-cell RNA-sequencing, is desired;
* Proficiency in R, Python, and bash scripting, along with familiarity working in a Linux environment using schedulers, is expected;
* Previous exposure to workflow management systems like Snakemake and/or Nextflow is preferred;
* Good verbal communication skills in English are essential;
* You are inherently driven, scientifically curious, and adept at collaborative teamwork.


**Our offer**
-------------

* A flying start to your career in scientific research.
* Plenty of room for personal development with a wide range of training & development of academic skills
* Working on large-scale and own research, with motivated colleagues
* A contract for 12 months with the prospect of extension for another 12 months.
* Salary scale: 8M: € 3.401tot € 4.816 bruto (based on a fulltime workweek), depending on experience.
* Additional benefits including an 8.3% end-of-year bonus and 8% holiday pay. Calculate your net salary here.
* Your pension is accrued at BeFrank. A modern, understandeble en fair pension
* Excellent accessibility with public transportation and reimbursement of a large portion of your travel expenses. Additionally, we have plenty of parking spaces at the AMC location and a good bicycle scheme.


**About the workplace**
-----------------------


You will be collaborating with researchers at the Tytgat Institute for Liver and Intestinal Research and the Department of Gastroenterology at the AmsterdamUMC. Both departments are home to dedicated researchers engaged in fundamental, applied, and clinical research within the fields of gastroenterology and hepatology. The candidate will be actively involved in facilitating projects in the context of inflammatory bowel disease. While you will primarily work with colleagues at the Tytgat Institute and Department of Gasteroenterology, we actively encourage you to collaborate with peers outside the Tytgat Institute to facilitate knowledge exchange.


**Let's meet**
--------------

**During the publication period, applications will be handled continuously. If the vacancy is filled, it will be closed prematurely.**


The first round of interviews is scheduled in **late June, early July**. We ask you to take this into account in advance.


If you have any questions about this position, please feel free to contact **Andrew Li Yim**, via**a.y.liyim@amsterdamumc.nl**or **Wouter de Jonge**, via **w.j.dejonge@amsterdamumc.nl**.


For more information about the application procedure, please contact **Chey Edwards**, Recruitment Advisor, via **c.i.edwards@amsterdamumc.nl**or via **+316 214 87 245**.


A reference check, screening and hiring test may be part of the procedure. Read here whether that applies to you. If you join us, we ask you for a VOG (Certificate of Good Conduct).


Internal candidates will be given priority over external candidates in case of equal suitability.


Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.

title: Student – Development Support of R and Shiny Apps
description:
**Let’s color the world!**

We are GNT, an ambitious and innovative family-run business with a colorful character! With our EXBERRY® brand, we are the market leader in the field of Coloring Foods. Our colorings are 100% natural and are made from fruits, vegetables and plants. We are world champions when it comes to utilizing the bounty of nature and strive to continuously innovate and improve natural color ingredients for the consumer. By carefully preserving all of nature’s beauty and goodness, we are able to offer our clients the highest quality and most reliable products. In the future, we also want to offer the most sustainable on the market. This is what continues to motivate us every day!

The most important ingredients for GNT’s success are our employees and the cooperation that exists between them. We believe in teamwork and we are there for one another, our clients, our suppliers and our partners. That is what makes us GNT.

*Due to the strong growth of our organization, we are looking for:*

**Student – Development Support of R and Shiny Apps** 

Within GNT we produce natural food colorants from various vegetables. In general, the first process step is a water extraction of the vegetable, followed by several refining and concentration steps. Typical unit operations are microfiltration, ultrafiltration, reverse osmosis, evaporation but there are many more. The resulting concentrates are semifinished products, which are stored in warehouses. As a final step, the concentrates are mixed and finetuned according to specification, filled in containers and shipped to customers. These processes are monitored intensively by inline and out-of-line measurements, to assure optimal performance.

**The role:** 

To empower our employees to take better decisions in their daily work, we are increasingly collecting, aggregating and storing KPI data. The KPI data are shown in tailor-made apps, written in R using the shiny package. The apps run in a Docker environment. To speed up our app development we are looking for students who can support us with a wide variety of tasks, ranging from a few hours to several days.

Some examples of tasks on our backlog:

* Many minor fixes, such as displaying time in the correct time zone instead of UTC, making hover labels in Plotly visualizations more user-friendly, fetching additional information from databases to add to certain views, enriching Plotly elements so that links can also be opened by clicking on data points, merging several apps written according to the same template (see also point B), and many other minor adjustments/improvements.
* There is a "template app" for a specific group of visualization apps. We would like to convert this template into a package (for internal use), including documentation and automated tests.
* Writing specific R shiny modules to display specific visualizations. These modules can then be called from the "template app", which makes it simple to deploy and re-use.
* Creating a template app for another type of visualizations and also turning it into a package.
* Resolving a performance issue in one of the apps. We will likely need to make a different choice/development regarding the ETL (Extract - Transform - Load) for this app.
* Adjusting the Docker environment for more stable performance.

**About you, as our ideal student:** 

* You should already be able to program in R.
* Experience with the shiny package is a plus but not required.
* Knowledge of databases (especially SQL Server) is a plus but not required.
* Knowledge of Docker is a plus but not required.

If the applicant knows other languages, such as python or C++, this is a great foundation to learn R. We can suggest online learning materials, that we have found to be very useful.

**What do we find important?** 

The GNT values are the basis of our daily activities. That’s why we think it’s important that we fit together. GNT employs people who are enterprising and take responsibility. Customer and service orientation is of course paramount! We always take that extra step to offer our external and internal customers the best service. In addition, we do everything we do as sustainably as possible. We are open and honest with each other and bring out the best in each other.

**What do we offer you?** 

* A full-time gross hourly wage between €12 and €18 gross per hour, depending on your age, knowledge and experience.
* A job next to your study for 4 - 16 hours per week, if you are available for more hours that is also possible.
* A modern working environment with ambitious developers, with whom you can always spar about the latest technologies.
* We find sustainability very important. That is why we compensate - as part of our terms of employment - your carbon footprint.
* A great workplace at a successful and innovative company: GNT is on the move and so will you!

**We color the world, so do you?**

Does this vacancy suit you? Please send your motivation, cv, annual earliest possible start date to wvhelvoort@gnt-group.com. You will soon find out if you will be invited for an introductory meeting (in Mierlo).

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime

Salaris: €12,00 - €18,00 per uur

Verwacht aantal uur: 16 per week

Werklocatie: Fysiek
company_description: Wij zijn GNT, een ambitieus en innovatief bedrijf dat de wereld kleur geeft! Wij zijn marktleider op het gebied van 100 % natuurlijk kleurende levensmiddelen voor het kleuren van voedsel en dranken.

title: Postdoctoral position in Modelling Amphibian Species Invasions
description:
Vacancy number
14891
Job type
Academic staff
Hours (in fte)
1,0
External/ internal
External
Location
Leiden
Placed on
28 May 2024
Closing date
27 June 2024 27 more days to apply


The Faculty of Science and Institute of Environmental Sciences are looking for:

**1 Postdoctoral researcher related to applying landscape models to the evolutionary ecology and invasion trajectory of amphibians**


Vacancy number: 14891


**Key responsibilities**  

Are you a curious scientist, wanting to bridge evolutionary ecology questions to environmental science applications? Does combining landscape models with real-world data, and interfacing with policy decision-makers for conservation applications pique your interest? Do you have experience with using environmental DNA (eDNA) or have a desire to learn and apply this approach in aquatic systems to help stem biodiversity loss? If so, the Institute of Environmental Sciences (CML) at Leiden University is looking for a postdoctoral researcher who has experience and an affinity with applying landscape modelling methods to study questions relating to invasive species (mainly Triturus spp. amphibians but possibly also Salmonid fish), conservation, and evolutionary dynamics. We are particularly interested in candidates familiar with Species Distribution Models (SDMs), evolutionary ecology theory (e.g., speciation, hybridization) and if possible (but not required) environmental DNA (or eDNA).

  

Specifically, the postdoctoral researcher will look at applying modelling methods to (already collected) genetic data to track and predict hybridization and invasion dynamics. Specifically, we are looking for someone to integrate eDNA data into landscape genetic frameworks to understand genetic connectivity of populations across the composition of the landscape, and how this influences hybridization and invasion potential. The Postdoc will investigate whether landscape features, such as waterbody fragmentation or elevation (e.g. with LiDAR and GIS) promote or hinder invasive species spread and potentially hybridization. For SDMs, the postdoc will be expected to overlay biotic and abiotic covariate data for different species for forecasting distributional trajectories. With these projects, we aim to deliver critical information needed for meaningful conservation recovery strategies.

  

The postdoctoral research will work closely with PhD candidates collecting genetic data through field work, and will be expected to work in a large research group comprised of 3-4 PhD students and numerous master’s students. These projects are a part of a Nationally funded research program that links many collaborators across two continents (Europe and N. America) and numerous academic institutions, private enterprises, and NGOs, ultimately offering a unique, large, and dynamic research network. Within the network, the candidate will be expected to liaise with others and potentially travel to various countries across Europe and North America.


The postdoctoral research will become a member in the laboratory of Dr. Stewart whose research has been fully funded through the Dutch VIDI program. As such you will work closely alongside a similarly funded PhD candidate and be expected to offer some degree of mentorship. This collaboration may also see the postdoc doing some fieldwork if wished. Funding for this position also offers the postdoctoral researcher the ability to attend multiple national and international conferences. Dr. Stewart is dedicated to an inclusive and open research environment to promote passion, independence, and transferable skills for whatever future career goals the candidate may have. In our research group, we strongly value a collaborative approach. Researchers will enter an environment of weekly informal meetings to promote progress and cohesion within the larger research group, while also engaging with the larger e3DNA working group (e3DNA.com; the Dutch eDNA research hub hosted by Dr. Stewart and Dr. Trimbos at Leiden University) that meets twice a month.


If you are an interdisciplinary thinker with a PhD degree in Evolutionary or Molecular Ecology, Biology, Sustainability, Environmental Science (or a related field), this postdoctoral position might be a great fit for you.


**You are expected to:**

* Be a collegial person but have a proactive attitude towards balancing your research endeavors
* Contribute to a dynamic research group involved in genetic, ecological and evolutionary analysis both within our institute but also with project collaborators in other countries
* Be comfortable and confident working independently when required
* Be comfortable supervising BSc or MSc students for thesis projects
* Contribute to a mentorship role for PhD candidates
* Attend national and international conferences
* Work with supervisors outlining research methodologies and proposals
* Stimulate students’ collaborative and pro-active attitudes

**Selection criteria:**  

The preferred candidate

* Has at least a PhD degree, ideally in Evolutionary or Molecular Ecology, Biology, Sustainability, Environmental Science or a related discipline
* Proven ability to motivate and/or encourage students and to coach them through group work
* Has excellent organization and communication skills (e.g., as evidenced through publications and presentations at conferences)
* Demonstrable proactive and flexible attitude
* Has experience with molecular data and applying landscape modelling frameworks (e.g. SDMs)
* Particular strengths with Machine Learning or Deep Learning approaches
* Strong data management, visualization, and scripting skills (e.g. in R, Python, or other) are a prerequisite. Your previous degrees ideally involves landscape modelling related research
* You are a team player, and can communicate your work to other researchers of various disciplines within and outside of the CML
* Fluent in English, verbally and in writing

  

**Research at our Institute/Faculty**  

Leiden University is situated between Amsterdam (36km) and Den Haag (15 km) and was founded in 1575, making it the oldest university in the Netherlands. It houses around 35,000 students originating from 112 nationalities, facilitated by approximately 8,000 staff. The Faculty of Science is a world-class faculty where staff and students work together in a dynamic international environment. It is a faculty where personal and academic development are top priorities. Our people are driven by curiosity to expand fundamental knowledge and to look beyond the borders of their own discipline; their aim is to benefit science, and to make a contribution to addressing the major societal challenges of the future.


The research carried out at the Faculty is very diverse, ranging from mathematics, information science, astronomy, physics, chemistry and bio-pharmaceutical sciences to biology and environmental sciences. The research activities are organised in eight institutes. These institutes offer eight bachelor’s and twelve master’s programmes. The faculty has grown strongly in recent years and now has more than 2,300 staff and almost 5,000 students. We are located at the heart of Leiden’s Bio Science Park, one of Europe’s biggest science parks, where university and business life come together.


The environmental science research in CML is organized around two major research areas: ‘Industrial Ecology’ and ‘Environmental Biology’. This makes CML one of the few institutes covering both the circular, sustainable economic use of natural resources and natural capital, as well as assessing the environmental impacts of economic activities on natural resources, biodiversity and natural capital. Presently, over 140 FTE (including postdocs and PhDs) are employed at CML. CML collaborates with the TU Delft and Erasmus University (Rotterdam) in the Leiden-Delft-Erasmus Centre for Sustainability (LDE-CfS).

**Terms and conditions**  

At Leiden University, a postdoctoral research is seen as an employee rather than a student. As such, we offer a 1-year position with the possibility of extension to 3 years based on performance and following the pay scale 10 in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. Salary ranges from € 3.226,00 and € 5.090,00 gross per month based on a full-time position. Leiden University offers an attractive benefits package with additional holiday (8%) and end-of-year bonuses (8.3 %), training and career development. Our individual choices model gives you some freedom to assemble your own set of terms and conditions. For international spouses, we have set up a dual career programme. Candidates from outside the Netherlands may be eligible for a substantial tax break (“30% rule”).


**Diversity**  

At the Faculty of Science we value inclusiveness and strive for a diverse community with equal opportunities for all. We give full support to our staff in achieving their potential to become independent academic researchers and teachers. For more information about our policy on diversity and equality please go to the diversity page on our website. Female researchers are also welcomed to join the Researchers In Science for Equality network of the Faculty if Science (rise.nu).

**Information**  

Enquiries can be made to k.a.stewart@cml.leidenuniv.nl, or sollicitaties@cml.leidenuniv.nl for general questions.

**Applications**  

Please submit your application via the online recruitment system, via the blue button at the top or bottom of this page. Applications received via e-mail will not be taken into consideration. Please ensure that you upload the following additional documents quoting the vacancy number.

* CV – highlighting any research and teaching or mentoring related experiences.
* A publication list.
* A cover/motivation letter.
* The names and contact information of two referees.

  

Applications will be considered on a rolling basis based on matches with specific projects. However, no applications will be considered beyond 27th of June.

title: Business Analyst FINANCIAL CRIME -Dutch Speaking
description:
***Financial Crime Compliance IT Business Analyst / RiskShield package configurator (Medior/Senior)***


*Do you help us as a FINANCIAL CRIME IT Business Analyst / RiskShield package configurator in preventing and detecting all kinds of Fraud? Continue reading!*


**FINANCIAL CRIME Compliance IT Business Analyst**


**Utrecht, 36 hours per week**


**Domain Tribe KYC Tech / Compliance IT**


As an IT Business Analyst you’ll enter the world of Compliance. As Compliance IT department (>150 IT specialists) we facilitate all kinds of Compliance Monitoring (Fraud, AML, Sanction, Abuse, CDD) for all our clients globally.


Transactions continue 24/7 and we need to be able to monitor these at all times. As a Business Analyst, RiskShield package configurator you are responsible for realising new- and keep on running current functionality in our RiskShield applications. We make use of modern state-of-the-art techniques.


As a Business Analyst, RiskShield package configurator you’ll be made ready to start working in one of our DevOps scrum teams, making use of these modern techniques, performing thorough analyses, together with colleagues in an Agile setting and DevOps scrum team.


*A Business Analyst is able to do the development process from analyses to design to configuration/data engineering and also helps out in testing and implementation. In short a very versatile role. Experience tells us that someone with an information-, business analyst background (functionally strong and very analytical) and a more than average IT affinity or an analyst-developer is able to pick up this role and work quickly.*

*Besides your primary role you are also capable to take over basic activities of your colleague DevOps (Scrum)-team members, like the run and change process of the RiskShield Linux application, develop and test RiskShield configurations. You will be able to develop yourself and your specialties towards a T-shaped role within the team.*


As Financial Crime specialist you’ll get to learn and understand a criminal or fraudster and you’ll get to learn the details of our Compliance Monitoring applications to prevent our clients against Compliance and Fraud risks.


**Relevant competencies:**


* 3+ years working experience as a Business Analyst.


* Knowledge and experience with configurating (and testing) complex (competitive market standard) applications (preferably RiskShield).


* Knowledge and experience with defining and describing User Stories, requirements analyses.


* Understand complex business problems, identify business/functional requirements, and recommend how best to support them through processes and systems.


* Knowledge and experience with data analyses and models.


* Knowledge and experience with Agile / Scrum / DevOps way of working.
* Knowledge and experience with common Integration technologies like, API’s, Kafka, Message schema’s (JSON, AVRO, YAML).


* Experience in managing a complex stakeholder environment.


* You are functionally strong and very analytical, data scientist/engineering affinity.


* As teamplayer you need to be flexible, curious, investigative and you’re not afraid to take ownership.


**Nice-to-have:**

o Have development and coding experience (e.g. Java, R, Python, Yaml).


o Can work on a Linux OS and Oracle database.


o Knowledge of Azure Devops tooling and pipelines.


o Experience with AWS is a pre


o Experience in a financial institution.


**What we offer:**

* *A competitive salary based on your qualities and experience.*


* *Access to Udemy, Cognizant Academy digital libraries for your continuous learning.*


* *NS business card to cover your commute expenses.*


* *25 days of paid holiday per year.*


* *A laptop and a smartphone.*


* *A pension scheme.*


* *Organization driven by technology – we have a tremendous technology backbone.*


* *Open, ‘can do’ team spirit and international environment that encourages making your ideas reality!*


**Diversity and Inclusion at Cognizant:**

At *Cognizant, we believe diversity and inclusion are at the heart of our ability to execute successfully and consistently over the long term. We recognize that our people are our most important asset. We strive to create an environment where all associates feel comfortable to be themselves, feel accepted and can therefore thrive both personally and professionally. We continue to drive D&I throughout our organization to unlock the insights, imagination and innovation of our associates, as well as reflect the diversity of our clients and communities. We are a Dutch and European Top Employer and continually drive employment recognition and engagement through employee friendly policies and affinity groups such as “Women Empowered”, “Embrace LGBTQ+” and “Race Equality Network”. For more information, see* *https://careers.cognizant.com/global/en/diversity-and-inclusion*

**Recruitment process:**

To learn more about our hiring process, please visit https://careers.cognizant.com/nl/en/candidate-journey


**Recruiter contact details:**

Name: Mukta Wajpe


Email address: Mukta.wajpe@cognizant.com
company_addresses: 500 Frank W. Burr Boulevard Teaneck, NJ 07666
