title: Portfolio Manager Research & Analytics, Private Natural Capital
description:
**APG Asset Management Amsterdam is looking to hire a Quantitative Portfolio Manager Research & Analytics to join the Private Natural Capital (“PNC”) team, which is seeded alongside APG’s Infrastructure team and shares the Research & Analytics platform.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Locatie
Amsterdam
Dienstverband
32-40 uur
Jaren ervaring
5-8 jaar werkervaring
Opleidingsniveau
Master / WO
Publicatiedatum
31 mei 2024
  
### **Dit wordt je functie**

  

**Functieomschrijving**

**Job description**


Reporting to the lead Research & Analytics Infrastructure, the role is a pivotal element in the development of a global Private Natural Capital platform and support of the investment processes for the global investment portfolio.


This Analytics platform enables efficient data processing and reporting, as well as facilitates bottom up research on investments, providing new insights and ensuring that we are able to integrate all relevant (big) data sources into our decision-making. The role is a unique opportunity to contribute to a fast growing platform that is instrumental in the investment decision process.


Being part of the investment team, the quantitative portfolio manager also plays an important role creating and maintaining solutions that inform top-down portfolio management, underwriting and subsequent management of individual investments, as well as reporting. The portfolio manager will be working closely both with the Research & Analytics team, as well as PNC investment team to support the value-creation and growth of the Private Natural Capital portfolio.


This is an ideal role for candidates with a quantitative background that has affinity with sustainable forestry and agriculture markets. It offers the opportunity to help shape the business as we grow.

 **Dit ga je doen**

**Main Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Contributing to the formulation of the longer term digitalization strategy taking into account specifics of the Private Natural Capital portfolio, coordination of execution and interactions with internal stakeholders
* Working with the global Private Natural Capital and Research & Analytics team to develop the global Private Natural Capital analytics platform
* Build-out and maintenance of portfolio specific tooling that enables collection and processing of financial and non-financial data (with the focus on sustainability and impact investing) to support the entire chain of the investment process
* Consolidation and automation of data analytics and reporting
* Further professionalization of data pipelines, the knowledge graph and analytical tools that are built on top of these.
* Perform thematic research with a quantitative angle on relevant topics to assess impact on underwriting of the investment portfolio

**Dit breng je mee**

**Job Requirements:**

* A Master’s degree or higher with high distinction in quantitative methods, mathematics, or other statistical/data oriented emphasis from a top-tier school
* Experience and affinity with financial analysis or private investments is a plus
* A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience as a quant developer or quantitative analyst
* Value creation mindset over the long term - broad minded, innovative, forward thinker
* Experience with large-language models, knowledge graphs or BI tools such as MS PowerBI is a plus
* Coding skills in Python
* Strong team player and communicator with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders
* Adaptable and able to apply themselves to a broad range of demands
* Excellent English communication skills

**What APG has to offer**  

We offer you a competitive monthly salary based on 40-hours and attractive terms of employment with a  

focus on flexibility.  

  

* A guaranteed year-end bonus of 8.33%;
* A target driven bonus scheme;
* Ample attention to your vitality and personal development;
* Ability to grow your professional network, internally as well as externally;
* Working from home for 2 to 3 days, and also working from one of our beautiful offices;
* And of course a well-organized pension.

  

For pension provider APG, pensions are about people, life and how we live together. Through careful asset  

management, pension administration, communication and advice, APG wants to help building a decent  

future in which we share our well-being and prosperity honestly and sustainably. For present and future  

generations. For today, tomorrow and beyond.  

  

APG is committed to serving 4.7 million people in the Netherlands. That explains the importance we attach  

to reflecting Dutch society. To that end, APG strives for an inclusive work environment in which everyone  

can be themselves and their unique qualities are embraced.  

  

Choosing APG means choosing a job in which you contribute to a bright future. Don’t delay, apply today! **Hier ga je aan de slag**

**About APG**


For pension provider APG, pensions are about people, life and how we live together. Through careful asset  

management, pension administration, communication and advice, APG wants to help building a decent  

future in which we share our well-being and prosperity honestly and sustainably. For present and future  

generations. For today, tomorrow and beyond.  

  

APG is committed to serving 4.7 million people in the Netherlands. That explains the importance we attach  

to reflecting Dutch society. To that end, APG strives for an inclusive work environment in which everyone  

can be themselves and their unique qualities are embraced.  

  

Choosing APG means choosing a job in which you contribute to a bright future. Don’t delay, apply today!

 **Meer informatie**

**More information**  

For more information please feel free to reach out to Thomas van der Meij. You can contact him via the following e-mail address: thomas.vander.meij@apg-am.nl. If you have any other question, please contact our recruiter Roy Tholen, roy.tholen@apg.nl.  

  

A Pre-Employment Screening is part of the procedure.


  
### **Dit wordt je functie**

  

**Functieomschrijving**

**Job description**


Reporting to the lead Research & Analytics Infrastructure, the role is a pivotal element in the development of a global Private Natural Capital platform and support of the investment processes for the global investment portfolio.


This Analytics platform enables efficient data processing and reporting, as well as facilitates bottom up research on investments, providing new insights and ensuring that we are able to integrate all relevant (big) data sources into our decision-making. The role is a unique opportunity to contribute to a fast growing platform that is instrumental in the investment decision process.


Being part of the investment team, the quantitative portfolio manager also plays an important role creating and maintaining solutions that inform top-down portfolio management, underwriting and subsequent management of individual investments, as well as reporting. The portfolio manager will be working closely both with the Research & Analytics team, as well as PNC investment team to support the value-creation and growth of the Private Natural Capital portfolio.


This is an ideal role for candidates with a quantitative background that has affinity with sustainable forestry and agriculture markets. It offers the opportunity to help shape the business as we grow.

 **Dit ga je doen**

**Main Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Contributing to the formulation of the longer term digitalization strategy taking into account specifics of the Private Natural Capital portfolio, coordination of execution and interactions with internal stakeholders
* Working with the global Private Natural Capital and Research & Analytics team to develop the global Private Natural Capital analytics platform
* Build-out and maintenance of portfolio specific tooling that enables collection and processing of financial and non-financial data (with the focus on sustainability and impact investing) to support the entire chain of the investment process
* Consolidation and automation of data analytics and reporting
* Further professionalization of data pipelines, the knowledge graph and analytical tools that are built on top of these.
* Perform thematic research with a quantitative angle on relevant topics to assess impact on underwriting of the investment portfolio

**Dit breng je mee**

**Job Requirements:**

* A Master’s degree or higher with high distinction in quantitative methods, mathematics, or other statistical/data oriented emphasis from a top-tier school
* Experience and affinity with financial analysis or private investments is a plus
* A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience as a quant developer or quantitative analyst
* Value creation mindset over the long term - broad minded, innovative, forward thinker
* Experience with large-language models, knowledge graphs or BI tools such as MS PowerBI is a plus
* Coding skills in Python
* Strong team player and communicator with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders
* Adaptable and able to apply themselves to a broad range of demands
* Excellent English communication skills

**What APG has to offer**  

We offer you a competitive monthly salary based on 40-hours and attractive terms of employment with a  

focus on flexibility.  

  

* A guaranteed year-end bonus of 8.33%;
* A target driven bonus scheme;
* Ample attention to your vitality and personal development;
* Ability to grow your professional network, internally as well as externally;
* Working from home for 2 to 3 days, and also working from one of our beautiful offices;
* And of course a well-organized pension.

  

For pension provider APG, pensions are about people, life and how we live together. Through careful asset  

management, pension administration, communication and advice, APG wants to help building a decent  

future in which we share our well-being and prosperity honestly and sustainably. For present and future  

generations. For today, tomorrow and beyond.  

  

APG is committed to serving 4.7 million people in the Netherlands. That explains the importance we attach  

to reflecting Dutch society. To that end, APG strives for an inclusive work environment in which everyone  

can be themselves and their unique qualities are embraced.  

  

Choosing APG means choosing a job in which you contribute to a bright future. Don’t delay, apply today! **Hier ga je aan de slag**

introWe zijn op zoek naar een collega die ons anti-fraude team komt versterken. Vind jij het te gek om in een multidisciplinair team, met de laatste technieken en tooling, AI oplossingen te maken die het opsporen van verzekeringsfraude gemakkelijker maakt? Dan is dit de baan voor jou!  


Wat ga je doen?


Samen werken we aan state-of-the-art oplossingen, in Python en in de (Azure) cloud. In je werk ervaar je veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Dat zorgt ervoor dat je blijft groeien. Je bouwt, samen met twee andere data sciëntisten, aan het opzetten en uitbreiden van de frauderisicomodellen voor alle business lines binnen NN Schade & Inkomen. Verder werk je samen met de data analist bij het opzetten van verschillende rapportages.


Je sluit je aan bij ons Data Science Gilde waar de data sciëntisten specialistische kennis met elkaar delen. Zo werken we heel efficiënt aan schaalbare oplossingen. De ambitie van het Gilde is om de beste in AI te worden. Het Gilde organiseert bijvoorbeeld hackathons om de nieuwste technieken te onderzoeken en te kijken of deze toepasbaar zijn in jouw projecten.


Je adviseert, gevraagd en ongevraagd, en rapporteert aan de teammanager Data & Analytics.


Wat wij jou bieden


NN investeert in een inclusieve, inspirerende werkomgeving en in vaardigheden en competenties voor de toekomst. Daarbij passen arbeidsvoorwaarden die aansluiten bij wat er vandaag nodig is én die rekening houden met de toekomst. Zo bieden we onze medewerkers de mogelijkheid het beste uit zichzelf te halen. Wij bieden jou:

* Een salaris tussen € 3.784 en € 5.405 per maand, dit afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring
* 13de maand en vakantiegeld, maandelijks uitbetaald bij je salaris
* 27 vakantiedagen bij een werkweek van 5 dagen, op basis van een werkweek van 36 uur, en één Diversiteitsdag
* Een moderne pensioenregeling uitgevoerd door BeFrank
* Volop training- en opleidingsmogelijkheden
* NS Business Card 2e klas, waarmee je onbeperkt kunt reizen, ook privé. Reis je liever met eigen vervoer? Declareer dan je kilometers
* Thuiswerkvergoedingen voor internet en een goede werkplek

  



Wat je meebrengt


Jij vindt het mooi om je kennis te delen met anderen. Je neemt dan ook graag de tijd om je collega’s mee te nemen in jouw stappen en ze dingen uit te leggen. Je open houding en sterke communicatieve skills helpen hier enorm bij. Verder heb je:

* Een bachelor of master richting in Data Science, Econometrie, IT of een studie met een sterke Data Science component, met 0 tot 3 jaar werkervaring
* Eerste ervaring opgedaan in het ontwikkelen van ML-applicaties in Python
* Praktische kennis van de data science-processen, zoals dataverzameling, opschoning, modelbeoordeling en modelimplementatie.
* Bij voorkeur al wat ervaring met (Azure) CI/CD-tools, Azure DevOps en ervaring met het ontwikkelen van (Flask) API’s
* Kennis van SQL en/of PowerBI is gewenst

  



Ties Herpers
Talent Acquisition Specialist Tech & Data

title: Agile Test Engineer Online | Veghel | Sligro | Hybride
description:
**Agile Test Engineer Online**  


***Ben jij de topper in agile test engineering die de puntjes op de i zet bij de doorontwikkeling van het grootste e-commerce platform voor food professionals?***  


Bij Sligro Food Group is Digital een zeer belangrijk onderdeel van de strategie. De food service markt zit namelijk in een digitale transformatie. Die transformatie brengt veranderingen met zich mee die ook bij Sligro in veel disciplines moeten worden doorleeft. De food business was en is sterk smaak gedreven en wordt mondjesmaat ook data gedreven. De nog traditionele organisatie moet dus worden meegenomen in het omgaan met, en de aanpak van digitale uitdagingen, in alle capabilities. IT Online loopt voorop in die verandering. Hoog op de agenda staat een transitie naar een agile en DevOps manier van werken. Daarmee heeft Online een belangrijke rol als voorbeeld, verkenner, aanjager en supporter van deze change. De eerste stappen zijn gezet. We willen nu gaan doorpakken.  


**Wat is de uitdaging?**
Sligro is marktleider in foodservices in Nederland en wil dit ook online zijn en blijven. Van de totale omzet loopt ruim 70% reeds via het Online platform, waarmee we één van de grootste e-commerce platformen van Nederland hebben. Vanzelfsprekend maken we ook de hele logistieke keten en klantervaring steeds meer digitaal toegankelijk, klantgericht en betrouwbaar. Dat dit business kritisch is, zal je duidelijk zijn. In deze rol ga je IT Online helpen met verdere verfijning van de klantreis, uitbreiding van functionaliteit en versnelling van de ontwikkelstraat, met behoud van 24/7 beschikbaarheid van het Online platform. We willen food professionals in Nederland en België ook Online écht verder brengen.  


**Naar wie zijn we op zoek?**
Als **Agile Test Engineer** ga je ons helpen met het ontwikkelen en leveren van robuuste IT-oplossingen. Kwaliteit en agility zitten in je DNA en dat draag je ook uit. In deze rol ben je namelijk mede-verantwoordelijk voor de levering en verbetering van de Online kanalen, en daarmee ook direct voor de omzet, winst en groei van Sligro Food Group. Als Agile Test Engineer weet je hoe je de bestaande visie en test strategie moet vertalen naar concrete testgevallen. Het automatiseren van testen alsmede Test Data Management en CI/CD hebben geen geheimen voor je. Als lid van een agile delivery team zorg je voor scherpe acceptatie criteria die iedere sprint worden afgetikt en vraag je ook continu aandacht voor kwaliteit van requirements en designs. Ook neem je je verantwoordelijkheid om software developers uit te dagen om code van hoge kwaliteit op te leveren, want je weet als geen ander dat kwaliteit een gezamenlijke inspanning en verantwoordelijkheid vereist. Als Agile Test Engineer maak je deel uit van het Test Chapter en werk je nauw samen met de Quality Lead om constant te verbeteren. Een shift-left in de ontwikkelstraat is een belangrijke verbetering. De rol is hybride (60/40) voor 32 tot 40 uren in Veghel. Je rapporteert aan de DevOps Lead Online.  


Denk bij concrete taken bijvoorbeeld aan:
* In een vroeg stadium beoordeel je requirements en designs om te waarborgen dat de uitgangsdocumentatie voor zowel softwareontwikkeling als QA altijd op orde is, functioneel en technisch.
* Je neemt de verantwoordelijkheid voor het opstellen, uitvoeren en onderhouden van testgevallen voor zowel progressie als regressie testen met en door het team. Je identificeert en analyseert gevonden bugs en defects en coördineert een passende oplossing. Je rapporteert en adviseert de PO over de status, uitkomsten en risico’s van de bevindingen.
* Samen met de QA Lead werk je samen met belanghebbenden om richtlijnen en testconventies op te stellen voor niet-functionele aspecten, zoals code kwaliteit, security, wet- en regelgeving, performance en beschikbaarheid. Je borgt deze in geautomatiseerde tests die stelselmatig worden uitgevoerd.
* Je bent in staat om zowel functionele als niet-functionele regressietesten te automatiseren met tooling zoals Robot Framework, Playwright en Gatling.
* Samen met je team benoem je in iedere sprint en voor alle stories zowel functionele als niet-functionele risico's en neem je de juiste maatregelen om deze met je team te mitigeren.
* Binnen je team zorg je voor een optimale data set aan herbruikbare testgevallen en geautomatiseerde en handmatige test scripts.
* Samen met de QA Lead documenteer, deel en integreer je nieuwe inzichten en ervaringen ten behoeve van continue verbeteringen van de testaanpak. De test strategie volgt meer en meer het shift-left principe, waarvoor je binnen je team de regie neemt om dit principe samen met je product owner en ontwikkelteam planmatig vorm te geven.

  


**Wat breng je mee?**
* Je hebt aantoonbaar zeer ruime ervaring met CI/CD processen en tools, zoals SonarQube, Selenium, X-Ray, Playwright, Robot Framework, Gatling, Jenkins en Nexus, alsmede Jira en Confluence.
* Je hebt kennis en ervaring van een of meerdere script dan wel programmeertalen zoals Python, Java of JavaScript en bij voorkeur ook van SAP Hybris en Adobe AEM.
* Je bent Certified ISTQB Advanced Test Analyst en/of ISTQB Advanced Technical Test Analyst of CAT certified.
* Je weet wat het betekent om te werken aan een business kritisch 24/7 front-end applicatie platform in een microservices eco-systeem, waarin continu nieuwe versies worden uitgerold.
* Je hebt hands-on ervaring met exploratory testing en test automatisering als lid van een DevOps team en je weet daar correct, snel en doortastend op te acteren en rapporteren.
* Je weet verbinding te leggen met alle belanghebbenden binnen en buiten je team om zodoende een gezamenlijke “Quality Awareness” te bewerkstelligen.
* Je weet hoe je met het hele team, inclusief product owner, testbare requirements scherp kunt krijgen in user stories, bijvoorbeeld via SMART en INVEST. Je bewaakt de DoR en de DoD met professionele passie.
* Je communiceert makkelijk en goed, zowel in het Nederlands als Engels, mondeling en schriftelijk.
* Je bent accuraat, doortastend, omgevingsbewust, inventief, stressbestendig en uitgesproken.

  


**Interesse?**
Solliciteren kan gemakkelijk via de sollicitatiebutton. Heb je vragen? Neem dan contact op met Recruiter Peet Klaassen via 06-27458974 of peetklaassen@sligro.nl.  

  

**Over Sligro Food Group**  

Sligro Food Group bestaat uit verschillende foodservicebedrijven. Samen met onze klanten hebben we **één belangrijke passie: food.** Om ervoor te zorgen dat iedereen zich daarop kan richten, worden alle bedrijven vanuit ons hoofdkantoor in Veghel ondersteund. Zo kunnen de verschillende bedrijven zich regionaal richten op die passie.  

  

Op het hoofdkantoor werken we **intensief samen.** Dat uit zich in een professionele en efficiënte organisatie. We zijn **trots op onze passie** en **gezond eigenwijs** waar nodig. Kijk hier voor meer informatie over Sligro Food Group.  

  

**Voor iedereen een plek!** Sligro Food Group vindt het vanuit haar sociale hart en maatschappelijke betrokkenheid belangrijk dat iedereen een kans krijgt om deel te nemen aan de arbeidsmarkt en dus ook bij Sligro kan werken.

title: Product Owner
description:
**Overview**
------------



The world is facing an abundance of environmental and societal challenges. Recent years have seen a significant momentum surrounding the need for a ‘new normal’ where financial markets are designed to positively contribute to sustainable development.



Phenix Capital Group is an Amsterdam-based impact investment consultant, and we envision a world in which institutional capital helps to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all.



We strive to educate and inspire some of the largest institutional investor organisations with our annual global conferences and publications. We support both institutional investors as well as fund managers to make more impact with their capital.



To support our vision and growth path, Phenix Capital Group has a position opening for a Product Owner for our Amsterdam based office.


**Role description**
--------------------



The ideal candidate must have **passion for impact**, knowledge of the Asset Management industry, strong strategic leadership and **hands-on skills**.



The Product Owner / Manager will be responsible for the development and growth of the Impact Investor Database and Investor IQ. Therefore, it's important that he/she will have a few years of experience in finance as well as information technology.


**Responsibilities**
--------------------



As a Product Owner at Phenix Capital Group, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping our online impact investment products. Here’s what you’ll be responsible for:


**Product Vision and Strategy:**


+ Define and communicate the vision for our impact investment products.
+ Align product strategy with our mission

**Requirements Gathering:**


+ Collaborate with stakeholders, including developers, designers, and business analysts, to gather and prioritize product requirements.
+ Translate business needs into clear user stories and acceptance criteria.

**Product Backlog Management:**



* Maintain and prioritize the product backlog.
* Ensure that features are well-defined, estimated, and ready for development.


**Release Planning:**



* Plan and coordinate product releases.
* Work closely with development teams to ensure timely delivery.


**User Experience (UX) Design:**



* Advocate for user-centric design principles.
* Collaborate with UX/UI designers to create intuitive and impactful interfaces.


**Quality Assurance (QA):**



* Define acceptance criteria and conduct thorough testing.
* Ensure product quality and adherence to specifications.


**Stakeholder Communication:**


- Keep stakeholders informed about product progress, changes, and upcoming features.
- Facilitate feedback sessions and gather insights.
- Ensure product quality and adherence to specifications

**Growth of in-house data**


* Growing our internal database with industry knowledge

  

  

**Product Owner Capabilities**
------------------------------



We’re looking for someone with the following skills and qualities:


* **Passion for Impact:** You believe in the power of impact investments to drive positive change.
* **Financial Acumen:** An affinity for the financial sector and an understanding of investment concepts.
* **Product Mindset:** Ability to think strategically and translate ideas into actionable product features.
* **Low-Code/No-Code Experience:** Familiarity with tools like Bubble.io or similar platforms.
* **AI Integration:** Exposure to AI-driven solutions for financial advice is a plus.

**Our offer**
-------------


* The office is located in Amsterdam, the Netherlands
* Align your work with your values
* 40 working hours per week
* A competitive salary and 25 days of vacation
* Be a part of a fast-growing organization and a dynamic international team


**We look forward to hearing from you!**

introAs a Medior Business Analyst Capital Markets at NN Group, you will support the Group Finance and Reporting unit at one of the Netherlands’ largest insurance companies. Based in The Hague, you will use your business analyst and capital market skills to help assure the accuracy of our group financial & Risk reporting. So doing, you will help us care for what matters most to over one million customers. But it’s not all hard work and no play at NN. We believe that everyone works better with a good work-life balance.  


Wat ga je doen?


You will be responsible for supporting the business-as-usual data management operational tasks, such as setting up financial instruments, portfolios and bank accounts in our internal systems. You will also support internal stakeholders in Finance and Risk and external data vendors by dealing with all kinds of data-related issues.


In addition, you will:

* Challenge inconsistencies in data-related information and propose improvements when you spot inefficiencies in data management processes
* Validate the definition of business terms and support the data governance office

* Design and deliver the functional requirement specification document for mid- big projects that involve implementing new data management processes

Wat wij jou bieden


At NN, we invest in an inclusive, inspiring work environment and the skills and competencies of our people. We match this with employee benefits that are in line with what is needed today and in the future. So doing, we offer our employees the opportunity to get the best out of themselves. In addition, we can offer:

* A salary between €3973,- and €5675,- based on 36 hours a week and depending on your knowledge and experience
* A 13th month and holiday allowance, paid with your monthly salary
* 27 vacation days for a 5-day working week and one Diversity Day
* A modern pension administered by BeFrank
* Plenty of training and learning opportunities, with generous personal development budgets and a Young Professionals Programme for our future leaders
* An NS Business Card 2nd class, which offers you unlimited travel, also privately. And/or compensation for commuting costs

We work hybrid at NN. In consultation with your team, you may decide when, where and how you work. While you’ll officially be based in The Hague, 3-4 days a wee k, your office could be anywhere.

  



Wat je meebrengt


We are looking for a person with a passion for data, who is driven by continuous improvement. You have a proactive mindset and strong analytical and systematic (execution) skills. You are not fazed by changing priorities and you’re good at solving problems. Collaborative and communicatively strong in English (Dutch would be a bonus), you can interact with a wide range of stakeholders and easily make contact with your colleagues. While you can challenge data-related issues, you should also be able to take direction. Furthermore, you enjoy documenting and proposing standardized processes and work instructions, and you have:

* At least 4 years of relevant experience as a Business/ Data Analyst at an asset management company or a comparable financial services company
* Knowledge of financial instruments such as bonds, equities and derivatives
* Eagerness to work (or learn to work) with systems like MarkitEDM, SimCorp Dimension and S&P Markit
* Some experience working with data vendors, such as Bloomberg or Refintiv
* A basic understanding of static data setups, such as instruments, parties and portfolios is a plus

title: Medior Data Analyst Engineer
description:
Coolgradient is a fast-growing green-tech start-up with a clear vision to make our digital footprint more sustainable.

**Why?**

Every swipe, every like, every TikTok video we upload, every Zoom call we have, every Netflix video we watch, or everything we buy online is all processed and depends on… data centers. However, these data centers consume large amounts of energy due to the underlying technology we use every day all day.

**How?**

We have developed an AI-based analytics platform that captures the entire data center (DC) infrastructure—"from roof to room"—to bring the whole DC into a more optimal state. This platform saves energy, water, and scope 3 emissions while increasing reliability and sustainability in data centers across countries like Germany, France, the UK, Australia, and The Netherlands.

We are looking for a Medior Data / Analytics Engineer that can help us develop and scale our modern data warehouse aka 'data / analytics factory'

**About the Role**At Coolgradient, we're driven by our mission to create a more sustainable digital footprint. As a Medior Data / Analytics Engineer, you'll directly support this goal by developing our AI-based analytics platform that optimizes data center infrastructure to save energy and improve reliability. By joining our team, you'll collaborate with other engineers to refine our data platform, contribute to process automation, and deliver reliable, governed data/information products that help transform data centers globally.

**What You’ll Do**

* **Onboard customers:** You will help onboard new data centers and map their data according to our platform's standards, ensuring seamless integration into our analytics system.
* **Process and Model Data:** Utilize tools like Snowflake and dbt to process and model data effectively, turning raw data into insights that drive decisions.
* **Optimize ELT Pipelines:** Develop and maintain efficient ELT pipelines capable of managing billions of records, focusing on scalability and performance.
* **Improve Data Models:** Work on improving and extending our current dimensional data models to enhance data analysis and utility.
* **Enhance Performance:** Optimize queries and the overall performance of data pipelines to ensure high efficiency and responsiveness.
* **Data Availability:** Take responsibility for maintaining the data warehouse to ensure continuous data availability for data product consumers.
* **Automate Data Processes:** Collaborate with senior engineers to automate and generalize data processing, increasing efficiency and reducing manual workload.
* **Integrate Data Science Models:** Contribute to integrating our data science models and processes into our data pipelines, enhancing our platform's capabilities.
* **Explore New Technologies:** Optional: Bring interest or experience with graph technology (e.g., Neo4j) to explore innovative data structuring and analysis techniques.

Job requirements

* Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
* Solid expertise in SQL and familiarity with Python.
* Experience with Snowflake and dbt, including Jinja coding.
* Strong knowledge of dimensional data modelling and query optimization to enable building models that are efficient / can scale
* A proactive attitude toward continuous improvement.
* Experience in handling data in complex environments.
* Familiarity with the Azure cloud.
* *Optional*: be able to utilize Git, Visual Studio Code and Jira for version control development workflows and task management
* *Optional*: Experience or interest in graph technology (e.g., Neo4j).

**Perks:**

* Working on making the world of data centers more sustainable
* Enjoy a competitive salary, pension scheme, holiday allowance, and disability insurance.
* Our goal is to increase our impact and grow. We want you to grow with us and offer an Employee Stock Option Plan.
* A hybrid home-office-remote policy with flexible working hours where we value your regular presence to enjoy team dynamics, but we like to support the flexibility that fits your daily rhythm and preference.
* Lots of mobility options, where we provide a public transportation subscription, or company bike, or we’ll reimburse your travels when you prefer to use your own means of mobility.
* Lots of opportunities for professional growth and development
* Join activities like meetups or (business) events.
* Work abroad with the team, where we combine good weather, a great environment, and good food.
* And above all: a fun and enthusiastic team that values a diverse and transparent culture.

**Visa:**

At our company, we highly appreciate and encourage diversity. We believe it is crucial to achieving success and being the responsible company we want to be. However, *our company currently cannot sponsor any work visas.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: €35,00 - €50,00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

title: Senior Data Analyst Engineer
description:
Coolgradient is a fast-growing green-tech start-up with a clear vision to make our digital footprint more sustainable.

**Why?**

Every swipe, every like, every TikTok video we upload, every Zoom call we have, every Netflix video we watch, or everything we buy online is all processed and depends on… data centers. However, these data centers consume large amounts of energy due to the underlying technology we use every day all day.

**How?**

We have developed an AI-based analytics platform that captures the entire data center (DC) infrastructure—"from roof to room"—to bring the whole DC into a more optimal state. This platform saves energy, water, and scope 3 emissions while increasing reliability and sustainability in data centers across countries like Germany, France, the UK, Australia, and The Netherlands.

We are looking for a Senior Data / Analytics Engineer that can help us develop and scale our modern data warehouse aka 'data / analytics factory'  
**About the Role**  
At Coolgradient, we're working to redefine the digital footprint by making data centers more energy efficient. As a Senior Data Engineer, you'll be instrumental in guiding our AI-based platform that optimizes data center infrastructure, ensuring reliable and sustainable operations. Your leadership will shape the architecture, standardize processes, and enhance data pipeline automation, enabling our team to deliver impactful data solutions that meet the evolving demands of the industry globally.

**What You’ll Do**

* **Architect Analytical Data Solutions:** Design comprehensive data architecture patterns and automate data pipelines with a focus on scalability, performance, and integration of Data Science models.
* **Design Data Models that scale:** Design, develop, and optimize dimensional / 3NF / Data Vault data models to enhance the accuracy and utility of our data.
* **Optimize our Data Warehouse:** Design and optimize our Snowflake data warehouse to ensure efficient data storage and retrieval. Optimize queries and overall data pipeline performance to maintain system efficiency and responsiveness.
* **Mentorship:** Mentor and coach junior data engineers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
* **Collaborate Across Teams:** Work closely with other departments to streamline data automation and ensure seamless data flow across the organization.
* **Integrate MLOps:** Guide the integration of MLOps with data pipelines, enhancing the platform's machine learning capabilities.
* **Develop efficient ELT Pipeline patterns:** Create templates for robust ELT pipelines using dbt to handle billions of records, ensuring high performance and scalability.

Job requirements

* Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
* Ability to design data architectures, patterns, and automation workflows.
* At least 5 years of experience in data design and ETL/ELT pipeline building.
* Strong knowledge of dimensional data modelling
* Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Jinja coding using dbt.
* Advanced expertise in Snowflake and Azure cloud platforms.
* Be able to optimize the performance of Snowflake / know how how to optimize SQL so it can scale
* Problem-solving skills to standardize data processes across diverse data centers
* Proactive attitude with a focus on continuous improvement.
* Ability to coach junior / medior team members effectively.
* *Optional*: be able to use Data Vault modelling
* *Optional*: be able to utilize Git, Visual Studio Code and Jira for version control development workflows and task management
* *Optional*: Experience or interest in graph technology (e.g., Neo4j).

**Perks:**

* Working on making the world of data centers more sustainable
* Enjoy a competitive salary, pension scheme, holiday allowance, and disability insurance.
* Our goal is to increase our impact and grow. We want you to grow with us and offer an Employee Stock Option Plan.
* A hybrid home-office-remote policy with flexible working hours where we value your regular presence to enjoy team dynamics, but we like to support the flexibility that fits your daily rhythm and preference.
* Lots of mobility options, where we provide a public transportation subscription, or company bike, or we’ll reimburse your travels when you prefer to use your own means of mobility.
* Lots of opportunities for professional growth and development
* Join activities like meetups or (business) events.
* Work abroad with the team, where we combine good weather, a great environment, and good food.
* And above all: a fun and enthusiastic team that values a diverse and transparent culture.

**Visa:**

At our company, we highly appreciate and encourage diversity. We believe it is crucial to achieving success and being the responsible company we want to be. However, *our company currently cannot sponsor any work visas*

title: .Net Back-end Developer-Tacx
description:
**.Net Back-end Developer**  



*Are you a Cloud API Developer who is passionate about creating maintainable and highly*

*scalable solutions that will enable our users to push their limits and become better athletes?*

*Are you looking for a sporty working environment with fanatic cyclists, triathletes and*

*experienced developers? If so, join us and push your limits anywhere, any time of the year.*

As a Cloud Developer you will participate in the development of our APIs to support the


Tacx Apps and integration with Garmin Connect. In this role, you will be working closely


with the Product owner and other team members to implement new features and align the


way of working.


**The Software & App Development team**

The Tacx app (available for IOS, Android and Windows) connects with Tacx trainers and


makes indoor cycling more realistic, challenging and fun. With our extensive collection of


real-life videos, we are serving thousands of cyclists worldwide and helping them push


their limits and reach their goals. In this client-facing product environment we


continuously need to improve performance, quality, features and design. Next to this, we


aim to join the Garmin ecosystem, creating an all-season cycling experience.


The software & app development team has grown rapidly in the past years. Currently, it


consists of 40 people spread across 4 teams with 10 different nationalities.


Next to this we aim to join the Garmin ecosystem, creating an all-season cycling


experience.


**What are your main tasks and responsibilities?**


* Implement a high quality and scalable solution together with our team of developers,

designers, automation engineers and testers.


* Pro-actively address any issues or bugs and solve these if prioritized.
* Adhere to principles, patterns and practices together with the team.
* Participate in code reviews.
* Partner with the Product team and Business analysts to create new concepts and

features.


* Mentor junior developers and share knowledge that benefit their skill development.

**What do we expect from you?**

* You hold a few years of experience working with the .NET framework and C#

programming language.


* Experience with web programming frameworks like ASP.NET Core (REST APIs).
* Proven experience with Azure and a good understanding of git and CI/CD workflows.
* Working experience in an Agile/Scrum way is a plus.
* Experience with distributed runtimes, such as Dapr / Microsoft Orleans is a plus.
* Experience with (near) real-time data processing is a plus.
* Experience with Gaming backend UDP networks is a plus.
* You can explain complex technology matters in simple terminology.
* You are genuinely curious and constantly striving to learn.
* Good communication skills in English and preferably Dutch.
* You are someone who inspires others with his/her passion and ambition.
**What we offer you?**

We offer you the opportunity to contribute to the ambitions and success of a globally


growing company. You will share your passion and engage in ambitious and challenging


projects. While using your skills you will have a direct impact on our current focus and


future direction.


Besides a competitive salary, 27 holiday days a year, holiday allowance and a performance


bonus we also offer flexible working hours, training opportunities, a good pension plan and


attention for personal development. In addition, you have the option to participate in the


Garmin stock program and receive an attractive reduction on Tacx and Garmin products.


All present in an inspiring, diverse, multicultural and sporty work environment. For the


right candidate who is not living close to our Oegstgeest office, we offer relocation support.


**Do you want to work at Tacx, a Garmin company?**

If you feel excited by being part of this inspiring and sporty work environment and you


think your personal skills and professional qualities match the job requirements, we look


forward to receiving your job application, together with a Curriculum Vitae. If you have


questions about this position or the process do not hesitate, grab your phone and app or


call Dré Schellekens, Talent Acquisition Consultant, +31 6 28558033 or send an e-mail to


dre.schellekens@garmin.com
company_addresses:
1200 E. 151st Street 
Olathe, KS 66062 United States

title: Java Backend Developer-Tacx
description:
**Java backend developer**

Tacx – a Garmin Company  

  



*Are you an experienced Java Software Developer who is passionate about creating*

*maintainable and highly scalable solutions? Would you like to create an all-season sports*

*experience that will enable our users to push their limits and become better athletes? Are*

*you looking for a sporty working environment with fanatic cyclists, triathletes and*

*experienced developers? If so, join us and push your limits anywhere, any time of the year.*

The Tacx app (available for IOS, Android, Windows and Mac) connects with Tacx trainers


and makes indoor cycling more realistic, challenging and fun. Together with the Garmin


Connect App, which provides a full view of health and fitness data, we help our users to


push their limits and reach their goals by combining indoor and outdoor cycling: an all-



season cycling experience. In this client-facing product environment we continuously


need to improve performance, quality, features and design.


We are looking for a **Java Software Engineer** who has a passion for technology. You will


have the chance to develop highly scalable, supportable, and reliable APIs that service the


Tacx products in the entire Garmin ecosystem. Your main area of focus will be on the


Garmin Connect APIs.


**The App Development team**

The App Development team consists of 40 people spread across 4 teams with more than


10 different nationalities. We collaborate closely with our colleagues in the USA, Romania


and Taiwan to create an all-season cycling experience.


You will participate in the full lifecycle of development from conception, analysis, design,


implementation, testing and deployment, and use Garmin and Third-Party Developer


APIs to support innovative features across Garmin devices, web, and mobile platforms.


**What are your main tasks and responsibilities?**


* Implement large-scale, highly available, distributed solutions together with our team

of developers, designers, automation engineers and testers.


* Pro-actively address any issues or bugs and solve these if prioritized.
* Adhere to principles, patterns and practices together with the team.
* Participate in code reviews.
* Partner with the Product team and Business analysts to create new concepts and

features.


* You will be responsible for performing builds and deployments to various testing and

development environments.


**What do we expect from you?**

* A Bachelor of Science or above in Computer Science, Information Technology,

Computer Engineering, or equivalent work experience


* 5+ years of experience in designing and developing scalable enterprise-level backend

solutions, in Java and Spring.


* Significant experience with coding and tuning data structures and REST Services (3+

years).


* You are experienced with web standards, usability, and accessibility principles.
* Strong and effective verbal and written communication skills (in English).
* You are team-oriented, possess a positive attitude, and work well with others.
* You are flexible and able to work effectively and proactively in a fast-paced

environment.


It’s a plus if you have experience with HBase, Spring Boot, Rabbit MQ, SQL Server,


Elasticsearch, Kafka, Redis, Memcached, Docker, Kubernetes, FIT SDK.


**What we offer you?**

We offer you the opportunity to contribute to the ambitions and success of a globally


growing company. You will share your passion and engage in ambitious and challenging


projects. While using your skills you will have a direct impact on our current focus and


future direction.


Besides a competitive salary, 27 holiday days a year, holiday allowance and a performance


bonus we also offer flexible working hours, training opportunities, a good pension plan and


attention for personal development. In addition, you have the option to participate in the


Garmin stock program and receive an attractive reduction on Tacx and Garmin products.


All present in an inspiring, diverse, multicultural and sporty work environment. For the


right candidate who is not living close to our Oegstgeest office, we offer relocation support.


**Do you want to work at Tacx, a Garmin company?**

If you feel excited by being part of this inspiring and sporty work environment and you


think your personal skills and professional qualities match the job requirements, we look


forward to receiving your job application, together with a Curriculum Vitae. If you have


questions about this position or the process do not hesitate, grab your phone and app or


call Dré Schellekens, Talent Acquisition Consultant, +31 6 28558033 or send an e-mail to


dre.schellekens@garmin.com
