title: Test Engineer
description:
**Battolyser Systems is looking to recruit a Test Engineer**

  

Join the System Engineering and Validation team and play a pivotal role in the ground breaking development of the Battolyser®. As a member of our multi-disciplinary team of System and Mechanical Engineers, you'll be at the forefront of innovation, ensuring the verification and validation of our cutting-edge product at various system levels.  



  

In this collaborative, project-based environment, you'll work closely with the research team, stack design team, production engineering, and manufacturing departments. Your involvement will span the entire product development cycle, from concept inception to product shipment, offering a diverse and exciting experience. More specifically, you will be responsible for the following tasks:

  




* Responsible for the development and implementation of test strategies, setups, procedures, and protocols for function, strength, and endurance testing, including safety procedures, quality control, and data management within stack development.
* Perform testing and characterization of battery and electrolyser function of prototypes, pilots and full-size Battolyser® stacks, including electrochemical and mechanical characterization, using a variety of laboratory equipment and techniques, both in-house and with external partners.
* Work closely with Chemists, Product Designers, Material experts, Research Scientists, and Engineers to optimize performance, resolve technical issues, ensuring safety and lifetime requirements.
* Analyze test data, maintain accurate records of experiments and results with the goal of providing recommendations for improvements in performance and design.
* Assist in the design and construction of experimental setups for testing and optimization.
* Stay up to date with the latest advancements in both battery and electrolyser testing and characterization techniques.

  

We value autonomy and you will have lots of freedom, with that we expect you to show impactful initiatives and self-driven leadership. You will work with a team of fun and bright colleagues with professional background in various top tier companies all aspiring to build a fast growing and purposeful company, check us out at www.linkedin.com/company/battolysersystems/people.

 **Who are you**

  

At Battolyser Systems we have a shared mission: we will enable '100% green hydrogen’ for the world. We don’t just talk about the energy transition, we want to fix it and we expect you to feel the same way.

  

We believe, in order to be successful in this role, you need at least 5+ years experience as a Test Engineer.  

You have a background in Mechanical Engineering, Applied Mechanics, Materials Science, Energy Engineering or a related field. Good overview and steering capabilities regarding the testing activities within the three testing lanes (Function, Strength, Endurance).

  

* Preferably in Battery and/or Electrolyser Industry or other hardware-test intensive industries.
* Proficiency in Design of Experiment, experience with programming and (statistical) data analysis.
* Proactive management capabilities: Keep time, cost, quality in mind. Work along: Initiate, Identify, Assess, Plan, Implement
* Excellent communication skills, along with the ability to collaborate effectively within the team and to external partners.
* You control, steer, supervise activities and people, and are also not afraid of getting hands dirty.
* Well-versed in product design and development processes, a strong understanding of safety procedures and protocols, particularly those related to handling hazardous materials and equipment.



You are a resilient person and can work in a dynamic scale-up environment, you have a passion to contribute to the energy transition. Thrive in an environment of growth that comes with continuous change and ambiguity *(VUCA, yeah!)*. Lastly, you appreciate that this growth brings great personal development opportunities but also requires great teamwork and dedication to peak workloads at times.

 **What we offer**

  

We offer you a position in which you will have an important contribution to our mission “unlocking 100% green hydrogen”. In addition we offer you amongst others:

  

* A salary that matches your responsibilities and experience.
* 25 leave days.
* Laptop and iPhone (unlimited roaming in the Netherlands).
* The opportunity to develop and explore your own horizons.
* The perfect combination of the freedom to make the role your own and collaborative, supportive teamwork.
* An amazing team of awesome colleagues fully dedicated to exploring new horizons together.

  

And finally: Battolyser Systems is an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcomes Diversity!

 **Applications**

  

Hopefully we managed to get you interested. If you feel you are the right fit with the right motivation we can’t wait to receive your application.

title: Research Scientist Soft Robotic Ventricle Design
description:
Research Scientist Soft Robotic Ventricle Design
 Apply Now
Job description


For end-stage heart failure patients on the waiting list for a donor heart, mechanical pumps implanted in their chest are often their only option to survive. Given the high risks and severe discomfort of these devices, there is a strong need for soft circulatory devices that accurately replicate the natural motion of the heart.



In this project, you will computationally optimize soft robotic ventricle designs, additively manufacture them, and perform extensive static and dynamic experiments to quantify the soft robotic ventricle's acute and chronic performance, its efficiency, and its durability in response to realistic cardiovascular loading conditions.



The research will be conducted in the Department of BioMechanical Engineering at Delft University of Technology (TU Delft) under the supervision of dr. ir. Mathias Peirlinck and dr. ir. Aimée Sakes. The Peirlinck Lab integrates multimodal experimental data, physics-based modeling, and machine learning techniques to understand, explore, and predict the multiscale behavior of the human heart and cardiovascular system. More information on the team and research can be found on https://peirlincklab.com.



Prior experience in finite element analysis, mathematical and numerical modeling of soft matter mechanics, additive manufacturing, and experimental device testing are required. As the successful candidate for this position, you will direct the research project at hand. You will actively participate in (bi)weekly lab meetings, write scientific articles, and take part in teaching and supervision activities within the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering of Delft University of Technology.


Requirements


* You are a highly independent, motivated, and innovative individual.
* You can effectively communicate scientific ideas, and foster collaborations in a highly multidisciplinary team.
* You have demonstrable experience with finite element analysis, computational modeling of highly deformable materials, additive manufacturing, device design, as well as cross-disciplinary research.
* You have a master’s degree (or an equivalent university degree) in mechanical engineering, civil engineering, aerospace engineering, biomedical engineering, or a related field.
* You have a strong research-oriented attitude and are critical to your own work and output.
* You have excellent spoken and written English\* language skills (min. C1 level).


Please highlight your specific skills and relevant prior experiences for this position explicitly in your motivation letter. Motivation letters that do not address any of these requirements will not be considered.


Conditions of employment


* An excellent pension scheme via the ABP.
* The possibility to compile an individual employment package every year.
* Discount with health insurers.
* Flexible working week.
* Every year, 232 leave hours (at 38 hours). You can also sell or buy additional leave hours via the individual choice budget.
* Plenty of opportunities for education, training and courses.
* Partially paid parental leave
* Attention for working healthy and energetically with the vitality program.


TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)


Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.



At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.



Challenge. Change. Impact!


Faculty Mechanical Engineering


From chip to ship. From machine to human being. From idea to solution. Driven by a deep-rooted desire to understand our environment and discover its underlying mechanisms, research and education at the ME faculty focusses on fundamental understanding, design, production including application and product improvement, materials, processes and (mechanical) systems.



ME is a dynamic and innovative faculty with high-tech lab facilities and international reach. It’s a large faculty but also versatile, so we can often make unique connections by combining different disciplines. This is reflected in ME’s outstanding, state-of-the-art education, which trains students to become responsible and socially engaged engineers and scientists. We translate our knowledge and insights into solutions to societal issues, contributing to a sustainable society and to the development of prosperity and well-being. That is what unites us in pioneering research, inspiring education and (inter)national cooperation.



Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering. Do you want to experience working at our faculty? These videos will introduce you to some of our researchers and their work.


Additional information


For more information about this vacancy, please email Recruitment-ME@tudelft.nl.


Application procedure


Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than **1 July 2024** via the application button and upload a:


* Cover letter in which you describe your personal motivation and specific qualifications for this position (max 1 page).
* Curriculum vitae, including a list of your publications and the contact information of three (academic and/or industrial) references.
* Academic transcript, including grades for your qualifying degrees (BSc, MSc).
* A digital copy of your MSc thesis and potential internationally peer-reviewed publications.


Please note:


* Only complete applications will be considered.as applications are received and will continue until the position is filled.
* Screening of applicants will start as soon
* A pre-employment screening can be part of the selection procedure.
* You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
* Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.


FACULTY/DEPARTMENT### **Faculty of Mechanical Engineering**

JOB TYPE### **Research, development, innovation**

SCIENTIFIC FIELD### **Engineering**

HOURS PER WEEK### **24-24**

SALARY### **€ 3.226,00 - € 5.090,00**

DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION### **University graduate**

VACANCY NUMBER### **TUD05417**


Apply Now

title: Data Scientist Speciale Zaken
description:
We bieden je


NS Business card, ook privé te gebruiken


13e maand en vakantiegeld


27 vakantiedagen en 1 Diversiteitsdag


Hybride werken


Waarom Nationale-Nederlanden


Support +20 miljoen klanten


Sterk Nederlands merk


Inclusieve werkgever


Werken aan vitaal Nederland


Snel naar:
Wat ga je doen?
Wat wij bieden
Je werkweek
Wat breng je mee
Je collega's
Je werkplek
introWe zijn op zoek naar een collega die ons anti-fraude team komt versterken. Vind jij het te gek om in een multidisciplinair team, met de laatste technieken en tooling, AI oplossingen te maken die het opsporen van verzekeringsfraude gemakkelijker maakt? Dan is dit de baan voor jou!  


Wat ga je doen?


Samen werken we aan state-of-the-art oplossingen, in Python en in de (Azure) cloud. In je werk ervaar je veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Dat zorgt ervoor dat je blijft groeien. Je bouwt, samen met twee andere data sciëntisten, aan het opzetten en uitbreiden van de frauderisicomodellen voor alle business lines binnen NN Schade & Inkomen. Verder werk je samen met de data analist bij het opzetten van verschillende rapportages.


Je sluit je aan bij ons Data Science Gilde waar de data sciëntisten specialistische kennis met elkaar delen. Zo werken we heel efficiënt aan schaalbare oplossingen. De ambitie van het Gilde is om de beste in AI te worden. Het Gilde organiseert bijvoorbeeld hackathons om de nieuwste technieken te onderzoeken en te kijken of deze toepasbaar zijn in jouw projecten.


Je adviseert, gevraagd en ongevraagd, en rapporteert aan de teammanager Data & Analytics.


Wat wij jou bieden


NN investeert in een inclusieve, inspirerende werkomgeving en in vaardigheden en competenties voor de toekomst. Daarbij passen arbeidsvoorwaarden die aansluiten bij wat er vandaag nodig is én die rekening houden met de toekomst. Zo bieden we onze medewerkers de mogelijkheid het beste uit zichzelf te halen. Wij bieden jou:

* Een salaris tussen € 3.784 en € 5.405 per maand, dit afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring
* 13de maand en vakantiegeld, maandelijks uitbetaald bij je salaris
* 27 vakantiedagen bij een werkweek van 5 dagen, op basis van een werkweek van 36 uur, en één Diversiteitsdag
* Een moderne pensioenregeling uitgevoerd door BeFrank
* Volop training- en opleidingsmogelijkheden
* NS Business Card 2e klas, waarmee je onbeperkt kunt reizen, ook privé. Reis je liever met eigen vervoer? Declareer dan je kilometers
* Thuiswerkvergoedingen voor internet en een goede werkplek

  



Wat je meebrengt


Jij vindt het mooi om je kennis te delen met anderen. Je neemt dan ook graag de tijd om je collega’s mee te nemen in jouw stappen en ze dingen uit te leggen. Je open houding en sterke communicatieve skills helpen hier enorm bij. Verder heb je:

* Een bachelor of master richting in Data Science, Econometrie, IT of een studie met een sterke Data Science component, met 0 tot 3 jaar werkervaring
* Eerste ervaring opgedaan in het ontwikkelen van ML-applicaties in Python
* Praktische kennis van de data science-processen, zoals dataverzameling, opschoning, modelbeoordeling en modelimplementatie.
* Bij voorkeur al wat ervaring met (Azure) CI/CD-tools, Azure DevOps en ervaring met het ontwikkelen van (Flask) API’s
* Kennis van SQL en/of PowerBI is gewenst

  



Ties Herpers
Talent Acquisition Specialist Tech & Data  


Wat gebeurt er na je sollicitatie?


1
Je solliciteert
Jouw CV en motivatie worden door de Talent Acquisition Specialist en manager bekeken. Je ontvangt een reactie binnen twee weken.


2
Interview(s) en online assesment
We streven ernaar binnen een week het eerste gesprek in te plannen. Voorafgaand aan je tweede gesprek vragen we je een online assesment te maken.


3
Aanbod
Zijn we een match? Dan ontvang je van ons direct een aanbieding. De Talent Acquisition Specialist loopt samen met jou het aanbod door.


4
Welkom bij NN
Aanbieding geaccepteerd? Gefeliciteerd! Om alles ook administratief goed te regelen starten we de pre-employment screening en sturen we jouw arbeidsovereenkomst toe.
