title: Senior Fullstack Software Engineer - Maps
description:
**About the Role**  

  

Uber is looking for a senior software engineer who's passionate about the maps' domain that is powering all of Uber's rides and delivery products globally. You will own and contribute to systems that reflect the representation of planet earth and its rapid changes. You'll build maps tools that help curate the map, and create user interfaces that crowdsource map data from our users. From visualizing map data, loading map layers, comparing map versions and enabling all map feature type fixes, to owning user facing detection interfaces across all platforms. You'll be empowered to contribute to the vision of the maps org and architecture that help Uber move the world
  

  

**About the team:**  

  

Uber's map is the foundation of every ride and delivery made, it is the heart that makes us able to move the world. Having the latest and most accurate map is critical to the business. The Base Map team's charter is to build solutions so that changes to planet wide road network and other map data are continuously ingested, enriched and refreshed while serving hundreds of thousands of concurrent trips by drivers and couriers all around the globe. Uber's world-class engineers are empowered to innovate in scalability, distributed systems, mobile development and high availability services.
  

  

Come join us to help solve exciting problems at scale.
  

  

**What the Candidate Will Do*** Build and own the UI for fixing the map tool across all platforms
* Build the tools for map curation. Map visualization, layering, operation enabling and more.
* Optimize storage for high load of reports
* Influence the map curation architecture and reach alignment with team members and stakeholders on the technical direction
* See the big picture and identify inefficiencies and opportunities for meaningful improvements across the Maps Platform and Uber as a whole.

**Basic Qualifications*** Technically strong, with 5+ years of experience experience building highly scalable software
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, experience writing detailed technical documents.
* Experience with Java, Go, Javascript, React (bonus points for more than two)

**Preferred Qualifications*** Building open source tools or worked on a tooling team
* Background in geospatial problem solving
company_description: We reimagine the way the world moves for the better.

title: Data Analyst
description:
As Data Analyst at Effectory you will be improving the working lives of millions of people by leveraging employee data to help companies make better decisions, optimize operations, gain insights, and achieve strategic objectives. In this role you can apply your knowledge of analyzing and interpreting HR- and employee-data in a variety of ways.

  

This role divides its time between the Product Development and Consulting with separate but overlapping responsibilities. Formally you will be part of the Data Team, that is part of Product Development.  



  

The role of Data Analyst has 3 areas of responsibility:


**Product Development (50%)**

  


Collaborating with our data scientist, you will develop data-driven enhancements for our products and services, leveraging our data in innovative ways. Your contributions can include constructing predictive and descriptive models that empower our customers to better understand, interpret, and act on their survey results.


This role involves tasks such as data collection, pre-processing, and conducting various types of exploratory analysis using survey data, metadata, and web analytics. You will have the creative freedom to incorporate additional external data as needed. Making data visible through dashboards and reports is crucial for our product's success, and you will design innovative dashboards based on the data you collect and analyze, providing valuable insights to our customers.

 **Data Analysis for Thought Leadership** (25-40%)


For 2024 and beyond, our team of consultants aims to strengthen our thought leadership capability. Building on our historical data, benchmarks, and numerous studies, we have a wealth of relevant and interesting data to share more (pro-)actively, something our customers expect from us and frequently inquire about.As a Data Analyst you will collaborate closely with our Consultant - Thought Leader to investigate hypotheses and create relevant insights. We share these insights with our marketing and sales teams, use them to present during events as well as for our customer facing teams, helping them in both their commercial and advisory tasks.


**Custom Data Analysis for** **Customers (10-25%)**

  


Although we do not actively offer custom data analyses to customers, around 30 enterprise customers per year request custom analyses based on our research, sometimes in combination with their own data. This sometime involves doing an intake with the customer and possibly also an explanation of the findings.  



  

  

You are an experienced Data Analyst with at least 3 years relevant work experience. You have a master’s degree, with a quantitative character, like for instance econometrics, mathematics, or data science. Next to that:


* You have experience with modern data analysis tooling such as Python, R, Jupyter Notebooks, SQL, Databricks.
* Experience in the different phases of the analysis life cycle: data collection, extraction, cleaning and preparation, statistical methods for analysis, visualization and reporting and data modeling predicting
* Strong analytical skills and a proactive, results-oriented mindset.
* Good communication skills in English.
* If you have experience in the field of HR/Employee data that is a plus


**THIS IS US**

  


Effectory – Europe’s leading feedback specialist – is a thriving company with more than 200 entrepreneurial, young and ambitious professionals who help big and medium sized companies to collect feedback and ideas from their employees. Our mission is to work on making the working world better. Based in the center of Amsterdam, Munich and Cape Town, our multi-disciplinary teams collaborate with more than 1200 customers in ‘industries’ as varied as Retail, Production, Services and Non-Profit in over 110 countries.  



  

Historically we have a strong foothold at the Dutch market which was our place of birth and we can't be stopped! To meet our growth ambition, we are determined to only hire eager and enthusiastic employees - both starters and experienced workers - who help infuse our business with even more energy.  



  

**THIS IS WHAT WE OFFER**

* A monthly salary (*the range for this position is around* *€ 45.000 - € 65.000 gross a year based on full-time employment* *depending on your experienc**e).*
* An annual bonus scheme.
* 25 holidays for FTEs, and flexible public holiday options.
* A fun and interactive onboarding program to get to know our company and some of your new colleagues.
* A learning budget to spend on your own personal development. We also provide extensive professional and personal development opportunities and organize yearly summer and winter schools.
* Flexible working: you will be able to work max 60% of your contract hours from home (or any other location in the Netherlands).
* Budget to set up your home office.
* Yearly Body & Mind budget to spend on anything that energizes (or relaxes) you.
* Annual events, such as our Winter Party, Summer Party & the legendary Big Day.
* Additional monthly compensation for working from home.
* The option to work abroad for up to 4 months, and to take an unpaid sabbatical.
* You get your birthday off work and can also take a day to volunteer for a cause of your choice.

***This is a*** ***part-time position for 32 hours*** ***(4 days) and with a start date as soon as possible.***

  

Please note that we cannot provide visa sponsorship or relocation for this position.

 **THIS IS HOW IT WORKS**


1. *You want this job*: submit your application via the link below


2. *We are intrigued*: join a phone or video call to get to know each other a bit better and to ask questions


3. *We all think it went well*: we now meet live (or in a video call) to get to know each other a bit better


4. *We want to see you in action:* you complete a case/assessment (if applicable)


5. *The final hurdle*: we agree on terms & conditions, we sign and you start!
company_description: At Effectory, we understand the power of both technology and human connection.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Catch the Goodhabitz Sparkle ✨
  
Welcome to GoodHabitz, one of the fastest-growing international Ed-Tech companies in Europe. Our mission? To make learning as accessible, engaging, and fun as binge-watching your favorite series, scrolling through your news feed, or watching your team score a winning goal. How do we do it? We craft unique training experiences now available in 20 countries worldwide, all produced in-house at the GoodHabitz Studios. But we're not all work and no play. We invest in fun outings and events, ensuring our team has the time of their lives.
  
Behind the scenes, we're a team of goal-driven individuals who thrive on mutual inspiration and support. We're positive, creative masterminds always looking on the bright side, eager to tackle every challenge that comes our way.
  
  

About the Role
  
Are you a data explorer, always diving deep and transforming data into valuable insights? Join us as a financial Business Analyst and become an essential thinker, examining current and future business operations, recognizing improvement opportunities, and contributing to FP&A processes. Let's shape the future of our business together.
  
  

**What You'll Do:**  

* Be part of the FP&A team, evaluate current business processes and uncover risks and opportunities for improvement and streamlining.
* Play a key role in budgeting, forecasting, and reporting actuals meticulously comparing financial data to ensure precision and efficiency.
* Harness and make sense of vast amounts of data, transforming it from its raw state into valuable insights and determining the most effective way to showcase it.
* Intensively work together with, provide support and assist the Business Controller in reporting and analysis.


**Requirements:**  

**The perfect match:**  

* You have a Bachelor's degree in finance.
* Experience in finance, preferably with a background in Accounting or Business Control.
* Ideally a second / third career step, looking for widening your business scope.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to process complex data and derive actionable insights.
* Proficiency in data collection, processing, and visualization.
* Ability to clearly articulate findings and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels.
* Experience with Tableau (or other BI tool), data tooling, Business Central.
* Excellent Excel skills.


**Benefits:**  

Here's a glimpse of what's waiting for you
  
* A competitive salary package that rewards your hard work.
* 25 paid vacation days. And if that's not enough, you can add up to 10 more.
* A world of growth and development opportunities to enhance your skills. You'll have unlimited access to our treasure trove of GoodHabitz resources and MyAcademy.
* Access to mental coaching through our partner, OpenUp, to keep your mind in top shape.
* An annual do-good-day, fully paid, so you can contribute to a cause you're passionate about.
* Travel and expense reimbursement because we've got your journey covered.
* Pension and disability insurance, securing your financial well-being in the long run.
* A hybrid way of working.
* A work from anywhere policy after your first year.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
You're passionate about data, aren't you? Here's your chance to leverage your passion for data and innovative strategies and campaigns! Lead our growth and make your mark in the world of fintech. Ready to take your Data skills to new heights?


### **What will you do?**



As a Data Analyst with BridgeFund, you play a crucial role in expanding marketing data and transforming insights into targeted strategies. You will analyze customer data and market trends to measure and improve campaign effectiveness. By conducting customer segmentation and profiling, you create detailed profiles for targeted marketing strategies. You optimize marketing processes by advising on and implementing process automation. You will work in the data team alongside Data Engineers and Data Scientists, who ensure the data foundation and support other teams with their data-related issues. Your work, along with your colleagues', ensures that we operate in an increasingly data-driven manner as an organization.

 **What you will do:**


* Your analyses of marketing data and proposals for optimizations and automations will result in improved campaign conversions.
* You identify and define different customer segments based on behavior, demographics, and other relevant factors to gain better insights into customer behavior.
* You contribute to creating a culture within the marketing team where data-driven decision-making is central.
* Identify and combine customer segments for targeted marketing approaches.
* Create clear reports and visualizations to communicate insights.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate data-driven insights into business strategies.
* Assist the marketing team in conducting A/B testing.


**What we offer:**  

A fun, challenging position at an ambitious FinTech scale-up in a fast-growing environment. No day is the same. You'll have a lot of freedom and responsibility, allowing you to develop quickly and make a real impact on the organization.

  

* A good salary between €3.900 and €5.000 based on a 40-hour workweek.
* 26 vacation days; plenty of time to recharge.
* Your pension is well arranged with ASR, +4% on your gross salary.
* You receive €0.21 per kilometer for travel expenses, even if you come by bike.
* Uber(Eats), ClassPass, or Felyx credit? Customize your secondary benefits with €40 YourCampus credit per month.
* We consider your development super important. That's why we offer individual training as well as team training.
* A super funky office in Amsterdam, near Amstel station. No cubicles or drop ceilings here.
* Parties and boat trips. Friends coming along? Great!
* We throw the coolest parties and drinks every quarter. We celebrate our successes together.
* Skiing trips or partying in Berlin. You won't want to miss our fully paid trips abroad.
* A catered lunch every day.
* A good fixed workspace. You'll get a MacBook and two monitors from us. We also have standing desks if you prefer.
* A place where you feel at home and everyone can be themselves.


**Our Culture:**



What makes us unique is our culture. This is also one of the main reasons why we are growing so rapidly. We share the same mindset. We are a close-knit team of driven, ambitious people who want to disrupt the financial world. We are true entrepreneurs. You can feel it in our workplace. We work hard, but we also celebrate our successes in a big way together. Hierarchy is a difficult word for us, and we only do top-down when we go skiing together. We ask critical questions, give honest feedback, and are not afraid to fail occasionally, because failure means learning, and learning means growth.

### **What we can learn form you:**



As a Data Analyst at BridgeFund, you bring a wealth of experience and expertise in data analysis. We are looking for someone proficient with tools such as SQL, Python, and data visualization platforms like Qlik, Tableau, or Power BI. Communication skills are essential to translate complex analyses into actionable insights for non-technical colleagues and to collaborate effectively within teams.

 **What we expect from you:**


* Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a successful data analysis role, preferably within a marketing context.
* Experience with data tools such as SQL, Python, and preferably Databricks.
* Knowledge of statistical methods for analyzing marketing data.
* Understand marketing fundamentals for linking analyses and processes.
* Ability to communicate complex analyses in a meaningful way.
* You are a team player, yet independent and resourceful.
* Fluent in English.

  

**About BridgeFund: a FinTech scale-up on a mission**



BridgeFund, founded in 2018 in Amsterdam, is a club of headstrong and sometimes a little impatient go-getters who want to make social impact. A group of 90 ambitious, positive rebels. A group that works hard, but doesn't take itself too seriously. A team of like-minded people, committed to the same mission: to show that a bank-free world is easier, more efficient, fairer and therefore more fun. What we do. Build a digital bridge between idle capital of successful entrepreneurs and working capital for ambitious entrepreneurs. Through smart technology, we analyze a company's financial data at lightning speed and carefully to determine the maximum amount an entrepreneur can borrow responsibly. On the other hand, we have investors who make all this possible! And together, we are moving the Netherlands forward.

  


Dear agencies: if we need external recruiters to help us fill vacancies, it will be through HirePort. Through this form, you can register yourself there as an external recruiter: https://hireport.nl/bridgefund/. That also means you don’t have to call me or a hiring manager! :)

title: Youda - Business Analyst
description:
Join us at Playtika (NASDAQ: PLTK), where we're driven by the belief life needs play. We're on a mission to deliver infinite ways to play using cutting-edge technologies like AI and machine learning to craft immersive experiences that connect, inspire and entertain millions of players worldwide.


From our start as a small mobile games company founded in Israel to our current position as a publicly traded company and industry leader, we continue to be a dominant force in interactive entertainment. With a diverse portfolio of award-winning, category-leading Casual and Social Casino-themed games, including nine of the top 100 highest-grossing mobile games in the US, we're setting the standard for excellence.



Our success story is co-authored by a dynamic team of storytellers, strategists, creators and data scientists who thrive on innovation. We are home of the best, advancing an inclusive culture that embraces our core values and reflects our agile DNA.



With a strong financial foundation, disciplined operations, unwavering player-focused approach and relentless can-do spirit, we're well-positioned for sustained growth. If you're ready to join the driving force behind the evolution of interactive entertainment, we invite you to come play with us.

**ABOUT YOUDA GAMES**



We are growing! Therefore, we are looking for a talented **BUSINESS ANALYST** for our studio in Amsterdam. Better known as **YOUDA GAMES**. From our studio we supply the world with Governor of Poker 3 and Monopoly Poker.



We want users to have a fun time playing our games, it's that simple. Making games our fans can't stop playing is our goal. Our studio is loaded with motivated, talented and creative people that will make any possible effort to fulfill our promise. We are fast-paced, nimble and laugh a lot, at least we try to



We work hard, but also prioritize our fun, collaborative and well-balanced culture.


**ABOUT THE JOB!**



Business Analytics Playtikans have a talent for identifying bottlenecks and areas of growth potential using their ANALYTICAL skills. And want to work at a growing international company with great perks and benefits.


**Job Description & Responsibilities:**



As a Business Analyst you'll embark on an epic quest to wield data as your weapon and conquer the challenges of user engagement, growth, and monetization. You'll join forces with our product managers and game makers to unlock the secrets of gameplay enhancement and user retention, all while enjoying the excitement of the gaming universe!



Last but not least you're able to tell the data as a story and make it accessible through proper visualization for the rest of the studio.


**Requirements:**


* 3+ years of analytical work experience, preferably for a web or mobile company, or in the online gaming industry.
* Strong SQL skills with experience in querying large, complex data sets.
* High proficiency in data visualization tools (preferably Tableau)
* A methodological approach to data together with the ability to present the data clearly and efficiently to support business decisions.
* High level of analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail
* Great communication skills – someone who can turn complex concepts into actionable recommendations.
* A true passion for understanding consumers' social gaming behavior and tolerance for ambiguity.


Nice to have's:


* Be a gamer yourself – as a player, you can give different insights and add extra value to your analysis and your work
* Knowledge of statistics, predictive models and machine learning techniques (Python, R)


Here's what we offer you:


* A challenging role in a diverse, international and fast-growing organization with lots of career opportunities
* Hybrid ways of working between home and the office
* A competitive monthly salary
* Bonus incentive
* Monthly Phone Allowance
* Participation in our pension scheme
* 26 vacation days
* 6 powerup weekends
* 1 day off for your birthday
* Lunch benefit
* Christmas, Birthday & Special events gifts

  


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.



If you feel the above describes you perfectly - Apply now!

  


Employee at Playtika? Click here - https://t.ly/6F9Q\_

title: RGM (BI) Analyst
Senior Recruiter - Sales and GTM (Contract 6 months) (Remote, Netherlands)
description:
Grafana Labs is looking for a **Senior** **Recruiter** to support our GTM teams and leaders, focusing on sales hiring, on a 6 month contract. You will work alongside our Talent Team to deeply understand hiring requirements, hiring challenges, organizational structure, and individual team dynamics.


In your day-to-day, you will be responsible for running full-cycle recruitment. Tasks will range from engaging with passive and active talent internationally, to guiding the candidates through our hiring journey, to generating offers and handing the new hire off to our People Ops Specialist for onboarding.
### **Responsibilities and Requirements:**


* **Proven experience** working as a senior recruiter. Experience working directly with senior leaders focusing on sales hiring in SaaS/Tech space.
* You have a network of sales professionals that you are able to present.
* Own **high-volume recruiting** across a variety of roles across primarily sales roles globally.
* **Sourcing** is a big part of your role. You are confident engaging passive candidates and utilizing the team’s networks and technical experience to engage with candidates appropriately
* Willingness to support the talent acquisition team on any hiring necessary including other GTM and R&D roles.
* Work in a **remote-first** company where **communication is key**. You are happy to face off to different time zones.
* You’re comfortable in a **high-paced** environment. You embrace change and ambiguity.
* You’re familiar with **Greenhouse** and **LinkedIn Recruiter.**
* Available to work on a 6 month contract position in the United States/EMEA.


In the Netherlands, the targeted daily compensation is EUR 500. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed in the interview process.

  


**About Grafana Labs:** There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies - including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay - manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).

**Benefits:** For more information about the perks and benefits of working at Grafana, please check out our careers page.

**Equal Opportunity Employer:** At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.

*For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our* *privacy policy**.*

title: Internship, Data Engineering & Bioinformatics (project: Data Models for the Real World: Paving the Way for AI-Driven Insights)
description:
At Genmab, we’re committed to building extra[not]ordinary futures together, by developing antibody products and pioneering, knock-your-socks-off therapies that change the lives of patients and the future of cancer treatment and serious diseases. From our people who are caring, candid, and impact-driven to our business, which is innovative and rooted in science, we believe that being proudly unique, determined to be our best, and authentic is essential to fulfilling our purpose.
The role
Join our dynamic bioinformatics team at Genmab as a student data engineer, where you will play a crucial role in supporting our scientists by creating and managing sophisticated data architectures aligned with FAIR principles. In this position, you will focus on integrating real-world clinical and molecular data into graph database models to facilitate complex data analysis and enable innovative research methodologies. You will also explore the application of natural language processing for effective data querying. This internship offers a unique opportunity to develop expertise in data engineering technologies, contribute to bioinformatics solutions, and directly impact our research in developing groundbreaking therapeutic strategies. Your work will support essential projects aimed at enhancing drug discovery and development processes, fostering your growth as a data scientist and making a meaningful impact in the field of biomedicine.*Project Background*
Translational research leverages real-world data sets to study how patients respond to cancer treatments. This research often involves integrating complex and non-standardized molecular and clinical data. Clinical datasets, designed to answer specific scientific questions, typically lack detailed data granularity, making exploration challenging. Understanding the clinical data model is crucial to selecting the appropriate variables for analysis.
This project proposes the use of graph databases to overcome these challenges by organizing data into a flexible, multidimensional structure that facilitates easier access and more intuitive querying. Graph databases, such as Neo4j or Amazon Neptune, allow for the discovery of implicit relationships within the data that traditional table-based databases might miss. Through this initiative, we aim to develop and evaluate AI-driven querying techniques using natural language, enhancing the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets in translational research.
Responsibilities* Technology Exploration: Investigate various graph database technologies and their applicability to managing clinical data, assessing their strengths and limitations in this domain.
* Data Model Comparison: Compare and analyze the data structures of graph and relational databases to identify the most effective frameworks for clinical data.
* Pilot Database Development: Design and implement a prototype database focused on the standardization of clinical real-world data, ensuring it supports robust data integration and access.
* Natural Language Query Development: Create methods to enable querying of graph databases using natural language, employing advanced AI technologies to facilitate intuitive data interactions.
* Findings Presentation: Regularly present progress and insights during team meetings, ensuring clear communication of developments and challenges.
* Bonus Objective: Develop a user interface that enables easy querying, and effective visualization and presentation of results from the database.


Requirements* Education: You are a BSc/MSc student in bioinformatics, computational biology or a related field.
* Technical skills: Demonstrated strong technical skills, with substantial experience in Python programming. Familiarity with AWS is an added advantage.
* Soft skills: Comfortable with pioneering research and creative processes; scientific thinking and connecting that to technical requirements.


About You* You are passionate about our purpose and genuinely care about our mission to transform the lives of patients through innovative cancer treatment
* You bring rigor and excellence to all that you do. You are a fierce believer in our rooted-in-science approach to problem-solving
* You are a generous collaborator who can work in teams with diverse backgrounds
* You are determined to do and be your best and take pride in enabling the best work of others on the team
* You are not afraid to grapple with the unknown and be innovative
* You have experience working in a fast-growing, dynamic company (or a strong desire to)
* You work hard and are not afraid to have a little fun while you do so


Locations
Genmab leverages the effectiveness of an agile working environment, when possible, for the betterment of employee work-life balance. Our offices are designed as open, community-based spaces that work to connect employees while being immersed in our state-of-the-art laboratories. Whether you’re in one of our collaboratively designed office spaces or working remotely, we thrive on connecting with each other to innovate.
About Genmab
Genmab is an international biotechnology company with a core purpose guiding its unstoppable team to strive towards improving the lives of patients through innovative and differentiated antibody therapeutics. For more than 20 years, its passionate, innovative and collaborative team has invented next-generation antibody technology platforms and leveraged translational research and data sciences, which has resulted in a proprietary pipeline including bispecific T-cell engagers, next-generation immune checkpoint modulators, effector function enhanced antibodies and antibody-drug conjugates. To help develop and deliver novel antibody therapies to patients, Genmab has formed 20+ strategic partnerships with biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies. By 2030, Genmab’s vision is to transform the lives of people with cancer and other serious diseases with Knock-Your-Socks-Off (KYSO™) antibody medicines.
Established in 1999, Genmab is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark with locations in Utrecht, the Netherlands, Princeton, New Jersey, U.S. and Tokyo, Japan.  

Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion
We are committed to fostering workplace diversity at all levels of the company and we believe it is essential for our continued success. No applicant shall be discriminated against or treated unfairly because of their race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, or genetic information. Learn more about our commitments on our website.
Genmab is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy. Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with your application on our website https://www.genmab.com/privacy.
Please note that if you are applying for a position in the Netherlands, Genmab’s policy for all permanently budgeted hires in NL is initially to offer a fixed-term employment contract for a year, if the employee performs well and if the business conditions do not change, renewal for an indefinite term may be considered after the fixed-term employment contract.
company_description: Genmab is an international biotechnology company with a core purpose of improving the lives of people with cancer and other serious diseases.
ceo_name: Jan G. J. van de Winkel, Ph.D.,

title: Financial Reporting Analyst
description:
**Who is Infinitas Learning?**



Infinitas Learning is a dynamic educational resources company, and one of Europe's leading providers of innovative and engaging products and services for teaching and learning. At Infinitas we are passionate about transforming the way people learn. We aim to deliver flexible, market-leading solutions that support new approaches to learning for the 21st century. The Infinitas Learning group includes Liber (Sweden), Noordhoff (The Netherlands), Plantyn (Belgium) and Leya (Portugal) as well as Infinitas Product & Technology (The Netherlands). The group employs around 600 people and is headquartered in Utrecht (The Netherlands).

 **The role**



Are you an analytical talent with a passion for data and affinity with financial reporting?



As a Financial Reporting Analyst at Infinitas Learning, you will be part of a centralized Data & Insights team. Our role as the central team is to identify business problems worth solving, that need solving, and tackle them by utilizing, combining, and analyzing existing source data from systems such as Netsuite and SAP BPC. This enables the business and customers to make better (data-driven) decisions more quickly and with greater confidence. We operate across a broad variety of domains such as finance, operations, commercial, learning didactics, and platform usage.

  

As a Financial Reporting Analyst, you will focus on turning financial data into valuable insights and reports for different stakeholders within Infinitas. Focus is on reports like the Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Cash flow and all kind of reports related to the order and sales process. With your expertise in data and finance you will manage various initiatives, ensuring the delivery of project milestones within the agreed timeframe and quality standards.

 **What you will do**


* Design, build and deliver accurate and fast analytical reporting and dashboards using Microsoft Power BI fed from the data marts
* You will test and ensure the data quality and documentation of financial data products that our team creates and ensure uniformity and consistency across reports.
* Work closely with various stakeholders within the financial domain to identify areas where Data & Insights can be used to improve business processes and operation.
* You are able to act as a sparring partner for the finance team and are excellent at reconciling data with financials from source systems such as Netsuite and SAP BPC
* Utilize a strong business acumen to identify and develop analytical use-cases with high value together with various stakeholders within the financial domain.
* Ensure optimal performance to maximize the use of the Power BI functionality. Excel in designing data models to best practices including use of complex DAX-calculations, making use of conformed dimensions and striving to push business logic to the data marts.
* Work in close cooperation with Analytical Engineers to give feedback regarding necessary design changes on data models and missing data.
* Communicate, document, and present the use of our analytical tools to peers and different stakeholders throughout the organization.
* Constantly stay up to date on new technologies in the analytical reporting, dashboards, and visualization space and where they may fit our initiatives.

 **Who you are**


* Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment handling multiple activities simultaneously. Exercise business judgment and make sound decisions under pressure.
* Take initiative, are transparent, and deliver high-quality results. We take it for granted that you are responsible, and solutions oriented.
* An analytical, innovative, and structured problem solver with a passion to make data analysis a business asset by enabling value.
* Keen interest in improving financial reporting
* Recognize the importance of working as one team and can identify and develop talent. You thrive when developing people, not just products. Giving and receiving feedback is a natural part of your everyday work.
* Appreciate working with international colleagues and distributed teams.
* A curious and life-long learner with a keen interest in the evolution of analytical reporting and visualization techniques.


**What experience you must have to qualify as a candidate**

  

* Bachelor’s degree in either Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Data Science or Computer Science with a strong financial related component or a Bachelor’s degree in Accountancy, or Business Economics with a strong data component.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in data analytics and/or financial reporting: maintenance and support of analytical financial reports and dashboards.
* Designed, developed, tested, and supported analytical reporting and dashboards using Power BI. Experience programming in complex DAX calculations.
* Excellent English written and oral communication skills.
* Fluent in Dutch or Swedish is preferred.
* Working permit within the European Union.
* Can work regularly at one of our office locations Antwerpen/Stockholm/Utrecht/Groningen

 **What Infinitas Learning offers you**

  


* Competitive salary.
* Attractive and flexible employment conditions.
* Flexible working hours depending on team requirements as to how, where, and when you work.
* A job with a real purpose where you really contribute to society.

  

Applications are being reviewed on an ongoing basis. In case of any questions please feel free to reach out to Casper Fransz.
  

Please apply via https://careers.infinitaslearning.com. Applications via LinkedIn, direct messages, or mail will not be reviewed.

title: Graduation assignment - HBO - Visualize Hexagon architecture from CML
description:
Location: Hengelo, Netherlands**About Thales**


With 80.000 talents working in 68 countries, we are one of the biggest high-tech employers in the field of safety and security. In the Netherlands, where 2500 employees are based, we are located in seven cities: Huizen, Amersfoort, Rotterdam, Delft, Breda, Eindhoven and Hengelo (HQ). Together with an extensive ecosystem of knowledge partners, customers and suppliers, we work on radars for naval vessels, cyber security solutions, transportation systems, communication equipment for land forces, cryogenic cooling solutions, research & development for radar tech (in collaboration with TU Delft).


Within the innovation department we are looking forward to applying new technologies and methodologies to improve our products and engineering practice. Working together with colleagues and external partners new developments make a difference for Thales.

**About the assignment**


To model our complex software systems, we use CML (https://contextmapper.org/docs/language-reference/), it allows us to understand and differentiate various domains in our system. To provide good insight in the software design, we translate the information into various visualizations, one of which includes a Hexagon based architecture. In this assignment you’ll create an automated way to create this visualization and optimize the data within the visualization. Fitting the data in optimally is one of the challenges to be solved. A extension on the assignment is to make the visualization interactive.

**Affinity**

* Tools for CML are Java based, affinity with Java helps understand the tooling and libraries
* Visualization tools, a conversion from would be from a CML definition to SVG

**What’s in it for you**

* An interesting internship or graduation assignment within our high-tech, innovative work environment;
* A comfortable, flexible work space in a modern environment;
* An excellent internship allowance;
* Its own student association where you can participate in educational and fun activities.

**Interested?**


Apply now! Click on the button below to upload your CV and motivation!  

Please keep in mind that we can only accept students who are enrolled at a school during the whole internship or graduation period.
company_description: Thales is a global technology leader with more than 77,000 employees on five continents, investing in digital and 'deep tech' innovations to build a future we can all trust.

title: Head of Engineering - Hardware Electronics
description:
### **About Eddytec**



Carbon fibre composites are lightweight and strong materials that can help solve climate issues. These materials are used to make airplanes lighter, save fuel and with that reduce CO2 emissions or to make more efficient wind turbines. But they are inherently difficult to test for cracks and that slows down their adoption in the industry. At Eddytec we are solving this problem. We are developing a novel non-destructive testing device that will make finding defects faster and simpler. With that we’ll accelerate innovation and contribute to sustainability in a number of industries.

  

Eddytec is a young ambitious startup that develops cutting-edge hardware for the aviation, energy and other sectors. We are located at the vibrant Science Park in Amsterdam amidst tech companies, research institutes and universities.

### **The role**



We are looking for a Head of Engineering with a hardware electronics design background. This is a key role in our technology and product development. It combines hands-on work and building and leading the technical team.

  

* ️ You have tons of PCB design and debugging experience.
  

 You love working with a diverse team, sharing knowledge and you’re always learning. You are committed to enable your team to do their best work.

  

 You are energized by challenging problems and you can get people around you excited about your solution.

  

If that sounds like you and you’ll join us, your first goal will be to take ownership of the technical roadmap and make sure it is in alignment with the business needs and customer requirements. The second milestone will be to deploy and successfully run a demonstrator in a customer pilot.

### **Daily Tasks**



Your day to day tasks will include:


* Turning customer needs into cool demonstrator and product designs.
* Taking the helm on electrical design.
* Guiding data processing and visualization.
* Leading prototype testing and validation.
* Defining project timelines and budgeting.
* Crafting clear test reports and technical notes.
* Exploring and analyzing competitive technologies.
* Leading and expanding the technical team.
* Engaging in customer discussions.
* Assisting with grant applications.

  


### **Your profile**


* You're an expert in PCB design and electronics.
* You've got 10+ working experience ideally in a startup or scaleup.
* You've got experience in device physics, sensors, data acquisition.
* You are able to navigate complex regulatory environments to ensure product compliance from concept to market.
* You are naturally curious and thrive on challenges, demonstrating exceptional problem-solving skills, a flexible thinking approach, and a knack for innovative solutions.
* You’re experienced in leading diverse technical teams, embracing a variety of cultures, backgrounds, and perspectives.
* You thrive under pressure, keeping cool and spreading positive vibes to motivate the team.
* You are a confident and fair team player who not only excels in your role but also actively supports and celebrates the successes and growth of your colleagues.
* You're a great communicator who can write clear, concise reports and connect well with both teammates and clients.
* You have solid knowledge in programming in Python, R or C/C++ .
* Please note, you must have a valid working permit for the Netherlands.

  

Learn more about us at www.eddytec.eu

title: Data Analyst Intern
description:
**All Posting Locations:** Nijmegen, Gelderland, NL
**Job Functions:** IT
**Date Published:** April 16, 2024
**Ref#:** R-81492
  

ABOUT THE ROLE
Job Description
Data Analyst Intern
**Start date:** August/September 2024


**Duration:** 5 to 6 months


**Platform/Project:** R&D Digital Transformation


**Location**: Amsterdam


You will be part of an international small team with the ambition to drive digital technology forward for Kraft Heinz R&D International Zone. Expect to be part of the team from day one. Strong learning experience on data visualization with many practical deliverables which will be used directly by the organization.


 Assignments and key activities:


* Support dashboard creation to support day to day work of R&D functions
* Support digital transformation across the R&D team (e.g. communication about changes- identification of digital tools required by R&D team)
* Investigate new tools and trends in Digital world
* Participate & contribute into meetings related to Digital strategy
* Collaboration with Digital Ambassadors

Requirements:


* Having a Business Analytics/Management/Information Technology background
* Data visualization skills (Tableau, Power BI)
* Being comfortable with working with big data
* Having a structured personality with ability to learn fast
* Previous internship with data visualization or experience with data analytics is a plus
* You should have strong communication skills and fluency in English, both written and verbal (Dutch is not a requirement but other languages are a plus)
* You are enrolled at a university for at least 50% study load for the duration of the internship.
* **NOTE: EU working** **rights are required** ***(Either you have EU Citizenship, you are studying in the Netherlands or have relevant student work visa)***

**Recruitment process:**

CV selection based on hard requirements such as EU working rights Online Pymetrics assessment Online Pymetrics video assessment Online Screening Interview via Microsoft Teams Hiring manager interview Amazing internship opportunity that can kickstart your career!


*Note: The recruitment process can take 4/6 weeks in total*


**What we offer you**:


We take interns seriously. You can expect from us to give you 1-on-1 mentorship from one of our experienced colleagues. We will work together on your personal learning goals and are keen to hear all good ideas you have! We will give you the space and support to make mistakes and grow. Become a part of a close intern community as well as a young and ambitious work environment (including online).


As a Kraft Heinz intern you’ll be the owner of your own projects and especially of your own career. At Kraft Heinz, we provide the playing field. You change the game. Are you up for the challenge?


**About Us**


The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.


We spark joy around mealtime with our iconic brands, including Heinz, Kraft, Bull's-Eye, HP, Lea and Perrins, Quero, ABC, Master, Banquete, Plasmon, Orlando, Benedicta, Honig, Pudliszki, Wattie’s among others.


No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: *To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally*. Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and *let’s make life delicious!*


**Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy & Collaboration**


We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day. As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.


Location(s)
Nijmegen

  



**Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Underrepresented Ethnic Minority Groups/Women/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity and other protected classes****.**


  
ABOUT US
Kraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. Our emerging and iconic food and beverage brands deliver the best taste, fun, and quality to every table we touch. Worldwide.


We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. Consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress. As we drive innovation company-wide.


Our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We believe in being good humans — working to improve our company, communities, and planet.


We’re proud of where we’ve been and even more thrilled about where we’re headed as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.


WHY US
We grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our iconic and nostalgic brands.


Good isn’t good enough. We choose greatness every day by making bold decisions and challenging what’s ordinary. All while celebrating our wins – and failures – as we work together to transform the future of food.


GROW YOUR FULL  

POTENTIAL
Be ambitious. Aim high. Lead like the owner of our business. Realize your passions and purpose, here at Kraft Heinz.
company_description: Challenging the status quo takes talent. So we're growing a global team of food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers to reimagine the future of food and beverage.

title: Staff Data Engineer
description:
**All Posting Locations:** Amsterdam, Noord Holland, NL
**Job Functions:** IT
**Date Published:** April 25, 2024
**Ref#:** R-81839
**Remote, Hybrid or Onsite:** Hybrid
  

ABOUT THE ROLE
Job Description
Are you a talented and driven Data Scientist with expertise in machine learning and a passion for building robust pipelines for demand forecasting? We are seeking a skilled individual to join our dynamic team at Kraft Heinz. Join our team and make an impact by leveraging machine learning and demand forecasting to drive data-driven decisions and optimize our business operations.


**What's on the Menu?**
As a **Staff Data Scientist**, you will be a technical leader on demand forecasting team. You will design, build, and test statistical and machine learning models to accurately predict demand from our retailers. Additionally, you will review the junior team members output to ensure best practices have been implemented. The models you build will be deployed into a production setting where your models will drive value across all our brands. You will provide updates and results to the business on the progress of your work while partnering with the business users to identify modeling opportunity areas.


**Key Ingredients:**
* Utilize your strong analytical skills and machine learning expertise to develop advanced time-series models for demand forecasting.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define business problems related to demand forecasting.
* Conduct exploratory data analysis and feature engineering to extract valuable insights from complex datasets.
* Work in tandem with the Global Data Science Lead and North America Lead to create a roadmap for EMEA Demand modeling
* Develop and implement machine learning algorithms to optimize demand forecasting accuracy and efficiency.
* Evaluate and fine-tune models by applying statistical methods and running experiments on real-world data.
* Monitor model performance and proactively identify opportunities for improvement and optimization.
* Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and through data visualization techniques.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in machine learning and demand forecasting techniques, and apply them to enhance our forecasting capabilities.

**Recipe for Success: if it sounds like you!**
* Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field. PhD is a plus.
* 5+ years experience with predictive modeling time-series, machine learning, statistical modeling
* Experience building demand forecast models
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and R, as well as libraries like scikit-learn
* Solid understanding of data engineering principles
* Extensive knowledge on factors that influence shipment demand
* Proficient in SQL and working with relational databases.
* Experience using cloud-based services such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think critically about complex business challenges.

**We hope to find you a seat at our table!**


Location(s)
Amsterdam, London – The Shard

  



**Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Underrepresented Ethnic Minority Groups/Women/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity and other protected classes****.**

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Company Description**  

Avery Dennison Corporation (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science and digital identification solutions company that provides a wide range of branding and information solutions that optimize labor and supply chain efficiency, reduce waste, advance sustainability, circularity and transparency, and better connect brands and consumers. Our products and solutions include labeling and functional materials, radio frequency identification (RFID) inlays and tags, software applications that connect the physical and digital, and a variety of products and solutions that enhance branded packaging and carry or display information that improves the customer experience. Serving an array of industries worldwide — including home and personal care, apparel, general retail, e-commerce, logistics, food and grocery, pharmaceuticals and automotive — we employ approximately 35,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Our reported sales in 2023 were $8.4 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com.

**Avery Dennison is an equal opportunity employer.**  

Please let us know if we can support you with reasonable accommodations throughout the application process by contacting our team via Requestaccomodation@eu.averydennison.com.

 **Job Description** **ABOUT YOUR ROLE:**

**The Data Scientist will be joining the European Materials Group Finance team and will work on some of the most interesting and challenging business problems, with the goal to to drive better business insights, improve efficiency and unlock value for our customers. In this role you will interact with business leaders across functions and engage the business in data-driven debates.**

**You will utilize your skills and experience to systematically answer questions using data to provide actionable recommendations. You will commonly utilize advanced statistical analysis and machine learning techniques. You will be responsible for modeling complex problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. A successful candidate will have demonstrated experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations, such that they can efficiently and effectively develop solutions to a broad array of use cases.**

**YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:**

* **Interpreting and analyzing data using exploratory mathematic and statistical techniques based on the scientific method**
* **Formulating and leading guided, multifaceted analytic studies against large volumes of data**
* **Coordinating research and analytic activities utilizing various data points unstructured and structured and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data**
* **Analyzing problems and determining root causes**
* **Translating complex results into simple, clear conclusions and visualizations**
* **Explaining sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner**
* **Defining company data assets, data models, and jobs to populate data models**
* **Working closely with all European business units and cross functional teams to develop future models with the ability to link results to business processes**
* **Coordinating with Data Engineers to build data environments providing data identified by Knowledge Managers and Analysts**
* **Experimenting against data points, providing information based on experiment results and providing previously undiscovered solutions to command data challenges**

 **Qualifications** **WHAT WE WILL BE LOOKING FOR IN YOU:**

* **Bachelor’s, Master’s degree (preferred), or other advanced degree required in computer science, business analytics, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or other data centric discipline**
* **4+ years of relevant industry work experience providing advanced analytics solutions, with a focus on Forecasting based models.**
* **Proficiency with one or more programming languages: Java, NodeJS, Python, R**
* **Knowledgeable in some Cloud and Big Data technologies, such as Microsoft Azure, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Google Cloud Platform, Apache Spark**
* **Analytics skills: descriptive statistical modeling & algorithms, machine learning algorithms, modeling dataset building, optimization, data visualization, pattern/cluster/segmentation analysis, predictive analytics, Analytics tools and Technologies like Qlikview, Cognos, Visual Basic, Apache, Oracle, SQL, GraphQL, NoSQL**
* **Exceptional record of academic achievement, professional accomplishment, project management, and leadership**
* **Passion for building and comfort working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)**
* **Advanced analytical knowledge of data, ability to conduct big data analysis, data conditioning experience, programming advanced computing skill**
* **Additional experience in core analytic methods such as predictive modeling and customer and product segmentation/clustering**
* **Business sense: Basic knowledge of finance, manufacturing and commercial business processes and ability to translate business needs into data and explain complex concepts in an understandable manner**
* **Project lead experience of cross functional teams is strongly preferred**

 **Additional Information** **We offer:**

* Attractive salary package
* Workplace & work hours flexibility
* Structured learning and development / Mentoring program
* International environment
* Events such as International Women’s Day, Earth Day, etc.
* A growing and welcoming team with good spirit!

**Who we are! - Our Story:**

**Every voice. Every day!** **Eight Values****. One Team!**


Being open to every voice, every day, brings our value of diversity to life and makes Avery Dennison a vibrant and engaging place to be. We understand diversity and equal opportunities as enrichment for our future-oriented work. Across our diverse, global team, every voice makes us stronger. When we listen to and learn from each other, there is no limit to what we can achieve together. Each of us is unique, and we appreciate bringing together different personalities and talents.


Avery Dennison is an equal-opportunity employer. In the **EMEA region**, we have these **Employee Resource Groups**:

* **EmpoWer** - focusing on the engagement, mentoring, and promotion of women
* **Mental Health** - striving to provide a safe space for employees to discuss mental health issues in the workplace
* **Unite** - supporting the LGBTQI+ and ally community in the EMEA region


To find out more about **all our employee resources groups globally** as well as our **Diversity, Equity & Inclusion** approach, please go to our Diversity and Inclusion pages in the About Us section of our website: https://www.averydennison.com/en/home/about-us/diversity-and-inclusion.html


At Avery Dennison, we do what we love, and we love what we do - Just click here, and get to know us better: **Life @ Avery Dennison** (linkedin.com/company/avery-dennison/life/emea)
