title: Data Scientist
description:
Do you want to make impact in our digital transformation within Supply Chain? We have an opportunity for you as an Enterprise Data Scientist in our Global Digital Supply Chain team.

  


Wat we vragen


* Can do mentality, hands-on, challenging the current state, growth mindset, persistent, emphatic
* You have a broader view than just your position and you can identify with our purpose ‘Nourishing by Nature’.
* You are customer focused and are able to act with speed and decisiveness to achieve the best results.
* You take responsibility for your work and are continuously looking for new opportunities to make a change.
* Bachelor/Master education or equivalent.
* +4 years of experience as Data Scientis or in a similar role;
* Experienced knowledge in other related field such as statistics, math, computer science, or economics.
* Experience working with supply chain data and systems
* Knowledge of statistical techniques and data visualization tools.
* Analytical skills and proficiency in data wrangling and analysis tools such as SQL, PowerBI, and Excel
* Conceptual thinker, focusing on next step, next gen
* Internationally oriented and excellent communication and influencing skills;
* Capabilities in Project/Portfolio Management
* Capable of effective stakeholder management at various levels within RFC;


Wat we bieden


* Unique company culture of Dutch heritage and international presence
* We offer great work life balance, and competitive salary & benefits package so you can enjoy it
* Workweek of 38 hours, competitive pension scheme, holiday allowance of 8%, end year allowance 4%, bonus scheme, flexible working hours and the ability to work from home.
* Diverse training and mentoring programs to help you grow on your own professional journey
* Exceptional support of cross disciplinary movement within the company to broaden your knowledge and growth paths
* A friendly and informal working environment, yet professional team members as sparring partners
* Autonomy and trust to create longer term impact that helps bring better nutrition to the world
* Free cheese and milk at lunch in the central office, and barista coffee to help you go through your working days with a lot of joy


Vacaturetekst
We are looking for an Enterprise Data scientist in our Digital Supply Chain Team. In this role you:

* Develop digital tools for our business to enable improvements of our business
* Operate in a challenging landscape of End-to-End Supply chain while tasked to optimize, simplify and standardize our processes by digitalization.
* Use your analytical and statistical methods to identify patterns, trends, and insights from data that can be used to improve business performance.


You will be part of our Global Digital Supply Chain team, consisting of ten teammembers. The purpose of this team of to effectively leverage the power of digital capabilities and solutions to improve Service, Cost and Cash in the Global and End-to-End Supply Chain.


Bij FrieslandCampina geloven we in een werkomgeving waar iedereen zich hun volledige en authentieke zelf kan voelen en in hun kracht wordt gezet om het beste uit zichzelf te halen. We omarmen elkaars verschillen en ontvangen graag je sollicitatie, ongeacht je geslacht, geloof, afkomst, seksuele voorkeur, leeftijd, beperking, of nationaliteit. Als wie wij zijn bij jou past, moedigen we je aan om te solliciteren, ook als je niet zeker weet of je aan alle eisen voldoet.
Ons team
Zie alle collega's op LinkedIn
Want to work with one of the largest dairy companies in the world with the head quarter located in Amersfoort? Here we work with multidisciplinary disciplines to make a real difference in the lives of millions of people by providing the very best nutrition. Fulfilling our purpose, better nutrition for the world, requires great efforts from many people. We believe that people as diverse as our nutritional offerings – including and not limited to gender, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religious belief, nationality, social background, disability and thinking style – enrich our lives and strengthen our business.


About our team and office:

* A multidisciplinary team — highly skilled, focused on making our best work together
* A friendly environment — with wonderful cafeteria, free milk, cheese and Lattiz coffee
* Easily accessible — close to central station and with private parking spaces


Contact


Anke Brink


anke.vandenbrink@frieslandcampina.com
company_description: We're bigger than milk and more than a piece of cheese. Every day we work hard to make a difference in the lives of millions of people. Bring your spark. Join us. Grow with us. #UnleashYourNature

title: Senior Project Manager Communications - focus on leadership and strategy communication
description:
Do you agree that great leadership communications about strategic themes is one of the most interesting areas in our field of work?


Do you like complex communication projects that are relevant for colleagues worldwide? Is using your knowledge of and experience with reputation management and the Reptrak model your second nature?


Does your job give you energy when communication topics require strategic thinking combined with thorough expertise, craftsmanship, cooperation, coordination and a proactive, practical, hands-on approach?


Then this role as Communications Expert & Project Manager at our global Communications & Corporate Affairs (CCA) department could be yours!

**You and your job**


In this role within the global Communications and Corporate Affairs department, your projects centre around leadership, executive and strategy communications. That way you contribute to worldwide strategic alignment and to our reputation as a cooperative bank.


Together with your colleagues you are responsible for realizing regular CEO and Managing Board updates to global leaders and all employees. You will translate complex content into easy to understand, meaningful storylines that are globally consistent and locally relevant. You develop great content while smoothly managing processes and stakeholders. As you are an expert in bringing the Rabobank strategy to life, you are the linking pin between strategic messaging of the Managing Board and our global communications communities.


At the same time, you will develop a data-driven leadership and executive communications approach and planning for the year ahead. Always in close cooperation with the other support staff of the Managing Board. Expertise and creativity come into play when improving on existing formats and adding the latest innovative developments in communication to the mix. On top of this, you are always open to kick-start and deliver on the occasional special strategic projects.

**Your contribution**

* Strengthen and protect Rabobank’s reputation through leadership communications
* Be a trusted advisor for Board Members and their business managers / teams
* Contribute to internal strategic alignment and engagement by turning senior leaders and employees into ambassadors of the Rabobank strategy
* Realize high-quality communication assets and continue to improve based on data-driven insights
* You help build a strong worldwide communications community around the Rabobank strategy to leverage our impact

**Facts & Figures**


* Department of +/- 60 experienced colleagues
* Communication colleagues in 37 countries
* Managing Board of 8

**Top 4 responsibilities**


In collaboration with colleagues:

* Run (and improve) leadership communications and link it to the global comms community
* Support Executives and their teams with regard to strategic (internal) communications
* Help align content for internal leadership events
* Inspire colleagues with your practical approach and knowledge incl. reputation management

**Together we achieve more than alone**


We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people’s different perspectives is what makes us an even better Bank. We are curious to learn what you can bring to the Corporate Communications and Affairs (CCA) department.

*A colleague: “Our Communications & Corporate Affairs department is responsible for strengthening Rabobank’s brand and reputation. We are a strategic sounding board and advisor for our 40,000+ colleagues. We challenge them to seize opportunities and are their eyes and ears in society. We show, both inside and outside Rabobank, what we stand for as a cooperative and help our colleagues achieve the bank’s ambitions. Our communications department profiles, positions, connects, facilitates, inspires, surprises, and puts issues on the agenda in a positive way.*


The CCA department consists of the following sub-teams: Corporate & Internal Comms, Public Affairs, Media Relations, Branding, Content Hub. With you on board as a Communications Expert & Project Manager, the Corporate & Internal Communications team will have around 10 colleagues.

**You and your talent**


* Relevant university degree or equivalent;
* Relevant experience (7+ years) in a demanding communications environment. 3+ years of experience with leadership communications in another multinational is a must;
* Knowledge of and experience with reputation management and the Reptrak model
* Excellent communications craftsmanship (writing, presenting, scripting, presentations, visualization, social etc.);
* Result and output oriented; self-starting;
* Great project management skills;
* Organizational and political sensitive;
* Fluent in English and Dutch.

**This is what we offer you**


* a salary in the range of € 6.155,29 up to € 8.793,26 gross per month (scale 11, depending on knowledge, education and experience);
* a thirteenth month and vacation pay;
* an Employee Benefit Budget (11% of your monthly income). How you use this budget is up to you. Think, for example, of buying extra holiday time, an extra deposit in your pension or even having this budget paid out to you every month


This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Communications Expert & Project Manager based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on https://rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment

**You and the job application process**


Reply to the vacancy for Communications Expert & Project Manager at Rabobank before 25th of June.

* Any questions about the job content? Contact Leonoor Koole via Leonoor.koole@rabobank.nl
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Rebecca Stumpel, Recruiter via Rebecca.Stumpel@rabobank.nl.
* We may hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.

title: Senior Project Manager Communications – Focus on strategic HR, innovation and organizational change communication
description:
Do you agree that the combination of communications and Human Resources is one of the most exciting opportunities in our field of work?


Do you want to help drive engagement and strengthen and protect Rabobank’s reputation when it comes to ‘being a great place to work’ and ‘being ready for the future’.


Is using your experience with reputation management and the Reptrak model your second nature?


Does your job give you energy when communication topics require strategic thinking combined with thorough expertise, craftsmanship, cooperation, coordination and a proactive, practical, human-centric approach?


Then the role as Communications Project Manager at the global Communications and Corporate Affairs (CCA) department could be yours.

**You and your job**


In this role at CCA, your focus will be on strategic HR communications, including comms around innovation and organizational change. Internal branding is close to your heart. That way you contribute to our worldwide reputation as a cooperative bank and a great place to be.


You will be the linking pin between CCA and CHRO comms, while also aligning strategic innovation themes. Together with colleagues in the CCA, HR and IT domain, you lay out overarching communications strategies, develop yearly data-driven communications plans (including internal branding), and are responsible for the execution.


You translate complex content into easy to understand, meaningful storylines that are globally consistent and locally relevant. You develop great assets while smoothly managing processes and stakeholders. Creativity comes into play when improving on existing formats and adding the latest developments in communication to the mix.


You work closely together with your HR comms colleagues. In case of issues regarding HR topics, you are a trusted advisor to the CHRO and will take a leading role in communications toward the Rabobank business lines and domains, and coordinate execution.


You proactively see opportunities for external and internal communications on HR and innovation related topics to strengthen our reputation.


At the same time, you will take responsibility to kick-start and coordinate the communications around strategic organizational change projects. And you are actively involved in our own department and will help build the broader communications function through your knowledge and expertise when it comes to reputation management and internal branding. This is a diverse and dynamic role with a lot of responsibility.

**Your contribution**

* Contribute to Rabobank’s reputation as a cooperative bank, a great place to be and innovation
* Collaborate with CHRO Internal Comms team to realize Rabobank’s HR strategy and drive employee engagement
* Help build a strong communications community worldwide to leverage impact

**Facts & Figures**

* Department of +/- 60 experienced colleagues
* 40,000+ Employees world-wide
* Communication colleagues in 37 countries
* Managing Board of 8
* 9+ Million customers around the world

**Top 4 responsibilities**

* In collaboration with your colleagues, design overarching communication strategies and year plans, that tie together strategic HR themes, innovation and internal branding and drive their execution.
* Be a trusted advisor to the Internal Comms teams of CHRO and CITO,
* Be a trusted advisor to other senior leaders on communications around organizational change
* Inspire colleagues with your practical approach and knowledge, incl. reputation management

**Together we achieve more than alone**


We believe in the power of difference. Bring together people’s different perspectives is what makes us an even better Bank. We are curious to learn what you can bring to the Corporate Communications and Affairs (CCA) department.

*A colleague: “Our Communications & Corporate Affairs department is responsible for strengthening Rabobank’s brand and reputation. We are a strategic sounding board and advisor for our 40,000+ colleagues. We challenge them to seize opportunities and are their eyes and ears in society. We show, both inside and outside Rabobank, what we stand for as a cooperative and help our colleagues achieve the bank’s ambitions. Our communications department profiles, positions, connects, facilitates, inspires, surprises, and puts issues on the agenda in a positive way.*


The CCA department consists of the following sub-teams: Corporate & Internal Comms, Public Affairs, Media Relations, Branding, Content Hub. With you on board as a Communications Expert & Project Manager, the Corporate & Internal Communications team will have around 10 colleagues.


CHRO Rabobank is at the forefront of adapting to the Future of Work. They achieve this by embracing new methods and technologies, as well as through their agile internal organization, where HR, IT, and Communication experts collaborate within a single domain. Additionally, CHRO Rabobank is recognized for its Rabo@Anywhere policy and commitment to incorporating Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DE&I) in all aspects of their operations. Read more: HR - Rabobank

**You and your talent**


Professional collaboration, Customer focus, Problem solving, Change agility and Storytelling are Rabobank skills that are clearly essential for this role.


You are a strong team player, with an international mindset. A strategic, data-driven thinker with a practical and hands-on mentality. Your organizational sensitivity is highly developed, and you are at ease when moving around in politically sensitive settings. In addition, it is important that you recognize yourself in the checklist below:

* Relevant university degree or equivalent;
* Relevant experience (7+ years) in a demanding communications environment. 3+ years of experience with strategic HR communications and reorganizations in another multinational is a must;
* Ability to advise senior leaders;
* Knowledge of and experience with reputation management and the Reptrak model
* Excellent communications craftsmanship (writing, presenting, scripting, presentations, visualization, social etc.);
* Result and output oriented; self-starting;
* Great project management skills;
* Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to influence without authority;
* Team player and trusted advisor to senior management;
* Fluent in English and Dutch.

**This is what we offer you**


* a salary in the range of € 6.155,29 up to € 8.793,26 gross per month (scale 11, depending on knowledge, education and experience);
* a thirteenth month and vacation pay;
* an Employee Benefit Budget (11% of your monthly income). How you use this budget is up to you. Think, for example, of buying extra holiday time, an extra deposit in your pension or even having this budget paid out to you every month


This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Communications Project Manager based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on https://rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment

**You and the job application process**


Reply to the vacancy for a Communications Project Manager at Rabobank before 25th of June.

* Any questions about the job content? Contact: Leonoor Koole via Leonoor.koole@rabobank.nl
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Rebecca Stumpel, Recruiter via Rebecca.Stumpel@rabobank.nl.
* We may hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.

title: Postdoc Trustworthy Human-AI Interaction for Media and Democracy (m/f/x)
description:
Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica (CWI) has a vacancy in the Distributed & Interactive Systems (DIS) research group for a

  

**Postdoc on the subject of Trustworthy Human-AI Interaction for Media and Democracy (m/f/x)**


We are looking for a talented postdoc who is interested in trustworthy and transparent human-AI interactions, in the context of news media and journalism.


A 2-year fixed-term full time Postdoc position is available at the Distributed & Interactive Systems (DIS) research group at CWI. This project is a collaboration between CWI and the AI, Media, and Democracy (AIMD) lab in Amsterdam. You will be working under the supervision of Dr. Abdallah El Ali and Prof.dr. Pablo Cesar, where you will be embedded within the AIMD lab.


**Job description**
-------------------


The AI, Media and Democracy (AIMD) ELSA Lab’s aim is to set up an experimental space and testbed for novel ways of applying AI in the media. Journalists, media professionals, designers, citizens, researchers and public and societal partners bring in their challenges in using AI in the media. The lab investigates how AI-driven applications in the media change the public sphere, civic engagement and economic competition, and explores novel ways of applying AI in the media. The Distributed & Interactive Systems (DIS) research group at CWI combines data science with a strong human-centric, empirical approach to understand the experience of users. This enables us to design and develop next generation intelligent and empathic systems. We base our results on realistic testing grounds and data sets, and embrace areas such as ubiquitous and affective computing, human-centered multimedia systems, and human-AI interaction.


Encounters with AI-generated content can impact the human experience of algorithms, and more broadly the psychology of Human–AI interaction. In particular, AI system disclosures can influence users’ perceptions of media content. There is a growing concern that as generative AI becomes more widely used, manipulated content could easily spread false information. As a key step toward mitigating harms and risk, a key recent mitigation effort involves the European Al Act Proposition “Transparency Obligations for Providers and Users of Certain AI Systems and GPAI Models”, which seeks to address the issue of AI system transparency.


The research scope broadly addresses the effective, trustworthy, and transparent communication of AI system disclosures. We aim to account for ethical and legal considerations, design and human factors perspectives, as well as policy recommendations. As such, this role may involve relevant stakeholders where necessary, ranging from media organizations, policy makers, as well as AI researchers and practitioners. The initial focus is on the end-user (media consumer) perspective, and at later stages, on the perspective of the media organizations and the generative AI media production process itself. For this postdoc, we are specifically interested in how trust in AI systems can be garnered by focusing on creating better user interfaces and/or understanding human-AI system interactions at a cognitive, behavioral, and physiological level. By establishing user-centric designs for transparent AI disclosures, we can take steps toward ensuring a well-functioning democratic society.


We expect the postdoc researcher to be embedded within the AI, Media, and Democracy lab, which is located in Amsterdam’s city center.


**Topics of interest include:**


* Intelligent visualization techniques, adaptive user interfaces (UI), and content personalization, that allows tailoring users’ experience of the UI and media content as well as any associated disclosures and/or explanations
* User behavioral and physiological sensing techniques for human-AI interaction, that can help predict the right balance between information overload and the essential information to be communicated to users to build user trust in systems employing generative AI
* Developing and evaluating novel user interfaces for journalism that incorporate meaningful disclosure mechanisms for generative AI, from news production to audience engagement, to ensure user agency and autonomy
* Designing and evaluating explainability interfaces for journalists and editors working with AI to ensure responsible decision making
* Empirical studies (online and/or lab-based) to understand the relationship between AI disclosures and how people perceived AI content, for both users and media organization

**Requirements**
----------------


Depending on the specific topic of interest, candidates are required to have completed their PhD in computer science, human-computer interaction, industrial design, cognitive science, or a related field. We specifically seek candidates with a strong interest in physiological sensing and signal processing, information visualization, and/or human-centered AI. Ideally, the candidate has worked already on topics related to the social, ethical, or information presentation aspects of AI in the media sector. Candidates are expected to have publications in top HCI venues such as CHI, CSCW, UbiComp / ISWC, IEEE Vis, FAccT, IUI, or related venues.


Needed qualifications for candidates include proven research talent, strong technical background, and good academic writing and presentation skills. Candidates are expected to have an excellent command of English.


**Terms and conditions**
------------------------


The terms of employment are in accordance with the Dutch Collective Labour Agreement for Research Centres ("CAO-onderzoeksinstellingen"). The gross monthly salary for an employee on a full time basis, depending on relevant work experience, ranges from € 4.218 to € 5.141. The appointment will be for a period of two years.


Employees are also entitled to a holiday allowance of 8% of the gross annual salary and a year-end bonus of 8.33%. CWI offers attractive working conditions, including flexible scheduling.


Please visit our websites for more information about our terms of employment:


https://www.cwi.nl/jobs/terms-of-employment and


https://www.nwo-i.nl/en/working-at-nwo-i/jobsatnwoi/


**Information and application**
-------------------------------


All applications should include a detailed resume, motivation letter, and contact details of (at least) three references. For residents outside the EER-area, a TOEFL English language test might be required.


The deadline for the first application round is **1 September 2024.** To apply, use the application button at the end of the job text. Applications will be considered in rounds until the position is filled.


For more information about the vacancy, please contact Dr. Abdallah El Ali (aea@cwi.nl) and Prof.dr. Pablo Cesar (P.S.Cesar@cwi.nl)


CWI encourages a diverse workforce: we endeavour to develop talent and creativity by bringing people from diverse backgrounds and cultures together. We recruit and select based on capabilities and talent. We strongly encourage everyone with the appropriate qualifications to apply for the vacancy, regardless of age, gender, origin, sexual orientation or physical abilities.


**Diversity code**
------------------


CWI encourages a diverse workforce: we endeavour to develop talent and creativity by bringing people from different backgrounds and cultures together. We recruit and select based on capabilities and talent. We strongly encourage everyone with the appropriate qualifications to apply for the vacancy, regardless of age, gender, origin, sexual orientation or physical abilities.


**About CWI**
-------------


Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica (CWI) is the Dutch national research institute for mathematics and computer science and is part of the Institutes Organisation of the Dutch Research Council (NWO). The mission of CWI is to conduct pioneering research in mathematics and computer science, generating new knowledge in these fields and conveying it to trade, industry, and society at large.


CWI is an internationally oriented institute, with 160 scientists from approximately 27 countries, an informal atmosphere and short lines of communication. We have an activity committee that organizes after-work activities and an informal women’s network.


CWI is located at Science Park Amsterdam, the home of AMS-IX, that is presently developing into a major location of research in the physical sciences in The Netherlands, housing the sciences of the University of Amsterdam as well as several other national research institutes next to CWI.


**About Research group**
------------------------


To learn more about the Distributed & Interactive Systems (DIS) research group you can visit our website at:


https://www.dis.cwi.nl/

title: Experienced Full Stack Developer
description:
Experienced Full Stack Developer



At UNStudio.Tools, you’ll be part of compact and dynamic team that values innovation and creativity. We are dedicated to redefining UNStudio’s architectural practice through technology, focusing on user experience and sustainability. Our work environment encourages collaboration and personal growth, ensuring that each team member has a voice and can make a significant impact while growing on their own interest directions.



Full-time · Amsterdam



UNStudio is expanding its tech team with the launch of UNStudio.Tools. To expand our team we are seeking a **Full Stack Digital Developer** that has experience in the entire cycle of product design, from sketch to adoption. This role offers a unique work with a large user base with immediate impact at every stage. We seek someone who brings technology solutions with design sensibility to the table and is eager to test them in a dynamic environment. This is pivotal in blending cutting-edge technology with the creativity of an architectural design practice.


**In this role, you will:**


* Automate design processes and facilitate seamless data exchange to streamline operations.
* Design, develop, and manage products for our internal platforms, which include AI, Knowledge Integration and Design Control
* Engage in design engineering and product development, pushing the boundaries of traditional architectural practices.
* Collaborate closely with multiple stakeholders to ensure our technological solutions meet business and design needs.
* Research and communicate the current Architectural, Engineering, and Construction (AEC) technologies, setting benchmarks within the industry.
* Have a direct impact on the life of over 400 architects around the world.

  



**What we are looking for:**


* Proven ability to take sketches to fully-functional code, ranging both front-end components and back-end systems.
* Strong skills in data visualization, user interface design, and presentation.
* Proficient in TypeScript and database management using MySQL/Postgres. A strong foundation in React and Next is needed.
* Experience with Python and C#; DevOps is highly desirable.
* A knack for basic data analysis and a good sense of integrating design with functionality.
* Excellent communication skills and a collaborative spirit.


**Your experience:**


* Minimum 4 years of experience in software development with a focus on both front-end and back-end systems.
* Experience in participating in the full lifecycle of projects, from inception to delivery.
* Experience in designing and implementing user interfaces and data visualization tools.
* Experience working in a team.


**Your qualifications:**


* A degree or a valid program in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field. A master’s degree is preferred.
* Additional certifications in relevant technologies (e.g., React, Python, DevOps) can be advantageous.


**The necessary skills:**


* Proficient in TypeScript and React for front-end development.
* Experienced with Next.js for server-side rendering.
* Knowledge of database management systems, specifically MySQL and PostgreSQL.
* Familiarity with Python and C#


**The nice-to-have skills:**


* DevOps skills, including continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD), containerization (e.g. Docker), and cloud services (e.g. AWS, Azure).
* Familiarity with additional programming or scripting languages is a plus.


**Why UNStudio**



We offer competitive salaries, comprehensive benefits, and are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. While ideally looking for full-time applicants, we are always open to outstanding talent, regardless of working hours preference.



Here’s what we offer:


* This position is based at our Amsterdam office, with the option for hybrid working arrangements.
* A creative, professional, and academic working environment.
* A young, international team comprising over 30 nationalities.
* A dedicated learning budget to support your professional development.
* Legendary Summer and Winter Events.
* 30 annual holidays plus a holiday allowance on top of your salary.


**Apply Today**



We are excited to see how you can contribute to UNStudio.Tools and help us innovate the future of architecture. to join our team of forward-thinkers and industry leaders.

title: Sales consultant customer experience (CX) solutions
description:
De CX-propositie van Capgemini stelt onze klanten in staat om hun relaties met hun klanten te transformeren en waardevolle ervaringen te creëren, zowel voor hun eindklanten als voor hun eigen organisatie. Ben je geïnteresseerd in een internationale omgeving en wil je samen met ons de CX-diensten van Capgemini verder ontwikkelen en verbeteren? Lees dan verder en ontdek of de rol van sales consultant iets voor jou is.

Jouw mogelijkheden als functietitel bij Capgemini

Bij Capgemini helpen we onze B2B- en B2B2C-klanten met het bevorderen van hun sales door diepgaande kennis van verkoopactiviteiten, verkooptrajecten en de behoeften van moderne kopers. We begrijpen dat verkooporganisaties de juiste strategie moeten aanpassen en ontwikkelen om de optimale buyer’s journey te bieden. Onze oplossingen zijn gebouwd op een geïntegreerd platform, mogelijk gemaakt door onze wereldwijde partners Salesforce, Microsoft, Pega en SAP, waardoor de beste klantervaringen worden gecreëerd. Als CX sales consultant ben je verantwoordelijk voor: * Het introduceren van het CX-portfolio op de Nederlandse markt * De focus op concrete oplossingen die we samen met onze partners kunnen aanbieden * Het delen van kennis van het Capgemini CX-portfolio met interne teams, klanten, partners en op social media * Het presenteren en positioneren van het CX-portfolio op de zakelijke markt * Het identificeren van kansen en het definiëren van een go-to-market (GTM) strategie in samenwerking met het CX sales team * Samenwerken met onze partners om een pijplijn te ontwikkelen en deze om te zetten in concrete sales deals Je kunt ook ingezet worden op strategische opdrachten bij ons klanten.

Je thuisbasis bij Capgemini

Samen met onze partners beschikken wij over een global CX expertise om de beste oplossingen te kunnen bieden aan toonaangevende klanten. Wij werken samen met meer dan 2500 solutions experts, 3000 ervaren front-end professionals en 2000 experts in data science, AI & visualization.

Benefits

* Direct een contract voor onbepaalde tijd * Een goed gevulde koffer met vakantiegeld én genoeg tijd (26 dagen) om het uit te geven. Zin in een extra lange vakantie? Koop dan dagen bij. * Een leaseauto of NS-businesscard. Of kies voor uitbetaling van je mobiliteitsbudget met kilometervergoeding als je je eigen auto rijdt. * Happy hybride werken met onze connectiviteitsvergoeding. Een premievrij pensioen. *

Waarom past deze vacature bij jou?

Binnen Capgemini werken wij veel samen en wij zoeken naar kandidaten die ons daarin versterken. Je hebt goede kennis van wat er speelt op het gebied van customer experience technologie en je kunt daarover op senior niveau adviseren. Wij bedoelen hiermee onder andere: (Digital) Sales, CRM platforms (Salesforce Sales Cloud, Microsoft Dynamics, SAP CRM, CPQ-platforms). Daarnaast denken wij aan: * Bachelor of master diploma * Tenminste 8 jaar ervaring opgedaan in IT consultancy, bij een digital agency en/of in het domein van CRM/sales * Expertise in het adviseren op basis van businesscases met technologie als essentieel onderdeel van de oplossing * Een strategische denker en ervaring binnen grotere verkoop afdelingen van organisaties * Toont initiatief en ondernemerschap richting de markt door het ontwikkelen van bestaande- en nieuwe klanten op het gebied van Customer Experience Goede kennis van de Engels en Nederlands taal *

Get the future you want

Die belofte doen wij aan jou. Dat begint al op dag één. Met een goede onboarding en gestructureerde en transparante groeipaden. Maar ook: volop mogelijkheden om daarvan af te wijken, zelf te pionieren en je eigen weg te kiezen. Daarbij kun je van onze kant rekenen op grenzeloos vertrouwen én collegiale support. Werken bij Capgemini betekent ook werken in het internationale hart van de innovatie. De eredivisie van de technologie. Een werkgever met oog voor jou en het vizier op de toekomst, waarin duurzaamheid en diversiteit en inclusie de hoofdrollen spelen.
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Our employees talk trash all day, every day.**


**That’s why we love them!**

  


Orbisk employees **do** talk trash a lot. To be more precise, they discuss reducing food waste in the hospitality industry. How does the Orbi work in practice? Waiters scan cleared plates at Orbisk hardware stations, and our algorithms throw themselves on the leftovers to determine when ingredients were thrown away and in what quantity. Food for (actionable) thought because if we – for example – discover that guests aren’t into tomatoes but devour every last spec of avocado, restaurateurs can source smarter, reducing food waste and costs. We’ve already helped eliminate a whopping 737.520 kg of food waste, and we’re just getting started!

  

**As our Data Analyst,** you'll step into the role of our groundbreaking 'data detective' - the nickname we made up for the analyst who transforms complex data into clear, actionable insights for our product. Partnering with our Data & AI team, you will be responsible for transforming complex data sets into user-friendly insights that drive strategic decision-making and operational efficiency.


Additionally, we invite you to use your expertise to improve our data usability and enhance overall data quality. We want Orbisk to become a well-known name in the global hospitality business, and we believe you can help us achieve that goal.

  

**Our Product: The Orbisk Dashboard**  

Our product is a data-rich dashboard that shows all the waste registered by one or multiple of our Orbi’s. We can slice and dice this data in many different ways. As you can imagine, one Orbi registering waste is quite straightforward, but as we grow we now face the challenge of customers with increasingly complex environments, like waste from more than 200 different Orbis in different locations, time-zones, currencies and other (cultural) differences.



In this role, you'll become an expert in the data collected by the Orbi food waste monitor. You will frequently participate in food waste coaching sessions with our customers, assisting the Orbisk coaches in understanding customer data to maximize the value we can extract for them. Besides addressing hands-on data requests, you will also be responsible for systematically identifying common patterns in how customers successfully utilize the provided data. You will then translate these insights into new features that enhance our product's effectiveness. Do you feel like you are ready to bite down into this great international data challenge?

  

**The role in 6 bullets**

  

* Analyze data from multiple Orbi's to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for waste reduction.
* Develop and maintain intuitive, data-rich dashboards that provide clear insights into food waste metrics.
* Work closely with our product owner, developers, and other stakeholders to implement data-driven solutions.
* Continuously seek ways to improve data collection, analysis processes, and reporting accuracy.
* Conduct user research to understand the needs and behaviors of our clients, ensuring our data solutions are aligned with their goals.
* Propose and implement innovative data analysis methodologies and tools to enhance our service offerings.

 **Your track record mentions**

  

* You've been in the data game for 3+ years.
* Masters or bachelors degree in a technical field, such as data science or computer science.
* The magic, or ability to convert questions or requirements into comprehensive data reports, dashboards, or other data solutions.
* Thorough and meticulous approach to understanding data nuances, complexities, and the necessity for accurate reporting.
* You're a "masterchef" when it comes to data analysis frameworks and tools such as SQL, Python, dashboarding solutions, and data visualization.
* Big plus: experience with data-heavy products, where extracting value from data requires innovation beyond standard reporting and dashboarding.

  


**Why join Orbisk?**



For a whole menu of reasons. Some lofty (reducing food waste also reduces our collective CO2 and H2O footprints), others more down-to-earth. After all, joining a scale-up that disrupts an entire industry is also just plain fun. And a great conversation starter. Especially if that team is as driven and adventurous as ours. We also offer you:

  

* €4.500 - €6.000 gross p/m (depending on knowledge and experience)
* Pension scheme and 30 paid vacation days (based on 40 hours per week)
* Company laptop and €250 netto home office budget per year
* Education & Alleo budget, and a travel allowance
* Free office lunch and an office dog to keep you company
* An office based in Utrecht and option to work partly remote
* A young and creative startup work environment that invests in your development
* A close-knit team with smart, enthusiastic colleagues who are happy to share their expertise with you. And on Fridays, a (non-alcoholic?) beer or two.

 **Get to know us**



We can’t wait to tell you more about our plans. Reach out by clicking on that apply button or contact Doğu Colak via Whatsapp +31 6 38711496.

title: Geospatial Data Scientist Internship – Urban Heat
description:
**About the program:**  

The Ross Center for Sustainable Cities builds on WRI’s global and local experience in urban planning and mobility and uses proven solutions and action-oriented tools to make the fast-growing urban environment more resilient to new challenges. The Urban Development Program is committed to designing and influencing urban spaces that build resilience, improve health, and equitably connect people and opportunities. As part of the Data For Cool Cities Initiative , our data team is developing geospatial datasets, analytics and tools to support urban decision makers in implementing cooling infrastructure for reducing population exposure to extreme heat.
**Internship Highlight:**  

Reporting to the Data Product Manager of the Cities Data team, you will contribute to the development of urban heat analysis and datasets that can support European and Global South cities in addressing extreme heat challenges.  

You will participate in identifying, documenting and collecting heat-related datasets specific for European context, conduct geospatial data analysis for understanding the spatial distribution and severity of urban heat in different cities, produce statistical analysis and maps for estimating the cooling impact of heat-resilient infrastructure (tree cover, shade, water bodies etc). **What you will do:**


In this role, you will:

* Collect, document, clean and analyze geospatial data for better assessing urban heat stress in different European Cities (Land Surface Temperature, Air temperature, tree canopy, urban population distribution, urban infrastructure...)
* Perform data analysis on existing data, and support research for identifying alternative data sources (specific for European context) and calculating geospatial indicators
* Develop spatial analysis and produce static and interactive maps for addressing use cases identified by our stakeholders: identifying urban hotspots, mapping priority areas for implementing cooling infrastructure, estimating cooling benefits of various cooling interventions scenarios, estimating population exposure to extreme heat
* Document methodology and communicate finding and insights with the data team
* Contribute to blogs, data visualization and other communication products
  

Your internship supervisor will be the Data Product Manager based in the Hague, NL, and you will work closely with the wider data team led by the Global Manager of Cities Data & Tools team based in Washington, DC.**What you will need:**

* Confident use of Python and/or R
* Familiarity with Geographic Information Systems (GIS), spatial analysis tools (QGIS, Google Earth Engine, Carto etc) and geospatial libraries (rasterstat, xarray, shapefile, geopandas, sf, rasterio, gee etc)
* Familiarity with working with geospatial datasets (satellite imagery, climate data, census, urban features etc) and geospatial data formats (both raster and vector data)
* Familiarity with statistics and geo-statistics concepts and methods
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to document methodology
* Currently pursuing a degree in GIS, Geo-information and earth observation computer science, data science, computational urban planning, quantitative geography, environmental modelling
* Must be registered in a study program with a Dutch college or university for the full duration of the internship
* You are proficient in verbal and written English
**Conditions of the internship:**

* This is a 6 month internship with a start date of 16 September 2024.
* This internship will be based at the WRI Europe office in The Hague with some flexibility to work from home.
* This internship offers a reimbursement of 700 euros per month based on full-time working hours (32 hours per week).
**How to apply:**  

Please submit a resume and cover letter by 21 July 2024 . Applicants must apply through the WRI Careers portal to be considered. You are encouraged to link to any relevant blogs, projects or other pieces of work that demonstrate your suitability for the internship.  

**About Us:**  

Founded in 1982, World Resources Institute (WRI) is an independent, nonprofit global research organization that turns big ideas into action at the nexus of environment, economic opportunity, and human well-being. We are working to address seven critical challenges that the world must overcome this decade to secure a sustainable future for people and the planet: climate change, energy, food, forests, water, sustainable cities, and the ocean. WRI has a global staff of over 1,800 people with work spanning 60 countries. We have offices in Africa, Brazil, China, Europe, India, Indonesia, Mexico, Colombia and the United States, as well as a growing presence in other countries and regions.  


The foundation of our work is delivering high-quality research, data, maps, and analysis to solve the world’s greatest environment and international development challenges and improve people’s lives. We work with leaders in government, business, and civil society to drive ambitious action and create change on the ground. Equally important, we bring together partners to develop breakthrough ideas and scale-up solutions for far-reaching, enduring impact.
**Our mission and values:**  

WRI’s mission is to move human society to live in ways that protect Earth’s environment and its capacity to provide for the needs and aspirations of current and future generations.  

Our values are shared ideals that bind us together: Integrity, Innovation, Urgency, Independence, Respect.  

  

**Our culture:**  

WRI is committed to advancing gender and social equity for human well-being in our mission and applies this principle to our organizational and programmatic practices. We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment, we embrace all diversity and encourage women, the LGBTQ+ community, persons with disabilities, Afro-descendants, and Indigenous people to apply. Recognizing our strong commitment to gender equality, WRI has also been awarded EDGE certification.  

Our team carefully reviews all applications.
company_description: WRI’s mission is to move human society to live in ways that protect Earth’s environment and its capacity to provide for the needs and aspirations of current and future generations.

title: Business Insight Manager, Central and Northern Europe (CENE)
description:
Location: The Hague, Netherlands
Job reference: R-201733
Date posted: 06/07/2024
**This is what you will do:**


The Business Insight Manager will be responsible for quantitative and qualitative analytics providing product, patient and customer knowledge information across the CENE Area (Central and Northern Europe). The position will interact closely with the Commercial Excellence Team, as well as Netherlands Sales and Marketing Team.


The position will be based at Alexion Den Haag Office, Netherlands.

**You will be responsible for:**

**Business Insights Generation**

* Gather together key outputs and trends from Market Researches, feeding the results with insights and recommendations to support decision-making, identify market trends, and improve competitiveness.
* Develop a set of analysis to dive into the data and highlight business insights useful and relevant to internal stakeholders like emerging sales and market trends, common behaviors of customers
* Proactively lead generation of analysis and insights on all the therapeutic areas, presenting key findings to function leads and leadership
* Optimize existing reports improving usability and structure with a long term focus, leveraging the existing technology (i.e. PowerBI)
* Coordinate GBS (Global Business Support) team to update, develop and monitor CENE Area reporting tools (i.e. Power-BI dashboards)
* Create innovative dashboards by using advanced statistical and visualizing tools (Geographical visualization of performance, interactive graphs and dashboards…) that supports business decisions for the Sales and Marketing
* Run standard periodic reports (sales trend, report on Field force Activity, coverage of customer target and frequency of visits…)
* Support Sales Incentive Plan development and execution

**Customer Relationship Management**

* Create and support implementation of CRM Tools for all Sales Lines associated with new and existing products (via Veeva CRM)
* Maintain correct functionality of the CRM reporting systems and ensure good quality of data stored into them. Manage autonomously the troubleshooting of the system (correct bugs, monitor reporting on status, manage recovery and temporary plan for long term resolutions)
* Design and conduct local CRM training for new employees. Plan and deliver update sessions when necessary.
* Collect improvement requests from users and manage appropriate system updates with EMEA and Global team.

**You will need to have:**

* Fluent in both English and Dutch
* 3+ years analytical and reporting experience; preferably in Pharma Industry and/or Management Consulting Industry
* Advanced knowledge of the following tools and programs:
	+ Microsoft Excel
	+ PowerQuery and PowerBi
	+ CRM systems, including SalesForce and Veeva
	+ Microsoft Power Point
	+ SAP Business Intelligence Suite
* Strong experience using technology to work efficiently with large datasets such as scripting and statistical software packages
* Strong writing and oral presentation skills
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and deal with multiple functions and stakeholders
* Experience in modelling and dashboard preparation
* Ability to work independently, subject matter expert in its field
* Ability to gain cooperation of others, conducting presentations of technical information concerning specific projects
* Good team player with strong interpersonal skills
* Motivated and able to demonstrate initiative

**We would prefer for you to have:**


University Degree preferably in Statistics, Economics, Finance, Engineering or Computer Science


AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We comply with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements.
company_description: Alexion has focused its product development programs on anti-inflammatory therapeutics for diseases.

title: Manager, People Analytics
description:
At Genmab, we’re committed to building extra[not]ordinary futures together, by developing antibody products and pioneering, knock-your-socks-off therapies that change the lives of patients and the future of cancer treatment and serious diseases. From our people who are caring, candid, and impact-driven to our business, which is innovative and rooted in science, we believe that being proudly unique, determined to be our best, and authentic is essential to fulfilling our purpose.
Join Our Team as a Workday Reporting Manager!
We are excited to invite applications for the position of Workday Reporting Manager to become a vital part of our People Analytics team within Global HR Operations.  

About the Role:
As a Workday Reporting Manager, you will support ongoing business-as-usual reporting requirements and assist with internal Workday-related projects, including testing and documentation. You will collaborate closely with the HR Data Manager and external AMS consultants to enhance our reporting strategy, suggest improvements, and build new reports and dashboards as needed. Beyond Workday analytics, you will work with BI tools and serve as a business analyst, bridging the gap between stakeholders and consultants.  

Key Responsibilities:
Your primary responsibilities will include:* Overseeing the end-to-end request process for new reports and modifications to existing ones, including requirement gathering, prioritization, testing, and delivery.
* Managing AMS Consultants, ensuring regular progress check-ins and providing business context while challenging technical solutions when necessary.
* Developing and maintaining reporting across all Workday modules, such as Human Capital Management (HCM), Recruitment, Payroll, Time, and Absence.
* Maintaining the global reporting catalog, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of available reports and user access.
* Creating and utilizing all necessary Workday calculated field functions.
  

Additional duties include managing complex projects from start to finish, collaborating with the HR Data Manager to promote data governance and enhance data quality and insights, and providing HR Reporting and Analytics to key stakeholders, including HR Business teams, Talent, Reward, Payroll, and Finance. You will develop a suite of monthly HR reports and metrics, build reporting dashboards, and respond to ad-hoc HR reporting requests.  

Requirements:* Bachelor’s degree with 5+ years of HR/HR Systems experience.
* At least 3+ years of proven experience in HRIS reporting/Workday, working with advanced, matrix, and composite reports.
* Strong understanding of the Workday security model, with the ability to navigate complex intersection-based security setups for reporting solutions.
* Experience with Workday Prism or Adaptive Insights is desirable.
* Experience within an HR discipline is desirable but not essential.
* Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Power BI or similar.
* Ability to work with both structured and unstructured data.
* Strong stakeholder management, influencing, and organizational skills.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Self-motivated, with the ability to plan and deliver work independently.
* Strong project tracking skills, including involvement in enhancements and upgrades.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality, discretion, and attention to detail.
  

Important Note:
A Workday Certificate is a mandatory requirement for this role.  

If you are passionate about delivering reliable and accurate information through innovative HR reporting solutions and have the skills and experience, we're looking for, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to be a part of our dynamic team!  

About You* You are passionate about our purpose and genuinely care about our mission to transform the lives of patients through innovative cancer treatment
* You bring rigor and excellence to all that you do. You are a fierce believer in our rooted-in-science approach to problem-solving
* You are a generous collaborator who can work in teams with diverse backgrounds
* You are determined to do and be your best and take pride in enabling the best work of others on the team
* You are not afraid to grapple with the unknown and be innovative
* You have experience working in a fast-growing, dynamic company (or a strong desire to)
* You work hard and are not afraid to have a little fun while you do so


Locations
Genmab leverages the effectiveness of an agile working environment, when possible, for the betterment of employee work-life balance. Our offices are designed as open, community-based spaces that work to connect employees while being immersed in our state-of-the-art laboratories. Whether you’re in one of our collaboratively designed office spaces or working remotely, we thrive on connecting with each other to innovate.
About Genmab
Genmab is an international biotechnology company with a core purpose guiding its unstoppable team to strive towards improving the lives of patients through innovative and differentiated antibody therapeutics. For more than 20 years, its passionate, innovative and collaborative team has invented next-generation antibody technology platforms and leveraged translational research and data sciences, which has resulted in a proprietary pipeline including bispecific T-cell engagers, next-generation immune checkpoint modulators, effector function enhanced antibodies and antibody-drug conjugates. To help develop and deliver novel antibody therapies to patients, Genmab has formed 20+ strategic partnerships with biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies. By 2030, Genmab’s vision is to transform the lives of people with cancer and other serious diseases with Knock-Your-Socks-Off (KYSO™) antibody medicines.
Established in 1999, Genmab is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark with locations in Utrecht, the Netherlands, Princeton, New Jersey, U.S. and Tokyo, Japan.
Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion
We are committed to fostering workplace diversity at all levels of the company and we believe it is essential for our continued success. No applicant shall be discriminated against or treated unfairly because of their race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, or genetic information. Learn more about our commitments on our website.
Genmab is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy. Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with your application on our website https://www.genmab.com/privacy.
Please note that if you are applying for a position in the Netherlands, Genmab’s policy for all permanently budgeted hires in NL is initially to offer a fixed-term employment contract for a year, if the employee performs well and if the business conditions do not change, renewal for an indefinite term may be considered after the fixed-term employment contract.
company_description: Genmab is an international biotechnology company with a core purpose of improving the lives of people with cancer and other serious diseases.
ceo_name: Jan G. J. van de Winkel, Ph.D.,

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
At TBAuctions, we are committed to driving our online auction platform using data. We aim to understand the key drivers, measure our performance, predict future trends, and initiate improvements and innovations based on our insights. To achieve this, we need to enable data-driven decision making in all layers of the organization by translating raw data into clean, consumable data models as well as generate enthusiasm for and understanding of this data with business stakeholders.


As an **Analytics Engineer** you sit between a data analyst and data engineer by having the skills to optimize data transformations while applying domain knowledge to create data set to accelerate and enable analysis and insights.

**This is what you will do:**
-----------------------------

* Collaborate with various teams in strategy, operations, finance and technology for a better understanding of the business processes and tools to parse and translate the underlying business logic
* Accelerate data analysis and insights by creating clean, transformed data and maintaining data documentation and definitions
* Empower business users to answer their own questions by training them on how to use this data and data visualization tools
* Apply data modeling best practices to the organization's data
* Apply software engineering best practices to analytics code

**What you will bring**
-----------------------

* 5+ years of tabular modeling and tooling (ideally star schemas and DBT) experience
* Ability to communicate with the business to understand processes and tools and translate this into business logic
* Skilled at transforming raw data into a wealth of opportunities.
* Expertise in SQL, including the use of window functions, UDFs, self-joins, and other complex SQL functionalities.
* Knowledge and experience with a visualization tool (ideally Power BI) and setting up data models for users to create their dashboards
* Experience in balancing speed and accuracy and managing stakeholders in this area

**Bonus Points:**
-----------------

* Affinity with e-commerce
* Focus on delivering value
* Interest in contributing to data pipelines that transform unstructured raw data into tables ready for analysis

**What we offer you**
---------------------

* Independent and varied role within an entrepreneurial and innovative organization
* Salary of 65.000,- - 80.000,-
* Good pension scheme
* Bonus scheme (up to 1 gross monthly salary per year)
* 25 vacation days
* Laptop and iPhone
* Training opportunities
* Working in a fun team of professionals

**This is TBAuctions**
----------------------


Nothing of value should be lost


In a world where overconsumption is a threat, TBAuctions finds it important to extend the life of products as long as possible. So, nothing of value should be lost. Our online intelligent auction platform makes this happen. By using data and a smart system we match supply and demand of used industrial products. Together with our auction brands (Troostwijk Auctions, Klaravik, Auksjonen, British Medical Auctions, PS Auction, Vavato and Epic-Auctions) we bring sustainable trade to a higher level. With buyers and sellers all over the world millions of products are auctioned every year.


Auctioning is trendy and the way to buy and sell. We are fascinated by technology, with a love for user-friendliness and the drive to preserve value. Do you share this drive and do you want to work for a company that has the ambition and the firepower to become the largest online auction platform in Europe? Apply for this vacancy!

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Amsterdam -** Als data scientist in het data- & innovatieteam bouw je innovatieve modellen en methoden om inzichten te vergaren in de verhalen die kranten en tijdschriften bij DPG Media maken en wat gebruikers daarmee doen.  

  

**Over het team**  

Het Data- & Innovatieteam van de afdeling Redactionele Inzichten & Groei helpt redacties met inzichten uit data om hun doelen te bereiken. Het team bestaat uit data scientists, -engineers en -analisten en werkt voor alle redactionele media van DPG Media. Dagelijks werkt dit team o.a. met de miljoenen pageview events die plaatsvinden op onze media, zoals AD, HLN, Nu.nl, De Volkskrant, Donald Duck, Libelle en meer.
  

  

**Wat ga je doen?**  

Wat ga je doen? In deze rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het bedenken en uitwerken van innovatieve data science methoden om het werk van redacties te verbeteren. Bijvoorbeeld door large language models te finetunen op onze artikelen om het sentiment of de complexiteit van de teksten te bepalen. Ook kun je een voorspelmodel maken om te begrijpen waarom mensen bepaalde stukken wel of niet uitlezen. Verder:


* is er overleg met redacties en redactie-analisten over hun voornaamste wensen en vertaalt dat naar data science-oplossingen
* je stemt met de data engineers af welke data je nodig hebt en hoe die data georganiseerd moeten zijn
* begeleid je redactie-analisten die met jouw modellen aan de slag gaan zodat ze dit op een verantwoorde en waardevolle manier kunnen inzetten
* houd je je continue op de hoogte van ontwikkelingen op het gebied van generative AI of andere state of the art technologieën zodat je je daartoe kunt verhouden en over kunt adviseren binnen het bedrijf
* je denkt graag mee over verbeteringen en innovaties en helpt jongere collega’s met begeleiding en feedback
* je zit er in voor de lange adem: je werkt aan langetermijnprojecten die zorgen voor duurzame groei
* adviseer je de afdeling redactionele inzichten en groei over de data science strategie en prioriteiten

  

  

**Wij bieden**


* marktconform salaris afhankelijk van kennis en werkervaring;
* reiskostenvergoeding;
* een uitdagende functie o.b.v. 36 uur, waar jij veel ruimte krijgt om te bouwen en waarde toe te voegen voor DPG Media;
* 8% vakantiegeld en 4% persoonlijk budget, wat naar eigen inzicht kan worden besteed;
* jaarlijkse winstdeling o.b.v. de prestaties van DPG Media;
* ruimte voor ontwikkeling d.m.v. trainingen, cursussen en andere opleidingsmogelijkheden.
* flexibele werktijden en werklocaties met kantoren in Amsterdam, Rotterdam en Antwerpen

**Jouw profiel**


* je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met het ontwikkelen en finetunen van data science modellen
* Je hebt ervaring in python en sql
* een gezonde kritisch blik op data en spreekt je uit over mogelijke vertekeningen in de data(modellen) die van belang zijn
* het onderhouden van contact met stakeholders (zoals journalisten) of het geven van presentaties is voor jou geen probleem
* je bent nieuwsgierig naar de mogelijkheden die generative AI bieden voor het werk van data scientist en bereid dit verder te onderzoeken
* hebt affiniteit met media en staat er voor open om het werk van redacties beter te leren kennen
* je beheerst de Nederlandse taal

Als hét grootste mediabedrijf van Nederland staan we open voor alle talent in de maatschappij. Wij roepen kandidaten met een diverse achtergrond in de breedste zin van het woord dan ook op om te solliciteren op deze functie. Juist door de verschillen tussen collega’s ontstaan verrassende inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen. En dat past dan weer heel erg goed bij ons als organisatie. We zijn benieuwd wie jij bent en welke kwaliteiten en ervaring jij meebrengt.  

  

**Word jij binnenkort onze nieuwe collega? Solliciteer dan nu!**  

Eerst nog wat meer weten? Ik beantwoord graag je vragen via **leonie.lugtenberg@dpgmedia.nl**


*Wij doen graag onze werving zelf en wensen niet samen te werken voor de invulling van deze rol*  

  

***Nog meer redenen om bij DPG Media te willen werken***  

Bij DPG Media werken we voor meer dan 90 sterke nieuwsmerken, magazines, televisieprogramma’s, radiostations en online services zoals Qmusic, NU.nl, Tweakers, Libelle, VTM en meer. We bereiken maandelijks ruim 90% van de Nederlanders en 8 op de 10 Vlamingen.  

  

We bieden je een professionele werkomgeving waarin we vrijheid enorm belangrijk vinden. We geven je alle ruimte om aan je toekomst te werken door het aanbieden van workshops en trainingen. Voel je vrij om bij ons ondernemer, leerling en teamspeler te zijn, en vooral om jezelf te zijn. Bij DPG Media is iedereen welkom. Dus solliciteer, wat je achtergrond ook is. Er staan ruim 5.500 slimme collega’s te popelen om je op te nemen in een team, of dat nou een projectteam, een pubquizteam of een sportteam is.  

  

*Ontdek* *wat wij je te bieden hebben* *of leer onze* *tech organisatie kennen**! En, als je toch bezig bent, vind je ons ook op* *LinkedIn* *en* *Twitter**.*

title: Media- en publieksvoorlichter
description:
Functieomschrijving
-------------------


  
Het belangrijkste onderdeel van je werk is het beantwoorden van vragen van zowel interne als externe gebruikers. Dit doe je in teamverband.  

Het pakket van werkzaamheden dat door de Infoservice en Persdienst wordt verricht is veelzijdig. Je gaat onder meer het volgende doen:


* Beantwoorden van vragen van de media en gebruikers van statistisch materiaal.
* Bemensen van diverse loketten, waaronder de infoservice en persdienst.
* Geven van interne en externe voorlichting over beschikbare indexcijfers, het gebruik van Statline en open data.
* Verrichten van logistieke handelingen t.b.v. de persdienst.
* In contact brengen van journalisten met woordvoerders.

  
Functie-eisen
-------------


  
Ben jij iemand die gemakkelijk kan wisselen tussen taken? Heb je ook de volgende kwaliteiten:


* Aantoonbaar mbo/hbo werk- en denkniveau.
* Circa drie tot vijf jaar werkervaring in een soortgelijke functie.
* Kennis van statistieken, indexeringen en statistische begrippen.
* Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden.
* Daarnaast heb je de wil en het vermogen om je te ontwikkelen tot vraagbaak voor in- en externe klanten.

  
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
------------------


  
* Salarisniveau schaal 8, schaal 9
* Salarisomschrijving
Voor onze arbeidsvoorwaarden volgen wij de CAO Rijk.


	+ Een salaris van minimaal EUR 3246,- en maximaal EUR 4868,- bruto per maand op basis van 36 uur. De inschaling is afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring.
	+ Je ontvangt 8% vakantiegeld en een 13e maand. In totaal is dit 16,50% bovenop je salaris waarbij je zelf bepaalt hoe, wanneer en op welke wijze je deze wilt inzetten. Dit noemen wij het Individueel Keuze Budget (IKB).
	+ Je bouwt pensioen op bij het ABP Pensioenfonds.
	+ Je werkt hybride waarbij we als richtlijn hebben minimaal 2 dagen per week op kantoor. In je team maak je daarover afspraken.
	+ Je krijgt een laptop (Microsoft of Apple) en mobiele telefoon (Android of iOS).
* Maandsalaris Min €2.945 – Max. €4.440 (bruto)
* Dienstverband Arbeidsovereenkomst voor bepaalde tijd met uitzicht op onbepaalde tijd
* Contractduur 12 maanden
* Minimaal aantal uren per week 36
* Maximaal aantal uren per week 40

  
Overige arbeidsvoorwaarden
--------------------------


  
Naast het salaris ontvang je een Individueel Keuzebudget (IKB). Het IKB bestaat uit geld (16,37% van je bruto jaarsalaris) en tijd. Met het IKB maak jij de keuzes die bij jou passen en kun je een deel van je arbeidsvoorwaarden zelf samenstellen. Je kunt er bijvoorbeeld voor kiezen om een deel van je maandinkomen te laten uitbetalen wanneer jij dat wenst. Ook kun je dit budget omzetten in verlof en andersom of besteden aan fiscaal vriendelijke doelen. De Rijksoverheid hecht sterk aan persoonlijke groei en loopbaanontwikkeling en biedt daarvoor tal van mogelijkheden. Tot de secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden behoren onder meer verschillende studiefaciliteiten, bedrijfsfitness, volledige vergoeding van je OV-reiskosten woon-werkverkeer en gedeeltelijk betaald ouderschapsverlof.


  
**Meer over jouw toekomstige afdeling**
---------------------------------------



De afdeling Infoservice en persdienst bestaat uit 6 collega’s. Zij leveren informatie aan de pers en mensen die telefonisch of via mail vragen stellen over wat het CBS te bieden heeft. Ook bieden zij hulp bij het gebruik van StatLine. De collega’s zijn dol op hun werk, maar ze hebben ook hun eigen hobby’s of eigenaardigheden.  

Goltan is een echte Harry Potterfanaat, Monique zit het liefst bij haar man achter op de motor, Ferry loopt dit jaar zijn twaalfde Nijmeegse Vierdaagse, Nico voetbalt elke zaterdag fanatiek, Astrid is fervent knutselaar en Anna is meester van de woordgrappen.



**Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek**
--------------------------------------



Het CBS is een innovatieve kennisorganisatie, die voortdurend nieuwe technologien en ontwikkelingen toepast om de kwaliteit van de gegevens en de onafhankelijke positie te blijven borgen.



In een samenleving waarin informatie explosief toeneemt, is het vrij kunnen beschikken over betrouwbare en integrale data cruciaal. Het CBS levert als ht statistische bureau van Nederland met betrouwbare statistische informatie en data inzicht in maatschappelijke vraagstukken. Daarmee voedt het CBS het maatschappelijk debat, de beleidsontwikkeling en de besluitvorming en draagt zo bij aan welvaart, welzijn en democratie.



Het CBS onderzoekt zo ongeveer alles wat voor onze samenleving van belang is. Of het nu gaat over economische groei en consumentenprijzen of criminaliteit of vrije tijd. Op basis van onze onafhankelijke en betrouwbare informatie worden belangrijke beleidsbeslissingen genomen in Den Haag en in Brussel. Provincies, gemeenten en bedrijven, maar ook individuele burgers hebben belang bij de uitkomsten van onze onderzoeken.



Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek
**Contact**
-----------

### **Voor meer informatie over de sollicitatieprocedure:**



**Hilda Folkerts**
